您的 AI 文件分析師
2025/8/27 下午3:29:35
Hi, Google IT Automation 專家， 我將會把課堂上專家的講稿貼在這邊，你會用繁體中文協助我分類重點並補充說明，讓我充分理解課程內容。 第一堂如下： Working in IT is more than just a job, it's a career path. Research shows that the field of IT support is a launchpad for future career growth and better wages. In fact, a study on the subject was recently conducted by the Harvard Business School, Accenture, and Burning Glass entitled Bridge the Gap. It found that among today's middle skill jobs which require training but not a formal college degree, IT support offers clear pathways to prosperity. We saw this phenomenon play out here at Google in our IT support program. Those who pushed themselves to learn how to code in Python typically saw strong career growth. They built skills that are critical to accessing higher level positions in the IT field and after honing those skills through hard work and determination, they advanced into more technical IT support specialists, systems administrators, technical solutions engineers, and even site reliability engineers. The common thread across all of these roles is knowing how to write code to solve problems and automate solutions. By expanding your toolbox to include coding skills, you open a window into the world of systems management that can lead you towards more advanced technical roles down the line. Python in particular is having a huge surgeons According to the 2019 Stack Overflow developer Survey, Python is the coding language most people want to learn, the second most loved by those who already know IT, and the fourth most popular overall. So why take this program to learn how to code in Python? Well, first, it's geared towards people who are already in or aspiring to be in the field of IT. Maybe you're thinking bigger about your current IT role and want to work towards managing operations at scale. Or maybe you're just starting out and looking to break into the IT industry. Perhaps you've taken our IT Support Professional Certificate program on Coursera already. Or you have equivalent IT support knowledge with basic computing skills like working with files and directories, familiarity with networking concepts and understanding how to install software on your computer. In any case, this program is tailor made for you. Second, this program offers three hands-on methods of teaching coding in Python and automation, Codeblocks, Jupyter notebooks and Quick Labs. And third, we've assembled an awesome group of Googlers who will serve as your instructors in each course. They all started their careers in IT support, then learned programming and moved on to more technical roles. Like me. We can't wait to share our stories with you and how we use Python in our day to day. And hey, I should probably introduce myself. My name is Christine Rafla and I'm a systems administrator at Google. I will be your instructor in this course. This program has been entirely designed and developed by Google and we Even filmed each course at different cool Google spaces. It'll introduce you to the Python programming language with a special focus on how this language applies to automating tasks in the world of IT system support and administration. I'm super excited to be here with you. When I was younger, I had no idea that careers in IT even existed. There are a lot of reasons I wanted to participate in the certificate program, but one of my biggest motivations is that I want to see more women represented in the industry. I remember going to a system administration summit where there were hundreds of men and about three women that were sysadmins. A lot has changed since then, but there's still so much we can do to bring new ideas and representation into the IT field. That's why I want to share my knowledge with as many people as possible. I love my job and I love the people I work with because they make it easy to ask for help and offer their guidance. This type of support network allows our team and ultimately our industry to be more successful. I understand from experience that it can feel pretty intimidating and maybe even a bit scary to learn a coding language. Just remember, everyone started where you are right now with the first command, the first script, and of course the first of many errors. When I started out in my career, I strived to get everything perfectly right the first time I tried it, but that actually slowed down my progress. So don't be afraid to make mistakes. It will give you a leg up. So let's get down to it. What's ahead? The program begins with a crash course in Python where you will learn to write simple programs and understand their role in automation. Next, we'll get more hands-on focus on how Python interacts with the operating system. After that, we'll cover how to use Git and GitHub to manage versions of your code. Then we will focus on troubleshooting and debugging techniques to find and solve the root cause of problems in IT infrastructure. The next course covers automating at scale, where you will learn to deploy configuration management on a fleet of either physical or virtual machines running in the cloud. And last up, we will bring all this knowledge together and complete a final project designed to solve tasks that you might encounter in real world IT settings. Bonus, you can post your projects to GitHub to show off your fancy new skills to employers or friends, or both. Phew, that was a lot to rattle off. Are you excited or what? This all star team was brought together to guide you on your adventures in coding. You're in very good hands. Okay, I think that's everything. 以下將課程內容分類並補充說明，幫助你充分理解重點：

1. IT 支援作為職業發展的跳板

  • 重點：IT 支援不僅是一份工作，更是通往更高職位和更好薪資的起點。
    • 研究顯示，IT 支援是[中階技能工作]（需培訓但無需大學學歷）中，能明確帶來職業成長的領域。
    • 例如：Google 的 IT 支援計畫中，學習 Python 的學員通常能晉升為更高階的技術角色（如系統管理員、技術解決方案工程師等）。
  • 補充：Python 是關鍵技能，能幫助自動化解決問題，並開啟系統管理的大門。

2. Python 的重要性

  • 重點：Python 是 IT 領域的熱門語言。
    • 根據 2019 Stack Overflow 調查：
      • 最多人想學習的語言。
      • 第二受 IT 從業者喜愛的語言。
      • 總體排名第四的語言。
  • 補充：Python 的應用廣泛，特別適合自動化 IT 任務（如系統管理、腳本編寫）。

3. 課程設計與目標

  • 重點：課程專為 IT 從業者或想進入 IT 領域的人設計。
    • 三種教學方式：
      1. Codeblocks：基礎編程練習。
      2. Jupyter Notebooks：互動式學習。
      3. Quick Labs：實作演練。
    • 課程內容：
      1. Python 速成班（基礎編程與自動化）。
      2. Python 與作業系統互動。
      3. 使用 Git 和 GitHub 管理代碼版本。
      4. 疑難排解與除錯技巧。
      5. 大規模自動化（雲端配置管理）。
      6. 最終專案（解決真實 IT 問題）。
  • 補充：完成專案後可上傳至 GitHub，展示技能給雇主或朋友。

4. 講師團隊與經驗分享

  • 重點：講師均為 Google 員工，從 IT 支援起步並晉升為技術角色。
    • 講師介紹：
      • Christine Rafla（系統管理員）：課程主講，強調女性在 IT 領域的代表性。
      • Roger Martinez（Linux 系統管理員）：教授 Python 與作業系統互動。
      • Kenny Sulaiman：教授 Git 和 GitHub。
      • Amanda Belos：教授疑難排解與除錯。
      • Phelan Vendeville：教授大規模自動化與雲端配置。
  • 補充：講師們鼓勵學員不怕犯錯，因為錯誤是學習的一部分。

5. 學習心態與支持網絡

  • 重點：學習程式語言可能令人卻步，但支持網絡很重要。
    • 講師分享自身經驗：初期追求完美反而拖慢進度，犯錯才能進步。
    • Google 的團隊文化強調互相幫助，這對行業成功至關重要。

總結

這門課程不僅教授 Python 和自動化技能，更提供一條清晰的 IT 職業發展路徑。透過實作和講師的經驗分享，學員能快速掌握關鍵技能並應用於實際工作中。

如果有任何疑問或需要進一步解釋的部分，歡迎隨時提出！

If you work in IT, computer programming skills open up an incredible amount of opportunity. Being able to write scripts and programs that tell your computer to perform a task equips you with an invaluable tool. Not only does it make your work easier and more efficient, it can help you grow faster and advance further in your IT career. But how do you even start to learn a programming language like Python? How do you recognize when to tell a computer to perform a task? How do you then write a program to actually get your computer to complete the task you want it to do? The thought of learning to write a program in Python can make you feel a whole bunch of emotions, excitement, anticipation, that feeling of wanting to dive right in and get going, and also fear. You might ask yourself, can I really learn how to code or do I have it in me? I'm here to tell you, yes, you can absolutely do this. Learning how to program can be scary and intimidating, but at the same time it's really fun and really exciting. In coding, as in life, if we're going to get philosophical, the most rewarding work is usually a bit challenging, but ultimately well worth the effort. Of course, I'm able to say all this from experience, especially the cheesy parts. My name is Christine Rafla. I am a systems administrator at Google, and I'm going to be your instructor and guide in this course. The role of a sys admin can vary a lot from company to company, and even within different teams in the same company. I happen to work in the corporate identity and access management operations team, which is a really long way of saying that we make sure that everyone is represented correctly, and if they need to access certain resources, they can. What I love the most about being a sys admin is that the role has so many diverse functions. We handle loads of unique problems and edge cases. From tinkering with different systems to collaborating with other teams, I am always learning something new, so it's really hard to get bored. It all starts with knowing how to automate. If you're an IT support specialist, a systems administrator, or in a role somewhere in between, knowing how to get computers to do the hard work for you will set you apart from others in similar IT roles and make your life much easier. Think about it. Would you rather manually deploy 100 computers on your own or tell your computer to do it all for you all at once? No-brainer, right? Having a coding skill set can help you grow into more specialized roles like a systems administrator, cloud solutions engineer, DevOp specialist, site reliability engineer, or who knows, maybe even web developer or data analyst. The point is, being able to write a program is an essential tool in your IT toolkit, and more and more employers are looking for these skills in the people they hire. If you've ever learned a new skill like playing a musical instrument, speaking a foreign language, knitting, or skateboarding, you know that getting good at something new requires a lot of practice. For me, I love to learn new languages, and I'm proud to say I speak Spanish, Arabic, French, and I even know 10 words in Russian. Our world is shaped by the words and the languages we speak. While some words may be unique to one language, you can always find similarities that help you learn and understand. Being able to connect the dots between cultures allows me to see things others might not. Sounds like this applies to IT programming. My point is, whether you're learning French or Python, it's never easy. You have to start small, learn the basics, and practice those until you master them. Only then can you move on to more complex and impressive stuff, and I'm here to help you along that path, along with my colleagues who you'll meet in later courses. We'll start slow, master the foundations together, and you'll soon be ready for more challenging stuff. Are you wondering why we filmed this course in a cabin on a lake in Canada? The truth is, we're actually in a game room at one of the Google offices in Sunny Vale, California. We chose a different themed office space for each course of the program just to mix things up, and I think I scored with this one. I should warn my manager that I'll be hanging out in this one well after the course ends because it's super comfy. By the end of this course, you'll understand the benefits of programming and IT roles. You'll be able to write simple programs using Python, figure out how the building blocks of programming fit together, and combine all this knowledge to solve a complex programming problem. That's right. By the end of this course, you're going to write a program in Python that's designed to solve a real-world IT problem. Super exciting, right? We'll start off by diving into the basics of writing a computer program. You'll get hands-on experience with programming concepts through interactive exercises and real-world examples. You'll quickly start to see how computers can perform a multitude of tasks. You just have to write code that tells them what to do. Along the way, we'll be talking about automation, which is the process of getting computers to automatically do a task that us humans normally have to do by hand. Now, some of this stuff can get a little complex and confusing. I promise to do my best to make these lessons clear and easy to understand. But if you get stuck at any point, please feel free to rewatch the videos. Practice as much as you like and take the time you really need to understand these topics. The goal of this course isn't to teach you everything there is to know about software engineering because, yikes, that would be a long course. Instead, we're going to introduce you to some of the key concepts of programming and scripting that will empower you to spot opportunities for automation in real life. You're about to learn a skill that can help you take your career to whole new levels. Are you excited? I'm excited, so let's jump in.

以下將課程內容分類並補充說明，幫助你充分理解重點：

1. 程式設計技能在 IT 領域的重要性

  • 重點：掌握程式設計技能（如 Python）能為 IT 從業者帶來巨大的機會。
    • 優勢：
      • 自動化任務，提升工作效率。
      • 幫助職業成長，晉升至高階技術職位（如系統管理員、雲端解決方案工程師等）。
    • 心態調整：
      • 學習程式語言可能令人害怕，但同時充滿樂趣與挑戰。
      • 如同學習新語言或樂器，需要從基礎開始練習，逐步掌握。

2. 為什麼選擇 Python？

  • 重點：Python 是 IT 自動化的核心工具。
    • 應用場景：
      • 自動部署大量電腦。
      • 解決複雜的系統管理問題。
    • 職業發展：
      • 雇主越來越重視程式設計能力，Python 技能能讓你在求職中脫穎而出。

3. 系統管理員的角色與自動化

  • 重點：系統管理員的工作多樣化，自動化是關鍵技能。
    • 講師經驗分享：
      • Christine Rafla 在 Google 負責身份與存取管理，每天處理獨特問題，學習新事物。
      • 自動化能讓電腦完成繁瑣工作，節省時間並減少錯誤。
    • 補充：自動化不僅提升效率，還能讓你專注於更有價值的任務。

4. 課程目標與學習方法

  • 重點：課程設計從基礎到實戰，逐步建立程式設計能力。
    • 學習階段：
      1. 基礎編程：學習 Python 語法與基本概念。
      2. 互動練習：透過實例理解電腦如何執行任務。
      3. 自動化應用：識別現實中的自動化機會並實作。
    • 最終目標：
      • 完成一個解決真實 IT 問題的 Python 程式。
    • 學習建議：
      • 反覆觀看影片，充分練習，不要害怕犯錯。

5. 課程特色與環境

  • 重點：課程在 Google 的創意辦公室拍攝，營造輕鬆學習氛圍。
    • 補充：環境設計旨在激發學習動力，讓學員更投入。

總結

這門課程不僅教授 Python 技能，更強調自動化在 IT 領域的價值。透過基礎學習與實戰練習，你將能夠：

  1. 編寫簡單的 Python 程式。
  2. 理解程式設計的核心概念。
  3. 應用自動化解決實際問題。

學習過程中，保持耐心與好奇心，逐步累積經驗，你將發現程式設計的樂趣與潛力！如果有任何疑問，歡迎隨時提出。

At a basic level, a computer program is a recipe of instructions that tells your computer what to do. When you write a program, you create a step by step recipe of what needs to be done to complete a task and when your computer executes the program it reads what you wrote and follows your instructions to the letter. How nice is that? Play video starting at ::20 and follow transcript0:20 The recipe is written in a code called programming language. Programming languages are actually similar to humans spoken languages since they have a syntax and semantics. Now if it's been awhile since your last grammar class, here's a quick refresher on syntax and semantics. In a human language, syntax is the rules for how a sentence is constructed while semantics refers to the actual meaning of the statements. In English, sentences generally have both a subject, that's a person, place, or thing and a predicate, usually a verb and a statement that explains what the subject is doing. Let's take the sentence, Paula loves to program in Python as an example. In this sentence, Paula is the subject and loves to program in Python is the predicate. To form a sentence that others can understand, you need to know both the syntax that constructs the sentence and the semantics that gives it meaning. The same applies to programming languages. In a programming language like Python, the syntax is the rules for how each instruction is written and the semantics is the effects the instructions have. Much like spoken languages, there are lots of programming languages to choose from. Each has its own history, features, and applications but they all share the same fundamental ideas. So once you understand the basic concepts in one programming language, it becomes much easier to learn another. Lastly, computers always do exactly what they're told. So when you write a program, it's important to be super clear about what you want the computer to do. Learning the syntax and semantics of the programming language you choose will allow you to do just that. Make sense? Before we continue, let's spend a moment on terminology. In the next few videos you'll hear the term script being used a bunch. So what's the difference between a script and a program? The line between the two can be a bit blurry. In this course, we'll use the terms interchangeably. Play video starting at :2:16 and follow transcript2:16 In general, you can think of scripts as programs with a short development cycle that can be created and deployed rapidly. Play video starting at :2:23 and follow transcript2:23 In other words, a script is a program that is short, simple, and can be written very quickly. In this course we'll focus on a specific scripting language called python which we'll use to learn the basics of programming. We'll learn about the python syntax, the rules of how to write a python program, and the semantics or meaning of the different pieces involved. Before we start learning how to code and having you write your first python script, let's talk more about what automation is and why it's useful.
gpt-5-mini

以下將你提供的段落內容分類重點並補充說明（繁體中文、Markdown 格式），幫助你理解[程式、語法/語意、script 與程式碼自動化]的基本概念：

1) 程式（program）是什麼？ — [食譜]比喻

  • 重點：程式本質上就是一份[指令食譜]，描述要完成某項工作所需的步驟，電腦會逐步讀取並精確執行你寫的指令。
  • 補充：
    • 每一行程式碼都是一個明確指令，電腦不會[猜測]你的意圖，只會照字面執行。
    • 因此寫程式時需要把每個細節都明確寫出來（包括邊界情況、錯誤處理等），否則結果可能不是你期望的。

2) 程式語言與人類語言的相似性：語法（syntax）與語意（semantics）

  • 重點：
    • 語法（syntax）：程式語言的[語法規則]，規定如何撰寫正確的語句（像標點、關鍵字、縮排、括號等）。
    • 語意（semantics）：那些語句實際會做什麼（執行效果與結果）。
  • 補充與舉例：
    • 英文句子[Paula loves to program in Python]中，Paula 是主詞（subject），loves to program in Python 是述詞（predicate）。句法正確但語意才決定句子的真正含義。
    • 在 Python 中，語法錯誤（例如漏了冒號、縮排錯誤）會讓程式無法執行；而語意錯誤（logic bug，例如把加法寫成乘法）則會執行但結果錯誤。
    • 因此學程式要同時掌握語法（怎麼寫）與語意（寫了會發生什麼）。

3) 不同程式語言的共通基礎

  • 重點：各種程式語言雖然語法不同，但基礎概念（變數、條件判斷、迴圈、函式、資料結構等）是相通的。
  • 補充：
    • 學會一種語言後，學習第二種語言會比較容易，因為只需適應新的語法與工具鏈，而核心思維已具備。
    • Python 因為語法簡潔，常被當作入門語言來學習這些共通概念。

4) 電腦會[精確執行]，所以要非常明確

  • 重點：電腦只做你明確指示的事，含糊或遺漏都會導致錯誤或非預期結果。
  • 補充：
    • 撰寫程式時要把流程拆成小步驟並明確描述每步要做的事。
    • 在設計時常用[測試]來驗證程式在各種情況下的行為（例如單元測試）。

5) Script 與 Program 的差異（本課程用法）

  • 重點：在課程中，[script]與[program]會交替使用，差別不強調。
  • 補充說明常見區分：
    • script（腳本）：通常指開發週期短、功能單一、易於快速編寫與執行的程式。例如自動化一個重複任務的短程式。
    • program（程式）：一般可指較大型、設計週期長、功能複雜、需要更正式開發流程的軟體。
    • 實務上界線模糊——例如一個複雜的腳本長期演進下來也可能變成完整程式。

6) 為什麼在本課程選 Python 做為教學語言

  • 重點：Python 適合作為腳本與程式語言入門（語法簡潔、社群大、套件豐富）。
  • 補充應用例子：
    • 自動化檔案處理（批次改名、備份）。
    • 自動化系統管理（批次部署、監控腳本）。
    • 與其他系統互動（呼叫命令列工具、操作 API）。

7) 實作學習建議（How to start）

  • 從[小任務]開始：挑選你日常的重複性工作，將其拆成可自動化的小步驟。
  • 先寫[簡單腳本]：以短小、可執行的 script 嘗試自動化一個步驟。
  • 迭代與測試：跑、看結果，發現錯誤再修正（逐步擴充功能）。
  • 注重可讀性與註解：腳本往往會被自己或同事重複使用，清楚的命名與註解會省下很多時間。

如果你想，我可以：

  • 幫你把一個具體重複性任務（例如[批次改名檔案]或[自動備份資料夾]）拆解成步驟，並示範一個簡單的 Python 腳本範例；
  • 或直接給你一個入門練習清單（由簡到難的練習題）與學習順序建議。想要哪一項？
Although we might not realize it, we reap the benefits of automation all the time in our daily lives. Do you ever pay your bills with scheduled payments or use a self-checkout at the grocery store? I always set my coffee machine to start brewing before I've even gotten out of bed. The promise of fresh coffee makes early mornings way easier. Automation is the process of replacing a manual step with one that happens automatically. Take a traffic light, for example, which continuously regulates the flow of vehicles at an intersection. A traffic light requires a human intervention only when it needs repairs or maintenance. The automatic regulation of traffic means that humans don't have to stand at the intersection manually signaling when cars should stop or go. Instead, people can concentrate on more complex, creative, or difficult tasks like focusing on where you're driving. What's more, traffic lights don't get tired, bored, or accidentally display a green light when they meant red. This highlights another benefit of automation, consistency. Let's face it, us humans are flawed and sometimes we make mistakes. A human performing the same task hundreds of times will never be as consistent as a machine doing the same thing. But for all of its advantages, automation isn't a solution for every situation. Some tasks just aren't suited for automation. For example, they may require a degree of creativity or flexibility that automatic systems can't provide. Or for more complicated or less frequently executed tasks, creating the automation may actually be more effort or cost than it's worth. Think about when you get a haircut, what would it take to automate the actions of cutting hair with a machine? The client's height, the shape of their head, their current hair length, and desired hairstyle would all need to be taken into account when designing the automatic system. We need to replicate the creativity and skills of a trained specialist, along with extensive testing to ensure the client's safety and quality haircut. If you've ever had a bad experience at a hair salon, you know quality can be subjective. In this case, the cost and effort of automation just isn't worth the benefits of an automatic haircut would provide, which is why we don't have robot hairstylists. Not too complex. Automation is a powerful tool when used in the right place at the right moment. It can save time, reduce errors, increase consistency, and provide a way to centralize solutions and mistakes, making them easier to fix. Throughout this course and in upcoming ones, we'll be talking about when it makes sense to apply automation and exactly how you do it. Eventually, knowing when and where to use automation will become automatic for you.
gpt-5-mini

以下將你提供的段落內容以繁體中文整理重點並補充說明（Markdown 格式），幫助你理解[自動化的定義、日常範例、優缺點，以及何時應該採用自動化]：

1) 自動化是什麼？

  • 重點：自動化是把人為的手動步驟改成能自動執行的流程，藉此節省人力並提升效率。
  • 補充：在程式設計中，自動化通常由腳本或程式來實現—一段會在特定時間或條件下自動執行的指令序列。

2) 日常生活中的自動化範例

  • 定期自動扣款（scheduled payments）
  • 超市自助結帳（self-checkout）
  • 預先設定好開機時間的咖啡機
  • 交通號誌自動控制車流

這些例子展示自動化如何讓生活更便利，並減少人力介入。

3) 自動化的主要優點

  • 節省時間：讓系統代勞，省下重複性工作時間。
  • 提高一致性與穩定性：機器不會疲倦或分心，能長時間保持一致的行為。
  • 減少錯誤：一旦程式正確，重複執行時出錯機率通常比人工低。
  • 集中管理與除錯：集中化的自動流程較容易追蹤與修正問題。

4) 自動化的限制與不適用情境

  • 需要創造力或靈活判斷的任務（例如理髮、藝術創作），目前難以完全自動化。
  • 成本效益問題：若某任務很少執行或過於複雜，設計 automation 的成本可能高於節省的人力成本。
  • 安全與品質考量：某些情境需大量測試或涉及人身安全，會使自動化不可行或風險過高。
  • 主觀品質難以量化：例如美感、個人偏好等難以用固定規則取代。

5) 決定是否自動化的實務建議（簡易判斷法）

  • 頻率：這個任務多久出現一次？頻繁的任務更值得自動化。
  • 可預測性：任務是否有穩定、可明確定義的步驟與規則？
  • 成本效益：開發與維護自動化系統的成本是否小於長期人工成本？
  • 風險與安全：錯誤自動化可能造成的後果是否可接受？
  • 品質需求：任務是否重視主觀判斷或個人化調整？

若答案偏向[頻繁、可預測、低風險且長期可節省成本]，通常值得自動化。

6) 在 IT 工作中如何應用這些原則

  • 先找出日常重複、耗時且步驟固定的流程（例如批次部署、備份、帳號建立）。
  • 先做 MVP（最小可行自動化）：簡單實作、快速驗證效果，再逐步擴充與強化。
  • 設計可觀察的日誌與錯誤回報機制，方便發現與修正自動化流程中的問題。
  • 評估維護成本：良好文件與測試能降低長期維護的負擔。

總結：自動化是一把強而有力的工具，能在合適的情境大幅提升效率與一致性，但並非萬能。關鍵在於判斷何時適合自動化，並以分段、可測試的方式逐步實作。如果你有想自動化的具體任務（例如自動備份、批次改名檔案、建立使用者帳號流程），我可以幫你評估是否適合自動化並提供實作步驟或範例腳本。想從哪一個案例開始？

Working in IT, a lot of what we do boils down to using a computer to perform a certain task. In your job, you might create user accounts, configure the network, install software, backup existing data, or execute a whole range of other computer-based tasks from day to day. Back in my first IT job, I realized that every day I came into work, I typed the same three commands to authenticate into systems. Those credentials timed out every day by design for security reasons. So, I created a script that would automatically run these commands for me every morning to avoid having to type them myself. Funny enough, the team that monitors anomalous activity discovered my little invention and contacted me to remove it. Play video starting at ::44 and follow transcript0:44 Tasks performed by a computer that need to be done multiple times with little variation are really well-suited for automation. Because when you automate a task, you avoid the possibility of human errors and reduce the time it takes to do it. Imagine this scenario. Your company had a booth at a recent conference and has gathered a huge list of emails from people interested in learning more about your products. You want to send these people your monthly email newsletter, but some of the people on the list are already subscribed to receive it. So, how do you make sure everyone receives your newsletter without accidentally sending it to the same person twice? Well, you could manually check each email address one by one to make sure you only add new ones to the list. Sounds boring and inefficient, right? It could be, and it's also more error-prone. You might accidentally miss new emails or add emails that were already there, or it might get so boring you fall asleep at your desk. Even your automated coffee machine won't help you out there. Play video starting at :1:43 and follow transcript1:43 So, what could you do instead? You could get the computer to do the work for you. You could write a program that checks for duplicates and then adds each new email to the list. Your computer will do exactly as it's told, no matter how many emails there are in the list. So, it won't get tired or make any mistakes. Even better, once you've written the program, you can use the same code in the future situations, saving you even more time. Pretty cool, right? It gets better. Think about when you're going to send these emails out. If you send them out manually, you'll have to send the same email to everybody. Personalizing the emails would be way too much manual work. If, instead, you use automation to send them, you could have the name and company of each person added to the email automatically. The result? More effective emails without you spending hours inserting names into the text. Automating tasks allows you to focus on projects that are a better use of your time, letting computers do the boring stuff for you. Learning how to program is the first step to being able to do this. If you want to get computers to do the work for you, you're in the right place. Earlier in this video, I told you about the first task I ever automated. Now I want to tell you about the coolest thing I ever automated. It was a script that changed a bunch of access permissions for a whole lot of Google internal services. The script traversed a large directory tree with tons of different files, checked the file contents, and then updated the permissions to the services based on the conditions that I laid out in the script. Okay, I admit, I'm a total nerd, but I still think it's really cool. Make sure you read what others are saying. They give you ideas that you haven't even thought of. After that, you're ready to take your very first quiz of the course. Don't worry, it's just for practice.
gpt-5-mini

以下將你提供這段內容分類重點並補充說明（繁體中文、Markdown 格式），幫助你理解[在 IT 工作中識別自動化機會、實際案例與效益]：

1) IT 工作中的常見手動任務

  • 重點：IT 日常包含許多重複性的電腦操作，例如建立使用者帳號、設定網路、安裝軟體、備份資料等。
  • 補充：這些任務常有固定步驟與明確規則，特別適合觀察是否能用程式來自動化。

2) 如何辨識可自動化的任務

  • 重點：重複次數高、變化少、步驟可被明確定義的工作，最適合自動化。
  • 判斷要點：
    • 頻率：是否常常要做？
    • 可預測性：流程是否有明確步驟與規則？
    • 成本效益：寫腳本與維護的成本是否低於長期人工成本？
    • 風險：自動化後出錯的影響是否可控？
  • 補充：日常重複輸入相同命令（如講者每天輸入的三個認證指令）正是自動化的明顯候選。

3) 自動化的實際案例與好處（講者例子）

  • 小案例（認證腳本）：
    • 講者為避免每天重複輸入三個認證指令，寫了自動執行的腳本。
    • 教訓：某些自動化可能衝撞公司安全政策（被監控團隊發現並要求移除），因此在設計時要考量合規與安全審查。
  • 大案例（修改存取權限的腳本）：
    • 講者寫過一個遍歷大量目錄、檢查檔案內容並根據條件更新服務權限的腳本——這類自動化提升效率、可管理大量資源，且非常實用。
  • 好處總結：
    • 節省時間、減少人為錯誤、提升一致性。
    • 可重複使用，提高長期效率。
    • 能自動化個性化（例如在寄送郵件時自動插入姓名與公司等欄位），提高工作品質。

4) 自動化設計時的注意事項

  • 合規與安全：
    • 自動化前應確認公司政策（例如憑證管理、權限變更流程）與安全審查流程，避免產生安全事件或違規操作。
  • 驗證與測試：
    • 在正式執行前先在測試環境或使用小範圍資料驗證腳本行為，避免批量錯誤。
  • 日誌與回滾機制：
    • 設計清楚的日誌（log）與錯誤回報機制，必要時提供回滾（undo）或備份，以便發生問題時能快速恢復。
  • 權限最小化原則（Principle of Least Privilege）：
    • 自動化腳本應以最低必要權限執行，僅授予完成任務所需的權限，降低潛在風險。
  • 文件與可維護性：
    • 撰寫清楚的說明、參數與註解，讓同事或未來的你能容易理解與維護。

5) 實務建議：如何從小處著手自動化

  • 找[小、常、重複]的任務開始（例如：批次新增電子信箱、定期備份、批次改名檔案）。
  • 先做最小可行產品（MVP）：實作最簡單能解決問題的版本，再逐步加入例外處理、日誌、錯誤處理等。
  • 加入測試步驟：先在小樣本或測試環境跑，再逐步擴大使用範圍。
  • 與安全/監控團隊溝通：若腳本涉及憑證或大範圍權限調整，提前取得批准並通報。

如果你想，我可以：

  • 幫你把一個具體工作（例如[大量新增使用者並設定初始權限]或[檢查並移除重複電子郵件]）拆解成可自動化的步驟，並示範一個簡單的 Python 腳本範例；
  • 或針對你現有的一段手動流程，評估是否適合自動化並提供安全性與測試的建議。

你想從哪個實例開始？

下面我將你提供的段落以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理重點並補充說明，幫助你掌握本段落的要旨與實作建議：

1) 課程回饋與學習節奏

  • 重點：小測驗是學習的一環，錯了沒關係；遇到困難就回去複習影片再重做題目，確保理解後再往下學。
  • 補充建議：把每個單元的重點做筆記並定期複習，可提高學習效率與記憶鞏固。

2) 為何選 Python 當教學語言

  • 重點：Python 的語法接近自然語言、易讀易寫，適合初學者快速表達程式意圖與學習基礎概念。
  • 補充：即使完全沒寫過程式，也常能憑直覺猜出程式在做什麼（例如建立朋友名單並依序輸出問候語）。

3) 練習方式與工具

  • 重點：課程一開始用瀏覽器內的 code block 做小練習，隨著進度會用到更複雜的練習工具（例如 Jupyter、Cloud labs 等）。
  • 補充：
    • 練習頻率：建議跟著課程示範逐題練習，並嘗試修改範例以加深理解。
    • 練習範例：從小範例（如迴圈輸出問候語）開始，再逐步做更完整的自動化任務。

4) Python 直譯器（interpreter）是什麼

  • 重點：直譯器是讀取並執行 Python 程式碼的程式；如果把程式比為食譜，直譯器就是把食譜翻譯成實際動作的廚師。
  • 補充：
    • 線上直譯器：初學者可使用線上 Python 直譯器或 code pad 練習，不需立刻在本機安裝 Python。
    • 本機安裝：日後建議在本機安裝 Python，便於大量練習與進階開發；課程後續會示範安裝步驟。

5) 社群互動與延伸練習

  • 重點：課程鼓勵你在討論區分享自己的練習範例與創意作品，這有助於學習與取得回饋。
  • 補充建議：把你做過的練習放到 GitHub（或貼到討論區），一方面作為備份與展示，另一方面也能收到他人建議。

如果你願意，我可以：

  • 提供幾個由淺入深的練習題（含說明與參考解答）給你練習；
  • 或示範如何在瀏覽器上快速執行一段 Python 代碼（包含使用的線上直譯器網址與操作步驟）。
    你想先做練習題還是看線上執行示範？
Remember how we mentioned that Python is simple and easy to use? Python makes it easy to express the fundamental concepts of programming like data structures and algorithms with easy to read syntax. This makes Python a great language to use to learn programming. There are other reasons to pick Python too. Python is super popular in the IT industry, making it one of the most common programming languages used today. Python isn't new. Its first version was released by Guido van Rossum back in 1991. Since then, the community that develops it has grown and the language has advanced a lot. Whenever there's a significant change to the semantics or syntax of the language, a new major version is released. In 2000, Python 2 was released. In 2008, we got Python 3. In this course, we'll use Python 3.7, which came out in 2018. For many years, Python was considered a beginner's language, and was mostly used for teaching concepts or writing very small simple scripts like in this course. But in recent years, the adoption of Python has grown dramatically. One reason for this is that the language has become more powerful. It's also because there's more tools available in Python for a growing range of applications. You can use Python to calculate statistics, run your e-commerce site, process images, interact with web services, and do a whole host of other tasks. Python is perfect for automation. It lets you automate everyday tasks by writing simple scripts that are easy to understand and easy to maintain. That's why Python is the language of choice for lots of people working in IT support, system administration, and web development. Not only that, but it's also used in fast-growing areas of IT like machine learning or data analytics. Last but not least, Python is available for download on a wide variety of operating systems like Windows, Linux, and Mac OS. What's more, Python is so popular in the workplace that if you are currently working in IT you've most likely encountered it already. If you're planning her career in IT, chances are you'll interact with Python quite a bit. So there's a whole lot of reasons for why Python is relevant to today's IT industry. It took a lot of refactoring, debugging, and testing to get it to work. I relied on a lot of my teammates for help and mentorship and wound up spending more time on stack overflow than actually writing the code. Thankfully, you don't have to reinvent the wheel. It's really important to keep in mind that even experienced programmers may need to ask a colleague a question from time to time, or look something up on the Internet. Whether you're a programming novice or have some experience in software development, remember, the best programmers overcome challenges by seeking help or using other resources. You'll find answers to your Python coding questions in the official Python documentation. You can use sites like Stack Overflow to discuss and share with other developers. You can even subscribe to some of the Python mailing lists to keep in the know on the latest updates to the language. You're opening the door to the whole world of programming, and it's super exciting to be joining the development community. The most important thing to remember is that you're never alone. Any questions you may have, any time in your career, there are resources out there to help you find the answers you need. Wow, that was a lot of information. 下面我將你提供的段落以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理重點並補充實用建議，幫助你理解為何選 Python、Python 的歷史與應用，以及學習程式的心態與資源：

1) 為何 Python 適合學程式與自動化

  • 重點：Python 語法簡潔、易讀，能清楚表達程式設計的基本概念（資料結構、演算法等），非常適合作為入門語言。
  • 補充：因為語法接近自然語言，初學者通常能更快理解程式在做什麼，降低學習門檻。

2) Python 的歷史與版本

  • 重點：Python 由 Guido van Rossum 在 1991 年發布；之後有多次演化，重要里程碑包括 Python 2（2000 年）與 Python 3（2008 年）。本課程使用 Python 3.7（2018 年發行）。
  • 補充：語言大版本更新會伴隨語法或語意的重要變更，因此學習時注意你使用的版本（本課程以 Python 3 為主）。

3) Python 的廣泛應用與生態系

  • 重點：Python 應用範圍廣，包括自動化、系統管理、網頁後端、數據分析、機器學習、影像處理等。
  • 補充：豐富的套件與工具（第三方函式庫）讓 Python 能處理各種不同任務，是 IT 與資料科學領域常見的首選語言之一。

4) 可跨平台性與職場相關性

  • 重點：Python 可在 Windows、Linux、macOS 等多種作業系統上安裝與執行；在職場中也非常常見，IT 從業者大多會遇到它。
  • 補充：學會 Python 可直接提升日常工作效率，且在求職或職涯發展上具競爭力。

5) 學習程式的心態與方法

  • 重點：程式學習大量依賴試錯與詢問。犯錯是學習的一部分，不要氣餒。
  • 補充建議：
    • 多做實驗、頻繁重構與測試：透過反覆修正來學習良好寫法。
    • 善用社群資源：Stack Overflow、官方文件、教學課程、郵件列表與討論區都是重要資源。
    • 尋求同儕與導師幫助：即使是資深工程師也會查資料或請教同事。

6) 持續學習的資源建議

  • 官方 Python 文件（官方教材與語法參考）
  • 線上教學平台與課程（針對不同主題與應用）
  • 技術社群（Stack Overflow、GitHub、論壇、郵件列表）
  • 範例專案與實作練習（從小專案開始，逐步累積）

7) 最後的鼓勵

  • 重點：踏入程式世界是一扇充滿機會的大門；你不需要孤軍奮戰，社群與資源會幫助你成長。
  • 補充：建議按部就班練習、主動尋求回饋、並把學習當成長期投資。完成本課程後，你將具備以 Python 解決基本 IT 問題的能力，並能繼續在其他領域深造。

如果你想，我可以進一步：

  • 推薦對初學者友善的線上 Python 教學資源與文件連結（含互動環境）；
  • 提供入門練習題單（由淺入深）與範例解答；
  • 幫你把一個日常工作流程拆解成可自動化的步驟並給出 Python 範例程式。

你想要哪一項協助？

Now that you've got an idea of what Python code looks like, let's check out one of the most basic examples and dive deeper into what's going on. Get ready. We're going to use a Python interpreter to make our computers say hello to the world. When we run this code, either locally on our machine or on a web interpreter, the words Hello, World appear on the screen, just like magic. Actually, it's not magic. It's because print is a Python function that writes what we tell it to on the screen. Like the statement Hello, World, for example, the print function is part of the basic Python language. Whenever we use keywords or functions that are part of the language, we're using the programming language syntax to tell the computer what to do. So what are functions and keywords? Functions are pieces of code that perform a unit of work. We'll talk a lot more about functions later on, and you'll even learn how to write your own. Keywords are reserved words that are used to construct instructions. These words are the core part of the language and can only be used in specific ways. Some examples include if, while, and for. We'll explain all of those and a bunch more later in the course. As we called out, the keywords and functions used in Python are what makes up the syntax of the language. Once we understand how they work, we can use them to construct more complex expressions that get the computer to do what we want it to do. Last off, notice how Hello, World is written between double quotation marks. Wrapping text in quotation marks indicates that the text is considered a string, which means it's texts that will be manipulated by our script. In programming, any text that isn't inside quotation marks is considered part of the code. Now for a bit of trivia, do you know why we greeted the whole world in our example? Well, printing Hello, World has been the traditional way to start learning a programming language since way back in the '70s when it was used as the first example in a famous programming book called The C Programming Language. That example looked like this. Play video starting at :2:8 and follow transcript2:08 In Python, the Hello, World example is just one line. In C, it's three lines. In other languages, it could be even more. While learning to write Hello, World won't teach you the whole language, it gives you a first impression of how functions are used and how a program written in that language looks. Now that we've written our first piece of Python code, I think you're ready for something a bit more challenging than Hello, World. Ready? Let's do it.
gpt-5-mini

下面我把你提供的段落整理成繁體中文要點（Markdown 格式），並補充必要說明，幫助你理解 Hello, World 範例中出現的基本概念──函式、關鍵字、字串以及為何這個例子被廣泛使用：

1) Hello, World 範例說明

  • 範例目的：用最簡單的一段程式碼讓電腦在畫面上輸出 "Hello, World"，作為學習新程式語言的第一個練習。
  • 在 Python 中只要一行：
    • print("Hello, World")
  • 在其他語言（例如 C）可能需要更多行來達成相同效果。

2) 為何這不是[魔法]

  • print 是 Python 的一個內建函式（function），負責把我們給的文字輸出到畫面上。
  • 程式會根據語言提供的關鍵字與函式，把我們寫的指令逐步執行，所以看起來像[出現文字]，其實是直譯器按指令做事。

3) 函式（functions）與關鍵字（keywords）

  • 函式：執行特定工作的程式碼區塊。print 就是做輸出的函式。日後會學到如何撰寫自己的函式。
  • 關鍵字：語言保留字，用來構造語句（例如 if、while、for），有固定用途且不能當作變數名稱使用。

4) 字串（strings）與語法辨識

  • 文字要放在單引號或雙引號中，例如 "Hello, World"；被引號包起來的內容在程式中被視為[字串]，會被當作資料處理或輸出。
  • 程式碼中未被引號包住的部分則被視為程式語法（例如函式名稱、關鍵字、變數等）。

5) 為何用 Hello, World？

  • 歷史傳統：自 1970s 起，《The C Programming Language》一書以印出 Hello, World 作為示範範例，之後成為學習新語言時常見的第一個練習。
  • 功能：雖然無法教會你整個語言，但能讓你看到函式呼叫、字串與基本程式結構的第一印象。

如果你想，我可以：

  • 讓你在瀏覽器上直接執行 print("Hello, World") 並示範輸出結果（告訴你可用的線上直譯器）；
  • 或提供一些比 Hello, World 稍微進階的練習（例如：輸出不同格式的字串、接收使用者輸入並回應、或把問候語套用到清單中的每個名字）。

你想先做哪一個？

On the whole, for a program to be useful, it needs to get at least some information from the user. With this data, the program can take actions that are relevant to the user, instead of generic actions like printing Hello, World. Data can be provided to a computer in a bunch of different ways. For example, on a website, you might input data by entering text into text fields, or clicking links. If you're using a mobile application, maybe you'll click on buttons or select preferences from a drop-down menu. In a command line program, you might provide additional data by passing strings as parameters to the program, or you could have the program ask you for data interactively. All these various platforms, programs, and apps process data differently. Some might take the contents of a file as data to be processed, others gather data from other sources and process it in the background. Remember our earlier example when we automated the process of identifying and removing duplicate emails? There, the data provided to the program was the list of emails, which would usually be given in a file that lists the emails one per line. Whichever way your application gets the data, it will need to come from somewhere. For our first examples in this course, we'll just have the data as its own line in our block of code. This is limited, but straightforward. Later in this course, and in upcoming courses, we'll introduce you to better ways of feeding data into your code. For now, though, let's see this idea in action in a very simple example. Play video starting at :1:33 and follow transcript1:33 By having the name separate from the call to the print function, we're making the line of code that calls the print function generic, while still personalizing the greeting. If we then wanted to say hello to a different person, we only need to change the name, but the call to the print function will remain the same. Pretty simple. Next up, we'll learn a few other easy things that you can get Python to do for you.
gpt-5-mini

下面我把你提供的段落整理成繁體中文要點（Markdown 格式），並補充說明，幫助你理解程式如何從使用者取得資料、各種輸入方式，以及為什麼要把資料與程式邏輯分離：

1) 為什麼程式需要使用者資料

  • 重點：為了讓程式做出對使用者有意義的動作（而非泛泛輸出 Hello, World），程式通常要取得一些來自使用者的資料，才能根據這些資料執行相關操作。

2) 常見的資料輸入方式

  • 網頁：文字欄位、連結點擊、表單提交等。
  • 行動應用：按鈕、下拉選單、開關等互動控制。
  • 命令列程式（CLI）：透過命令列參數（arguments）傳入字串，或程式執行時以互動方式詢問使用者輸入。
  • 檔案：程式讀取檔案內容作為輸入（例如以每行一個電子郵件地址的清單檔案）。
  • 背景來源：系統或第三方服務定期推送或收集資料，程式在背景處理。

3) 資料來源與程式的關係

  • 不管資料來自哪裡，程式都需要某個來源供它讀取。設計時要考慮資料格式、取得方式與錯誤處理（例如資料遺失或格式錯誤）。
  • 範例回顧：在[自動辨識並移除重複電子郵件]的例子中，程式的輸入資料就是那個以每行一個郵件的檔案。

4) 把資料與程式邏輯分離的好處

  • 在範例中，將姓名（資料）與 print 呼叫（程式邏輯）分開，使得輸出函式變得通用（generic），而只需更改資料就能改變輸出內容。
  • 優點：
    • 可重複使用相同程式邏輯處理不同資料（提高復用性）。
    • 減少程式碼重複，維護更容易。
    • 更容易測試與擴充（例如未來從檔案讀入姓名清單，或從使用者互動取得姓名）。

5) 在課程中的做法與進階

  • 目前課程初期會把資料直接寫在程式碼區塊中（簡單、直觀，適合入門示範）。
  • 之後會逐步介紹更實用的資料取得方式，例如讀取檔案、命令列參數、或互動輸入，讓你能處理實際工作中的各種情境。

如果你想練習，我可以幫你：

  • 提供幾個示範：如何在 Python 中從使用者互動輸入取得資料（input）、如何從檔案讀取資料、以及如何使用命令列參數（argparse）；
  • 或示範把姓名與問候邏輯分離的簡單範例程式，讓你在瀏覽器上或本機執行。

你想先看哪一個練習範例？

Now that we've covered some Python coding basics, we'll introduce you to some of the coding tools. Coding tools can help you develop, write, debug and visualize your code. In this video, we'll cover the basics of code editors and Integrated Development Environments or IDEs. Play video starting at ::17 and follow transcript0:17 Code editors are tools used to make writing code easier. With a code editor, you can write, debug and execute programs in Python. Code editors provide features, including syntax highlighting, automatic indentation, error checking, and auto-completion. Overall, code editors help define the code structure and function. This allows you to write code more efficiently. They also make it easier to understand variables, commands, functions, and loops. VS Code, Jupyter Notebooks and CoLab are some of the code editors we will cover in the next few videos. IDEs have more features than code editors. The difference between a code editor and an IDE is that a code editor is like a text editor. IDEs provide direction in writing code and allow you to see how the code executes. You can think of a code editor like a landline phone. You can dial numbers and make phone calls with it. An IDE is more like a smartphone. You can still make phone calls, but it has additional features that allow you to make video calls, send text messages, browse the Internet and use lots of other applications. An IDE is a software tool that simplifies the process of creating a new software application. An IDE is a software application that provides comprehensive facilities for software development. IDEs always include a code editor. IDEs allow you to develop code more efficiently by bringing multiple tools into one environment. You'll be able to edit, build, test and package all in one application. They also allow you to program applications more quickly without having to add manual integration and configuration. Coming up, we will cover IDLE. IDLE is an IDE that comes with Python automatically. It's an excellent beginner level IDE because it's very simple to use. It may not be great for larger projects, but it's excellent for getting to know how to use an IDE. Now, let's dive into some of the code editors and IDEs that you can use as you continue in your Python learning journey.
sider

Based on the information you provided, here's a summary of code editors and IDEs:

  • Code Editors: These tools simplify writing code by providing features such as syntax highlighting, automatic indentation, error checking, and auto-completion. They help define code structure and function, making coding more efficient. Examples mentioned include VS Code, Jupyter Notebooks, and CoLab.
  • IDEs (Integrated Development Environments): IDEs are more comprehensive than code editors, offering more features and direction in writing code. They allow you to see how the code executes and simplify the process of creating new software applications. IDEs always include a code editor and bring multiple tools into one environment for editing, building, testing, and packaging. IDLE, which comes with Python automatically, is mentioned as an excellent beginner-level IDE.

The key difference is that a code editor is like a text editor, while an IDE provides more comprehensive facilities for software development, integrating multiple tools into one environment.

Now that we've covered some Python coding basics, we'll introduce you to some of the coding tools. Coding tools can help you develop, write, debug and visualize your code. In this video, we'll cover the basics of code editors and Integrated Development Environments or IDEs. Code editors provide features, including syntax highlighting, automatic indentation, error checking, and auto-completion. Overall, code editors help define the code structure and function. This allows you to write code more efficiently. They also make it easier to understand variables, commands, functions, and loops. VS Code, Jupyter Notebooks and CoLab are some of the code editors we will cover in the next few videos. IDEs have more features than code editors. The difference between a code editor and an IDE is that a code editor is like a text editor. IDEs provide direction in writing code and allow you to see how the code executes. You can think of a code editor like a landline phone. You can dial numbers and make phone calls with it. An IDE is more like a smartphone. You can still make phone calls, but it has additional features that allow you to make video calls, send text messages, browse the Internet and use lots of other applications. gpt-5-mini

下面我依照你之前要求的格式（繁體中文、Markdown）整理該段落重點並補充實用建議，幫助你理解[程式編輯器（code editors）]與[整合開發環境（IDEs）]之間的差異，並推薦入門時可用的工具與實作建議。

1) 程式編輯器（Code Editors）是什麼

  • 重點：程式編輯器是用來讓撰寫程式更容易的工具，通常提供語法高亮、自動縮排、錯誤提示與自動完成等功能，能加速編寫並降低語法錯誤。
  • 常見用途：寫、除錯、執行簡單的 Python 程式；閱讀與理解變數、函式與迴圈結構更直觀。
  • 範例工具：VS Code、Jupyter Notebook、Google Colab（後兩者特別適合互動式教學與資料科學/筆記本式開發）。

2) 整合開發環境（IDEs）與編輯器的差別

  • 概念比喻：編輯器像座[電話]，能打電話（寫程式）；IDE 更像智慧型手機，除了打電話還能視訊、上網、安裝各種應用程式（整合更多功能）。
  • 重點：IDE 提供更完整的開發流程支援（包括編輯、建置、測試、封裝、除錯器、整合版本控制等），並且通常內建或整合其他工具，減少手動設定與整合成本。
  • 共通點：IDE 通常包含一個強化過的程式編輯器，但在此基礎上加上更多的開發工具。

3) 初學者友善與進階取捨

  • 入門：IDLE（隨 Python 安裝）是推薦的入門 IDE，介面簡單、容易上手，很適合初學者探索 IDE 的基本概念。
  • 進階：若要開發大型專案、做測試或整合第三方套件，可以考慮功能更強的 IDE（如 PyCharm）或透過 VS Code 加上擴充套件來達成。

4) 工具推薦與使用情境

  • 初學與教學互動：Jupyter Notebook、Google Colab（可即時執行程式、插入文字與圖表，適合教材與資料分析）。
  • 輕量開發與跨語言：Visual Studio Code（擴充豐富、啟動快，適合學習與小型專案）。
  • 大型專案與進階特性：PyCharm（專業級 Python IDE，提供強大的除錯、重構與專案管理功能）。
  • 隨機試驗與學習：IDLE（內建、零設定，適合快速試寫與練習）。

5) 實作建議（如何開始）

  • 如果你剛開始：先用 IDLE 或 Google Colab 練習基本語法（無需安裝 Python 或做複雜設定）。
  • 若想進一步建立開發環境：安裝 VS Code，並安裝 Python Extension（支援語法高亮、Lint、程式除錯與虛擬環境管理）。
  • 對於專案管理：學習如何建立虛擬環境（venv 或 conda）、使用版本控制（Git）以及用 IDE 或編輯器整合這些工作流程。

6) 常見功能快速比較

  • 語法高亮與自動完成：編輯器與 IDE 幾乎都支援，但 IDE 的自動完成與上下文提示通常更強大。
  • 除錯（debugging）：IDE 通常內建可視化除錯器（設斷點、逐步執行、檢視變數）；編輯器則多靠外掛或較簡單的除錯功能。
  • 測試與建置：IDE 會整合測試框架與建置工具，編輯器需手動或用外掛補強。
  • 多工具整合：IDE 集成更多工具（版本控制、套件管理、資料庫工具等）；編輯器透過擴充套件達成相似功能但需自行設定。

如果你願意，我可以幫你：

  • 提供一步步在本機安裝 VS Code 與 Python 擴充套件的教學（包含虛擬環境與基本設定）；
  • 示範如何在 Google Colab 執行一段簡單的 Python 程式，適合不想安裝環境的學習者；
  • 或比較 PyCharm 與 VS Code 的優缺點，針對你的學習或工作需求給出建議。

你想從哪一個開始？

Let's get started with our first coding tool. In this video, you'll learn how to write Python scripts at the command line, along with the Python GUI, Idle. The command line is used to tell your computer what to do. You can use it to access servers, move files, change directories, and write scripts. In this video, we'll show you how to use the command line and Idle on the Linux operating system. If you're using another operating system, you can refer to the reading titled, "Use the command line." Now, let's go over the command line on Linux OS. Access the Linux terminal by clicking on it or using CTRL, ALT, T. This will allow you to check for Python. Type Python. Python comes pre-installed on most Linux systems. If the command is not found, you can install Python by writing sudo apt install python3. Next, it will ask you for your password. Type your password and press enter. Python version three will begin installation. Once installation is complete, you can begin writing Python code from the terminal. Simply type python3 to use the interactive mode. Let's try out interactive mode using a print statement. Type print Hello World, and press enter. You will see the output, "Hello World." To exit interactive mode, we will type exit(). Play video starting at :1:22 and follow transcript1:22 You can also write Python scripts using Linux with Idle. Idle allows you to write Python scripts with ease on your local machine. Idle is an integrated development and learning environment for the Python programming language. Python Idle is included with Python installations on Windows and Mac OS. You can download Idle using your package manager on Linux. Python Idle is an interactive interpreter, or file editor, that allows you to easily write Python scripts and programs. Idle provides syntax highlighting, code completion, and automatic indentation. To install Idle on Linux, type sudo apt install idle. Once installation is complete, type idle to open the interpreter and begin coding. Play video starting at :2:10 and follow transcript2:10 Now we can write a Python file! Play video starting at :2:26 and follow transcript2:26 Once you've completed writing your Python code in the file, go to file save as. Give your Python file a name. In this example, we will name our file sum.py. Hit save. To run the Python code in the file you saved, click run, run module from the menu, or press enter. Play video starting at :2:47 and follow transcript2:47 Now you know how to use the command line to begin writing Python code. Remember, whichever operating system you're using, you'll be able to run Python from the command line. Using a text editor like Idle and running Python from the command line is best for executing and debugging individual scripts or .py files. Next, let's explore some other code editors and IDEs. I'll see you over in the next video.
gpt-5-mini

下面我依照你之前要求的格式（繁體中文、Markdown），根據你提供的內容整理重點並補充實作步驟與小技巧，幫你在 Linux 上從命令列與 IDLE 開始撰寫與執行 Python 程式。

1) 在 Linux 上開啟終端機與檢查 Python

  • 開啟終端機：點選 Terminal 或按 Ctrl + Alt + T。
  • 檢查 Python 是否已安裝：在終端輸入
    • python3
    • 若出現[command not found]，可用管理員權限安裝：
      • sudo apt install python3
      • 系統會要求輸入你的密碼並開始安裝。

2) 使用互動模式（REPL）快速試寫

  • 啟動互動模式：在終端輸入 python3 然後按 Enter。
  • 範例：在提示符下輸入
    • print("Hello World")
    • 會立即顯示 Hello World。
  • 離開互動模式：輸入 exit() 或按 Ctrl+D。

小提示：互動模式適合快速測試單行或小段程式碼、檢查函式行為與變數內容。

3) 在 Linux 上安裝並使用 IDLE（Python 的內建簡易 IDE）

  • 安裝 IDLE（若尚未安裝）：
    • sudo apt install idle
  • 執行 IDLE：在終端輸入 idle，或從桌面環境選單啟動。
  • IDLE 功能概覽：
    • 互動 Shell（可即時執行 Python 指令）
    • 檔案編輯器（可建立與儲存 .py 檔案）
    • 提供語法高亮、程式自動縮排與基本自動補完

小提醒：IDLE 對初學者友善，設定與使用門檻低，很適合練習與學習基本概念；但對大型專案或進階除錯需求，可能需要更完整的 IDE（如 PyCharm）或 VS Code。

4) 撰寫與執行 Python 檔案（範例流程）

  1. 用你偏好的編輯器（IDLE 的檔案編輯器、或任何文字編輯器）建立檔案。
  2. 範例：建立檔案 sum.py，內容可能像：
    • a = 2
    • b = 3
    • print(a + b)
  3. 在 IDLE 中：File → Save As，命名為 sum.py → Run → Run Module（或直接按 F5）。
  4. 在終端機執行：在存放 sum.py 的目錄下，輸入
    • python3 sum.py

5) 何時用命令列 vs. IDLE

  • 命令列（Terminal）適用於：
    • 快速執行腳本（批次工作或自動化）
    • 在遠端伺服器上執行或部署程式
    • 使用命令列參數、整合其他系統工具
  • IDLE（或其他編輯器/IDE）適用於：
    • 編輯、除錯、逐步執行與測試程式
    • 初學者熟悉開發流程與程式互動
    • 當需要語法高亮、自動縮排與簡易除錯器時

最佳實務：用編輯器或 IDE 撰寫與除錯程式，用命令列執行測試與部署腳本。

6) 額外建議（下一步要學的內容）

  • 練習在終端使用 python3 --version 確認版本。
  • 學會建立虛擬環境（venv）以隔離專案套件：
    • python3 -m venv venv
    • source venv/bin/activate
  • 嘗試在終端傳入命令列參數並在程式中存取（sys.argv 或 argparse）。
  • 若不想安裝環境，可用線上互動環境（Google Colab、Repl.it）練習。

如果你想，我可以：

  • 提供一個簡單的 sum.py 範例檔並示範如何在終端與 IDLE 執行（含逐步指令）；
  • 或一步步教你在本機建立與啟用虛擬環境，並在其中執行 Python 程式。

你想先做哪一項？

There are many different environments that you can use to write and run code. In this video, you'll learn more about Jupyter Lab and Jupyter Notebooks for writing, running and debugging Python code. Jupyter Lab and Jupyter Notebooks are part of an open source project called Project Jupyter and are free to use. You can learn more about Project Jupyter at jupyter.org. Jupyter Lab is a web-based interface that allows you to use Jupyter Notebooks to write, run and debug Python code. Jupyter Lab provides an online environment that allows you to run your code in the cloud. Jupyter Notebook can be used in the web-based interface through Jupyter Lab or on your local machine. Jupyter Notebook allows you to create text-based documents that contain live code blocks. You can write Python programs and scripts using Jupyter Notebooks and see how they execute all in one place. It's a great tool for creating and understanding the code you're writing because you can see your input and output all in one spot. This is what a basic Jupyter Notebook looks like. Next, we will cover how to use Jupyter Notebooks. One of the most popular ways to use Jupyter Notebooks is in the cloud-based environment. You can use this environment by visiting jupyter.org. Once you're at jupyter.org, you can get started. First, click try. Then select Jupyter Lab. To create a new notebook in the lab environment, add a new tab and select Python under notebook. A new notebook will open up and you can start writing and running Python code. Let's give it a try. You will write your code in the cell with the blue boarder. Let's use a print statement. Type print "Hello world" in the cell. Next, we will run the code in the cell. To do this, we'll use the run button located at the top of the toolbar. Click on run and your cell will execute. Your output should be Hello World. Play video starting at :1:50 and follow transcript1:50 You can save your Jupyter Notebook by using the save button that's also located in the top toolbar. Click save and give your notebook file a name. For this example, I will name my file Hello.ipynb. Also, if you would like to download your notebook, you can do that using the file menu located in the top left-hand corner. Play video starting at :2:10 and follow transcript2:10 You can also use Jupyter Lab and Jupyter Notebooks on your local machine. You can do this by using the pip command from the Python terminal command line. To install Jupyter Lab, type pip install Jupyter Lab at the command line. Once it's installed, you can launch it by typing Jupyter-Lab. To install Jupyter Notebooks, type pip install notebook at the command line. Once it's installed, you can launch it by typing Jupyter Notebook. Jupyter Lab and Jupyter Notebooks are great resources for writing Python code. To note, notebooks can also be shared and saved easily using email, GitHub and Jupyter Notebook Viewer. There are also tons of resources on Jupyter Notebooks out there, so if you need more support the Jupyter website is a great resource to dive deeper into. In the next video, we will go over CoLab. This is a coding tool that is very similar to Jupyter Notebooks. Head over to the next video to learn more.
gpt-5-mini

下面我依照你之前的格式（繁體中文、Markdown）整理你提供的內容，並補充實作步驟與實用小技巧，幫你快速上手 JupyterLab 與 Jupyter Notebook：

1) JupyterLab / Jupyter Notebook 概念一覽

  • 由 Project Jupyter 推出的開放原始碼工具，官網：jupyter.org（可到官網了解更多）。
  • JupyterLab：以網頁為介面的整合工作區（IDE-like），可以在瀏覽器中同時開啟多個筆記本、終端機、檔案總管等面板。
  • Jupyter Notebook：以[筆記本]為單位的互動式文件，內含可執行的程式碼區塊（cell）與說明文字（Markdown）。可在 JupyterLab 中使用，或獨立啟動。

2) 為何使用 Notebook？

  • 可在同一文件中交錯程式碼、執行結果與說明文字，適合教學、資料分析、快速試驗與展示。
  • 每個 cell 可單獨執行，方便逐步除錯與觀察中間結果。
  • 筆記本可儲存為 .ipynb 格式，容易分享（Email、GitHub、Jupyter Notebook Viewer）。

3) 如何在線上（雲端）使用 JupyterLab

  1. 到 jupyter.org。
  2. 點選 Try → 選 JupyterLab（依網站流程進入線上試用環境）。
  3. 在 JupyterLab 中新增 notebook：按[新增標籤頁（New Tab）]→ 選 Python（Notebook）。
  4. 在出現的 notebook 中，你會看到以藍色邊框框住的 cell。於 cell 輸入程式，例如：
    • print("Hello world")
  5. 執行 cell：按上方工具列的 Run（或按 Shift+Enter）。
  6. 儲存 notebook：按工具列的 Save，或檔案選單另存為 Hello.ipynb。也可以從 File 選單下載檔案（Download as）。

4) 如何在本機安裝並使用（pip）

  • 安裝 JupyterLab：
    • pip install jupyterlab
    • 啟動：在終端輸入 jupyter-lab
  • 安裝 Jupyter Notebook（傳統介面）：
    • pip install notebook
    • 啟動：在終端輸入 jupyter-notebook
  • 啟動後會自動在預設瀏覽器開啟介面（或提供本機的 URL），從那裡建立與管理 .ipynb 檔案。

小提醒：若使用系統 Python，建議先建立虛擬環境（python3 -m venv venv；source venv/bin/activate），再安裝 jupyter 以避免套件衝突。

5) 常用操作與技巧

  • 執行單一 cell：Shift + Enter（執行並跳到下一個 cell）。
  • 只執行該 cell：Ctrl + Enter（停留在同一 cell）。
  • 插入新的 cell：在工具列或用快捷鍵（A/B 分別在上方或下方插入）。
  • 切換 cell 類型：Code / Markdown（寫教學文字用 Markdown）。
  • 重新啟動 Kernel：當程式卡住或想重置執行環境時（Kernel → Restart）。
  • 安全儲存：經常按 Save（或啟用自動儲存）。
  • 下載與分享：File → Download as → 選 .ipynb 或其他格式（例如 .py、.html）。

6) 適用情境建議

  • 教學、紀錄試驗流程、資料分析、機器學習原型開發：Jupyter Notebook / Lab 非常合適。
  • 若需要多檔案專案結構、套件開發或複雜除錯：可考慮搭配 VS Code 或 PyCharm，用 Notebook 作為補充工具。

如果你要，我可以：

  • 提供一步步的本機安裝指令與在虛擬環境中安裝 JupyterLab 的示範（含常見錯誤處理）；
  • 或直接產生一個簡單的 Hello.ipynb 範例（包含程式 cell 與說明文字），說明如何在本機或雲端執行與下載。

你想要哪一個示範？

- Recently, we covered how to use Jupyter Notebooks. In this video, we will go over Colab notebooks. Colab Notebooks are Jupyter Notebooks that are hosted by Google's Colaboratory. In Colab, you can write and run Python code. In this video, you'll learn more about how to use Colab and its features. Colab is a web-based platform that allows you to write and run Python code really quickly in Google Drive. It's free and ready to use with zero configuration required. You can simply visit colab.sandbox.google.com or search Google Colab to get started. Play video starting at ::40 and follow transcript0:40 Colab provides all of the functionality that Python offers. The cells within Colab can include code, text, and images. The code cells include executable code and rich text, which makes it easy to write and run code. Colab also makes it easy to include markdown in your notebooks. This is a great feature for sharing notebooks because you can add headings, paragraphs, lists, mathematical formulas and more. You can install Python packages using the PIP command within the code cell. Colab Notebooks can easily be shared with other Colaborators too. Now, let's go over how to use Colab. First, open Google Colab. Again, you can do this by visiting colab.sandbox.google.com. Go to file and click on New notebook. Now you can begin writing your Python code. In the code cell, let's write a print statement that outputs your name. Play video starting at :1:36 and follow transcript1:36 To run your code and see its execution, use the run button to the left of the code cell. You can also give your coding project a name. At the top, you can change Untitled.ipynb to something like Name.ipynb. This will make it easier to find your code in the future. Play video starting at :1:56 and follow transcript1:56 The great thing about Colab is that it automatically stores your notebooks in Google Drive. To find your notebooks, you can simply visit your Google Drive, type in Colab Notebooks in the search bar and open up the folder titled Colab Notebooks. Here you will see all of the notebooks you've created. And that's how you use Colab. Pretty simple, right? I'm sure by now you're getting the hang of using these code editors. Let's move on to our final one, VS code. I'll see you in the next video.
gpt-5-mini

下面我依照你之前要求的格式（繁體中文、Markdown），根據你提供的內容整理 Google Colab 的重點與實作步驟，並補充實用技巧與注意事項，幫你快速上手 Colab 筆記本（Colab Notebooks）。

1) Colab 是什麼

  • Colab（Google Colaboratory）是 Google 提供的雲端 Jupyter 筆記本服務：在瀏覽器中撰寫、執行與分享 Python 程式碼，無需本機環境設定，免費可用（有付費升級選項）。
  • 每個 Colab 筆記本本質上是 Jupyter Notebook（.ipynb）檔案，整合程式碼 cell、Markdown 與圖像等內容。

2) 如何開始使用 Colab

  • 開啟 Colab：
    • 直接造訪 colab.sandbox.google.com，或用搜尋[Google Colab]並點入。
  • 建立新筆記本：
    • File → New notebook（或頁面上的 New notebook 按鈕）。
  • 指定檔名：點選上方的 Untitled.ipynb，重新命名為例如 Name.ipynb，方便管理與搜尋。

3) 寫程式與執行 cell

  • 在 code cell 中撰寫 Python 程式，例如：
    • print("Your Name")
  • 執行 cell：
    • 按 cell 左側的 Run 按鈕，或使用 Shift+Enter。
  • cell 類型支援：
    • Code（執行程式）
    • Text / Markdown（加入說明、數學公式、標題、清單等）

4) 安裝套件與存取外部資源

  • 在 cell 內可使用 pip 安裝套件，例如：
    • !pip install package_name
      （在 cell 第一行加驚嘆號來執行 shell 指令）
  • 可掛載 Google Drive（讀寫雲端檔案）：
    • from google.colab import drive
    • drive.mount('/content/drive')
  • 可上傳本機檔案或直接從網路下載資料（例如使用 wget 或 curl）。

5) 儲存、分享與管理

  • 自動儲存：Colab 自動將筆記本存到你 Google Drive 的 Colab Notebooks 資料夾。
  • 查看筆記本：打開 Google Drive，搜尋[Colab Notebooks]即可找到你創建的檔案。
  • 分享：像 Google 文件一樣分享 .ipynb，設定權限（檢視、可編輯）並可與協作者協同編輯。
  • 下載：File → Download → 選擇 .ipynb、.py 或其他格式以匯出。

6) Colab 的優點與適用情境

  • 優點：
    • 零設定，立即可用（適合教學與快速實驗）。
    • 免費 GPU/TPU（視配額與使用情況提供，有時需 Colab Pro）。
    • 與 Google Drive 整合，易於儲存與分享。
  • 適合：
    • 資料分析、機器學習原型、教學示範、快速試驗與協同開發。
  • 侷限：
    • 執行環境為臨時 VM（長時間運行或重度運算有使用與配額限制）。
    • 若需要長期穩定的生產環境，建議部署在專門的伺服器或雲端 VM。

7) 常用快捷與實務建議

  • 執行 cell：Shift + Enter（執行並跳到下一格）。
  • 在 cell 中執行 shell 指令：在指令前加 !（例如 !pip install numpy）。
  • 安裝套件後若要重新載入套件，可能需重新啟動執行階段（Runtime → Restart runtime）。
  • 使用版本控制：可將 notebook 存到 GitHub（File → Save a copy in GitHub）。
  • 安全性：避免在筆記本中硬編寫敏感金鑰或密碼；可把憑證存在 Google Drive 或用環境變數與秘密管理方案。

如果你想，我可以幫你：

  • 產生一個簡單的 Colab 範例筆記（包含文字說明 cell 與示範 code cell，例如讀取 Google Drive、安裝套件、顯示圖表）；
  • 示範如何在 Colab 中掛載 Google Drive 與讀取/寫入檔案的步驟；
  • 或示範如何把本機的 .ipynb 上傳到 Google Drive 並在 Colab 開啟。

你要我示範哪一項？

Now that you're familiar with a few different coding tools, let's take a look at VS Code. VS Code is an open source code editor that includes developer tooling. It's similar to Jupyter Notebooks and Colab, but it includes more features. VS Code provides built-in support with IntelliSense code-completion, an interactive debugger, and other build and scripting tools. VS Code has a simple layout that makes it easy to learn and use. Its intuitive features make it a great choice for coding in Python. To use VS code for Python, you will need to have Python 3, VS Code, and the VS Code Python extension installed. In this video, we're gonna show you how to do that. You can use VS Code on Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems. For this video, we'll be using the Linux operating system. If you're using another operating system, we have provided a reading on using VS Code with the other operating systems that you could take a look at later on. Now let's get started. We'll start by opening a terminal window. Type the following command, python3 --version. Play video starting at :1:7 and follow transcript1:07 If Python 3 is installed, the output will show the Python version that is installed on your computer. An example of what that output would look like is python 3-10-12. If it is not installed, the output will return command not found. This means you'll need to start by installing Python 3. To do this, go to your terminal. At the command line, you will type sudo apt install python3, and press enter. It will prompt you to enter your password. Enter your password, and it will begin installing. As Python 3 is installing, it may prompt you to continue by asking, do you want to continue? Yes slash no. Select yes and press enter. Now Python 3 is installed and ready to go. Let's move on to VS Code. You can download VS Code at codevisualstudio.com/download. Play video starting at :2:1 and follow transcript2:01 Here we're going to download the version that is compatible with Linux. Let's select the .deb version of VS Code. We will give it a second to finish downloading. Play video starting at :2:13 and follow transcript2:13 Next, we're going to go back to the terminal. We will navigate to the downloads folder. We will do this by typing cd Downloads/. Then we'll use the LS command. This will list the Debian file we just downloaded. The name of the file you just downloaded will appear. Next, you will type sudo dpkg -i, Play video starting at :2:38 and follow transcript2:38 and the name of the file listed. Play video starting at :2:41 and follow transcript2:41 Once that command is executed, Visual Studio Code is installed. Play video starting at :2:45 and follow transcript2:45 To open up Visual Studio Code, we type code at the command line, Play video starting at :2:50 and follow transcript2:50 and Visual Studio Code will open right up for us. The final step is setting up Python in VS Code. To do this, we will browse for extensions. To view extensions in VS Code, we will type ctrl shift X. This will show you a list of the most popular VS Code extensions on the VS Code marketplace. You can search for Python using the search bar, and click install. Once it's done installing, it will give you the option to get started with Python development. We'll jump right in by selecting create Python file. This will open up the code editor. Play video starting at :3:27 and follow transcript3:27 Let's test it out with a simple statement. We're going to type print hello world into the new workspace. Next, click on run to run the code. Play video starting at :3:37 and follow transcript3:37 You'll be prompted to name and save your file. Give your Python file a name and click save. In this example, we will give our file the name helloworld.py. Your code will run, and you will see its output here. Great job. Now, to summarize, VS Code is an extremely robust source code editor. It uses IntelliSense technology, which provides syntax highlighting and auto complete for coding. VS Code allows you to debug right in the editor with its interactive console. Overall, VS Code is extremely interactive and customizable. There's also a large library of extensions that are easily integrated. Great job. That was a lot to cover. Feel free to review these videos as many times as you need to. And remember, one of the best ways to figure out which tools work best for you are to explore all the features they have to offer and practice using them.
gpt-5-mini

下面我依照你之前要求的格式（繁體中文、Markdown），根據你提供的內容整理 VS Code 在 Linux 上設定與使用 Python 的完整步驟、重點比較與實作小技巧，幫你快速從安裝到執行第一個 Python 程式。

1) 前置條件檢查（確認 Python 3）

  1. 開啟終端機（Terminal）。
  2. 檢查 Python 版本：
    • python3 --version
    • 若顯示類似 python 3.10.12，表示已安裝。
    • 若顯示 command not found，請安裝 Python 3：
      • sudo apt install python3
      • 輸入密碼並在系統詢問時選擇 yes 以繼續安裝。

2) 下載與安裝 VS Code（Linux .deb 範例）

  1. 到官網下載：code.visualstudio.com/download，選 Linux 並選 .deb 檔（Debian/Ubuntu 系統）。
  2. 下載完成後，在終端進入 Downloads 資料夾：
    • cd Downloads/
    • ls（確認剛才下載的 .deb 檔名稱，例如 code_*.deb）
  3. 使用 dpkg 安裝：
    • sudo dpkg -i <下載檔案名稱>.deb
    • 若有相依套件問題，可接著執行 sudo apt -f install 修復相依性。
  4. 安裝後可在終端啟動 VS Code：
    • code

3) 在 VS Code 中安裝 Python 支援（擴充功能）

  1. 開啟 VS Code，開啟 Extensions 視窗：
    • 按 Ctrl+Shift+X 或點側邊欄 Extensions 圖示。
  2. 搜尋 "Python"（由 Microsoft 提供的 Python extension），點 Install 安裝。
  3. 安裝完成後（可能會建議安裝其他相關擴充如 Pylance），可選 Create Python file 立即開始。

4) 在 VS Code 中建立並執行第一個 Python 檔案

  1. 在工作區（Explorer）或直接在編輯器建立新檔案，輸入程式碼，例如：
    • print("Hello World")
  2. 按上方 Run 按鈕或右鍵選 Run Python File in Terminal 執行。
  3. 系統會要求你儲存檔案（例如 helloworld.py），儲存後程式會在內建終端或互動窗格顯示輸出。
  4. 若需除錯，可在左側 Debug 面板設定斷點並使用 Run and Debug 來逐步執行。

5) VS Code 的重要功能（對 Python 開發的幫助）

  • IntelliSense：語法高亮、參數提示與自動完成（由 Python extension 與 Pylance 支援）。
  • 互動式除錯器：設定斷點、逐步執行、檢視變數、REPL。
  • 內建終端機：直接在編輯器中執行 python3 檔案與命令。
  • 大量擴充套件：Linting（flake8、pylint）、格式化（black、isort）、虛擬環境管理、Docker、Git 等。
  • 工作區彈性：可處理單一檔案或多檔案專案，並方便整合版本控制。

6) 建議的進階設定（強烈推薦）

  • 安裝 Pylance（提供更快更準確的型別與補完）。
  • 安裝並設定 linter（例如 pylint 或 flake8）與自動格式化工具（black）。
  • 使用虛擬環境與 VS Code 結合：
    • 建議在專案資料夾建立 venv：python3 -m venv venv
    • 啟動虛擬環境：source venv/bin/activate
    • 在 VS Code 下方狀態列選擇對應的 Python interpreter（選擇 venv 中的 python 執行檔）。
  • 若有相依安裝問題（dpkg 安裝後），可用 sudo apt -f install 處理相依性。

7) 常見問題與排錯

  • dpkg -i 後出現相依性錯誤：
    • sudo apt -f install
  • 執行 code 指令找不到：
    • 重新開啟終端或確認安裝時有將 code 的啟動器加入 PATH（VS Code 安裝完成應會提供指令安裝 code 到 PATH）。
  • VS Code 找不到虛擬環境的 interpreter：
    • 在 VS Code 下方狀態列或 Command Palette（Ctrl+Shift+P）→ Python: Select Interpreter，選擇 venv 中的 python。
  • 執行時顯示不是預期 Python 版本：
    • 在終端與 VS Code 皆確認 python3 --version 與所選 interpreter。

8) 小結

  • VS Code 是強大且可擴充的原始碼編輯器，結合 IntelliSense、互動除錯與大量擴充，適合從教學小專案到大型應用開發的 Python 工作流程。
  • 在 Linux 上的基本流程：確認 Python3 → 下載 .deb → sudo dpkg -i 安裝 → code 啟動 VS Code → 安裝 Python extension → 建立並執行 .py 檔案。
  • 配合虛擬環境、linter 與格式化器，可建立更穩健的開發環境。

如果你要，我可以：

  • 提供你一組逐步的終端指令（可複製貼上）來完成從檢查 Python、下載 VS Code（用 wget）、安裝、修正相依性，到啟動並在 VS Code 中建立第一個檔案的完整流程；
  • 或示範如何在 VS Code 中設定虛擬環境、選擇 Interpreter、安裝 Pylance 與 black，並執行一段示範程式與簡單除錯流程。

你想要哪一種示範？

Hi there. Welcome back. Well done for completing your first grade at assessment. You're doing a great job making it this far. Chances are, some topics we've covered may have been a little tricky at times, especially if you're completely new to programming. Don't worry if something wasn't obvious right away. We went through a lot of new concepts, and it might take several passes until you feel comfortable with them and that's totally normal. We all went through when we were learning how to code. In the previous module, we explored some basic concepts like programming and automation. We called out that each programming language has a specific syntax, which we need to learn so we can tell the computer what to do. We then got a sneak preview of some of the things we could do with Python. Up next, we'll dive deeper into some basic building blocks of Python syntax, things like variables, expressions, functions, and conditional blocks. At first glance, these pieces may seem pretty simple, but when we start to combine them, they become a lot more powerful. Understanding a programming language of syntax isn't too different from learning a spoken language. For example, the best way to learn Spanish is to visit a Spanish speaking country, immerse yourself in the culture, listen to the people, then figure out how to arrange the words to form a sentence that another speaker can understand. The same is true for programming. When you immerse yourself in Python programming, you'll learn how to formulate statements of code that the computer can understand. This is called syntax. As you go through the next few videos, keep in mind that our main goal is to learn the language of syntax. We'll focus on how to tell our computer what to do, not on how to get it to do complicated tasks. Like before, we'll run through some simple exercises to help you see the concept in action. As you pick up the new skills and get to grips with different tools, we'll start to write more advanced scripts that tackle more challenging problems. Again, if at any point you feel confused or that something just isn't clear, remember, you can watch the videos and take the practice quizzes as many times as you need. The key to getting good at programming is practice, practice and practice. You have to keep working your programming muscles in order to get strong, just like building muscles in the gym. Train hard, train regularly, and you'll be tackling more weighty coding problems in no time. Ready to jump back in? In the next video, we're going to learn all about data types. Let's get started.
