下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式，整理本段影片重點（while 迴圈放在函式內）、範例行為解說、常見做法與實務建議，並附上可以直接執行的參考程式碼與練習題，幫你把概念練熟並應用到實際情境。

重點回顧：在函式內使用 while 迴圈

  • 將 while 迴圈放在函式內沒什麼特別限制；迴圈的執行範圍仍由條件控制。
  • 迴圈條件可以直接用比較運算（例如 x < n）、也可以呼叫其他函式（例如 not valid(username)）來判斷。
  • 迴圈內要有使條件最終變為 False 的步驟（例如遞增變數、接收有效輸入、或使用 break），否則會發生無限迴圈。
  • 可使用 x += 1 這種縮寫（增量賦值），語意與 x = x + 1 相同。

範例與行為說明

  1. 傳入參數 n，從 x=1 開始遞增直到不小於 n：
def repeat_attempts(n):  
    x = 1  
    while x <= n:  
        print("Attempt number", x)  
        x += 1  
    print("Final x:", x)

行為：若呼叫 repeat_attempts(5)，會印出 Attempt number 1 到 Attempt number 5，最後列印 Final x: 6。
說明：當 x 每次遞增後，迴圈在 x 超過 n 時結束；印出的最後 x 值比 n 大 1。

  1. 以函式結果作為條件（常見用法：重複要求輸入直到合法）：
def get_username():  
    return input("Enter username: ").strip()  

def is_valid_username(name):  
    # 範例驗證：長度 3–15 且只能英數或底線  
    return 3 <= len(name) <= 15 and all(c.isalnum() or c == "_" for c in name)  

def ask_for_username():  
    name = get_username()  
    while not is_valid_username(name):  
        print("Invalid username, try again.")  
        name = get_username()  
    print("Username accepted:", name)  
    return name

行為：ask_for_username 會不斷詢問使用者直到輸入合法的使用者名稱為止。條件是函式 is_valid_username 的布林結果。

常見陷阱與建議

  • 必須保證迴圈內會改變導致條件最終變為 False，或明確在某些情況下 break / return，否則會無限迴圈。
  • 若迴圈依賴使用者或外部事件，應加上可取消或超時機制（例如計數最大嘗試次數或加入 timeout）。
  • 使用函式封裝條件判斷（如 is_valid_username）能提升可讀性與測試性。
  • 迴圈與 I/O（input、網路請求）結合時應考慮錯誤處理（try/except）與延遲重試策略（避免忙等）。

可執行測試範例（快速測試）

簡潔版的 repeat_attempts 與驗證範例，你可以直接貼到 Python 執行：

def repeat_attempts(n):  
    x = 1  
    while x <= n:  
        print("Attempt number", x)  
        x += 1  
    print("Final x:", x)  

repeat_attempts(5)  
# 預期輸出：  
# Attempt number 1  
# Attempt number 2  
# Attempt number 3  
# Attempt number 4  
# Attempt number 5  
# Final x: 6

練習題（建議實作）

  1. 修改 repeat_attempts，使其在每次嘗試間等待 0.5 秒，並在達到最大嘗試次數仍失敗時回傳 False。
  2. 改寫 ask_for_username，使其最多只允許 3 次輸入，超過則印出錯誤並回傳 None。
  3. 實作一個函式 poll_status(check, timeout_seconds)：每隔 1 秒呼叫一次 check()（回傳 True/False），若 check() 回傳 True 則回傳 True；超過 timeout_seconds 後回傳 False（提示：使用 time.time() 計時與 time.sleep() 間隔）。

要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：寫出練習題 1 或 2 的完整參考程式碼（含測試）；或
  • B：寫出練習題 3（poll_status）的實作，並示範如何在真實情境下搭配指數退避與例外處理。
As we've called out earlier, writing loops allows us to get our computer to do repetitive work for us. Since one of the main benefits of writing scripts in IT is to save time by automating repetitive tasks, loops are super useful. So let's make sure you avoid some of the most common mistakes people make when writing loops. One of the most common errors is forgetting to initialize variables with the right value. We've all made this mistake when starting to code. Remember how in the earlier examples we initialized our variable x to 0 in one case and to 1 in the other? When we forget to initialize a variable, two different things can happen. Play video starting at ::37 and follow transcript0:37 The first possible outcome and the easiest to catch is that Python might raise an error telling us that we're using a variable we haven't defined, which looks like this. As we've done with other errors we've come across, we can look at the last line to understand what's going on. This error type is a name error and the message that comes after it says we're using an undefined variable. It's straightforward to fix. We just need to initialize the variable before using it, like this. Fixed. Now, there's a second issue we might face if we forget to initialize variables with the right value. Play video starting at :1:20 and follow transcript1:20 We might have already used the variable in our program. In this case, if we reuse a variable without setting the correct value from the start, it will still have the value from before. This can lead to some pretty unexpected behavior. Check out this script. Can you spot the problem? In the first block, we correctly initialize x to 1 and sum to 0, and then iterate until x equals 10, summing up all the values in between. So by the end of that block, sum equals the result of adding all the numbers from 1 to 10, and x is 10. Play video starting at :1:57 and follow transcript1:57 In the second part of the code, the original intention was to get the product of all the numbers from 1 to 10. But if you look closely, you can see that we're initializing product, but forgetting to initialize x. So x is still 10. This means that when the while condition gets checked, x is already 10 at the start of the iteration. The while condition is false before it even starts, and the body never executes. Let's see how this problem would look. In this case, it might be harder to catch the problem because Python doesn't raise an error. Play video starting at :2:34 and follow transcript2:34 The problem here is that our product variable has the wrong value. If you have a loop that's gone rogue and not behaving as expected, it's a good idea to check if all the variables are correctly initialized. In this example, we need to set x back to 1 before starting the second loop. As always, the best way to learn is to practice it yourself. Make sense? So to recap, whenever you're writing a loop, check that you're initializing all the variables you want to use before you use them. Don't worry if you don't get it right the first time. Play video starting at :3:8 and follow transcript3:08 We've all been there when learning how to code. As we've called out before, the way to master programming is to practice, practice, practice. Keep practicing until you're comfortable, and even then it's still okay to make mistakes. So don't feel like you can't loop back around to review and practice everything we've covered so far.
gpt-5-mini

下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理這段影片的重點，重點放在迴圈中變數的初始化常見錯誤、為何會發生，以及如何偵錯與預防。最後附上可直接執行的範例與練習建議，方便你實作驗證。

重點摘要：迴圈與變數初始化（Initialization）

  • 在使用 while（或其他）迴圈前，務必正確初始化迴圈相關變數（如計數器、累加器、旗標等）。
  • 忘記初始化會有兩種常見結果：
    1. 直接發生 NameError（使用未定義變數），Python 會拋錯並指出問題。
    2. 變數被重複使用但未重新設定為預期初值（仍保留先前的值），導致邏輯錯誤但不會拋錯，較難偵測。

範例與解說

  1. 未初始化導致 NameError（容易發現）
# 錯誤示範  
while x < 5:    # x 尚未定義  
    print(x)  
    x += 1  
# 執行會得到 NameError: name 'x' is not defined

修正：先初始化 x，例如 x = 0。

  1. 忘記重設變數（較難發現的邏輯錯誤）
# 第一段：計算 1 到 10 的總和（正確）  
x = 1  
sum_ = 0  
while x <= 10:  
    sum_ += x  
    x += 1  
# 此時 x == 11，sum_ 為 1+2+...+10  

# 第二段：想計算 1 到 10 的乘積，但忘記重設 x  
product = 1  
# x 未被重設，仍為 11  
while x <= 10:   # 條件一開始就是 False，迴圈不執行  
    product *= x  
    x += 1  

# 結果 product 還是 1，卻不是預期值

修正：在第二段開始前，務必重設 x = 1（或使用新的變數名，以避免混淆）。

偵錯與預防技巧

  • 明確初始化每個要使用的變數，並盡量在靠近使用處或同一邏輯區塊初始化，讓意圖清楚。
  • 若有相同用途的迴圈多次執行，最好每次都以新的變數或重新賦值開始（避免殘留狀態）。
  • 使用有描述性的變數名稱（如 counter、sum_total、product），減少混淆。
  • 在開發/偵錯階段，加入暫時性的 print 或 logging 以檢查迴圈進入前後變數值（例如印出迴圈前的 x）。
  • 使用單元測試或小範例覆蓋常見情境，及早發現邏輯錯誤。
  • 若程式較複雜，將功能拆成小函式（例如 compute_sum、compute_product），每個函式管理自己的變數範圍，降低變數相互影響的風險。

實作建議（習題）

  1. 修正上面範例，讓第一段計算和與第二段計算積分別正確執行（請重設 x 或使用不同的變數）。
  2. 將計算和、積的功能拆成兩個函式：compute_sum(n) 與 compute_product(n)，並比較在函式內是否還需要初始化變數（答案是：每個函式應自行初始化）。
  3. 撰寫一個小測試函式 test_compute()，檢查 compute_sum(10) 是否為 55、compute_product(5) 是否為 120，若錯誤則印出詳細變數狀態方便排查。

範例修正（示範程式碼）

def compute_sum(n):  
    x = 1  
    total = 0  
    while x <= n:  
        total += x  
        x += 1  
    return total  

def compute_product(n):  
    x = 1           # 確保重新初始化  
    product = 1  
    while x <= n:  
        product *= x  
        x += 1  
    return product  

print(compute_sum(10))      # 55  
print(compute_product(10))  # 3628800

需要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：把上述三個習題（包括單元測試）都寫成可執行的參考程式碼；或
  • B：示範如何用 logging 與斷言（assert）在迴圈中自動檢查變數是否如預期初始化與更新，幫助偵錯。
You may remember by now that while loops use a condition to check when to exit. The body of the while loop needs to make sure that the condition being checked will change. If it doesn't change, the loop may never finish, and we get what's called an infinite loop, a loop that keeps executing and never stops. Check out this example. It uses the modulo operator that we saw a while back. This cycle will finish for positive and negative values of x. But what would happen if x was zero? Play video starting at ::31 and follow transcript0:31 The remainder of 0/2 is zero, so the condition would be true. The result of dividing zero by two would also be zero, so the value of x wouldn't change, this loop would go on forever, and so we'd get an infinite loop. If our code was called with x having the value of zero, the computer would just waste resources doing a division that would never lead to the loop stopping. The program would be stuck in an infinite loop circling back around endlessly. We don't want that. All that looping might make your computer dizzy. To avoid this, we need to think about what needs to happen for a loop to be successful. Play video starting at :1:11 and follow transcript1:11 In this example, we said that x needs to be different than zero. We could nest this while loop inside an if statement, just like this. With this approach, the while loop is executed only when x is not zero. Alternatively, we could add the condition directly to the loop using a logical operator, like in this example. This makes sure we only enter the body of the loop for values of x that are both different than zero and even. Talking about infinite loop reminds me of one of the first times I used while loops myself. I wrote a script that emailed me as a way of verifying that the code worked. Play video starting at :1:49 and follow transcript1:49 While some condition was true, I forgot to exit the loop. Turns out those emails get sent faster than once per second. As you can imagine, I got about 500 emails before I realized what was going on. Infinitely grateful for that little lesson. When you're done laughing at my story, remember, when you're writing loops, it's a good idea to take a moment to consider the different values a variable can take. This helps you make sure your loop won't get stuck. If you see that your program is running forever without finishing, have a second look at your loops to check there's no infinite loop hiding somewhere in the code. Play video starting at :2:26 and follow transcript2:26 While you need to watch out for infinite loops, they're not always a bad thing. Sometimes you actually want your program to execute continuously until some external condition is met. If you've used the ping utility on Linux or macOS system, or ping-t on a Windows system, you've seen an infinite loop in action. This tool will keep sending packets and printing the results to the terminal unless you send it the interrupt signal, usually pressing Control C. If you were looking at the programs source code, you'd see that it uses an infinite loop to do this with a block of code with instructions to keep sending the packets forever. One thing to call out is it should always be possible to break the loop by sending a certain signal. In the ping example, that signal is the user pressing Control C. In other cases, it could be that the user pressed a button on a graphical application or that another program sent a specific signal, or even that a time limit was reached. Play video starting at :3:21 and follow transcript3:21 In your code, you could have an infinite loop that looks something like this. In Python, we use the brake keyword, which you can see here to signal that the current loop should stop running. We can use it not only to stop infinite loops, but also to stop a loop early if the code has already achieved what's needed. Quick refresh. How do you avoid the most common pitfalls when writing while loops? First, remember to initialize your variables, and second, check that your loops won't run forever. Wow. All this talk of loops is making me feel a little loopy. Play video starting at :3:53 and follow transcript3:53 I'm going to have to go and lie down while you do the next practice quiz. Best of luck and meet me over in the next video when you're done.
gpt-5-mini

下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理本段影片重點，重點放在無限迴圈（infinite loop）的成因、如何偵測與預防，以及實務上何時會刻意使用無限迴圈並如何安全終止它。最後附上範例程式與練習建議，方便你實作與驗證。

什麼是無限迴圈（Infinite loop）

  • 無限迴圈指的是迴圈條件永遠不會變為 False，導致程式持續重複執行且永不結束。
  • 常見原因：忘記更新用於判斷的變數、初始值選錯（例如為 0 而導致不會變化）、或條件邏輯有誤。

影片中提到的例子說明

  • 若迴圈內的更新無法改變條件（例如 x = 0 且迴圈條件依賴 x % 2），可能導致 x 永遠不變，迴圈永遠成立而無法結束。
  • 有時程式看起來沒錯但會卡住（沒有 Exception），這類邏輯錯誤較難偵錯，需要檢查變數初始值與更新邏輯。

如何避免無限迴圈（實務建議）

  1. 明確初始化變數，並確認初始值在意圖範圍內。
  2. 在迴圈內確保有變更條件的動作（例如遞增／遞減計數器、更新旗標、或在成功時 break/return）。
  3. 對依賴外部輸入的迴圈，加上最大重試次數或超時機制（guard），避免永遠等待。
  4. 在開發或測試階段加入紀錄（logging）或暫時性的 print，觀察迴圈進入次數與關鍵變數變化。
  5. 若迴圈執行頻繁呼叫外部資源或等待，加入適當等待（time.sleep）以降低資源耗用。
  6. 使用工具或測試來模擬特殊輸入（例如 x=0、負數等）以檢查邊界情況。

何時會刻意使用[無限迴圈]

  • 有些工具或服務（例如 ping、監控、守護程序）會以無限迴圈持續執行工作，直到外部信號（使用者 Ctrl+C、按鈕、IPC 訊號或達到時間上限）要求停止。
  • 重要原則：即使使用無限迴圈，也要提供一個明確且可觸發的退出機制（中斷、訊號、條件或超時）。

控制迴圈的常用語句

  • break：立即離開所在的迴圈（可用於提早結束或在某條件成立時跳出）。
  • continue：跳過本次迴圈剩餘程式，開始下一次迴圈（用於略過特定情況）。
  • return（在函式內）：結束函式與迴圈，回傳值給呼叫者。

範例程式碼與說明

  1. 可能導致無限迴圈的錯誤例子：
def buggy_cycle(x):  
    while x % 2 == 0:  
        # 當 x == 0 時，x % 2 == 0 且 x 不會改變，會成為無限迴圈  
        x = x // 2   # 若 x==0，仍為 0，無法脫離迴圈
  1. 加上檢查避免無限迴圈的修正：
def safe_cycle(x):  
    if x == 0:  
        return "x must be non-zero"  
    while x % 2 == 0:  
        x = x // 2  
    return x
  1. 在需要重試但要避免無限重試時，加入最大次數與等待：
import time  

def retry_operation(operation, max_attempts=5, delay=1):  
    attempts = 0  
    while attempts < max_attempts:  
        try:  
            return operation()  
        except Exception as e:  
            attempts += 1  
            print(f"Attempt {attempts} failed: {e}")  
            time.sleep(delay)  
    raise RuntimeError("Operation failed after maximum attempts")
  1. 一個典型的[永遠跑但可中斷]伺服器式迴圈（示意）：
import time  
import signal  
import sys  

running = True  

def handle_sigint(signum, frame):  
    global running  
    running = False  

signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, handle_sigint)  

while running:  
    # 做週期性工作  
    print("Working...")  
    time.sleep(1)  

print("Shutting down cleanly")

說明：使用訊號處理讓使用者按 Ctrl+C（SIGINT）時將 running 旗標設為 False，使迴圈能乾淨結束。

偵錯技巧（當程式[卡住]疑似無限迴圈）

  • 在可疑的迴圈加入短暫的 print 或 logging，記錄關鍵變數值與迴圈次數（要避免太多輸出以免淹沒資訊）。
  • 嘗試用最小化輸入（例如 x=0、極大值、負值）測試邊界情況。
  • 若程式可中斷，在迴圈內或外部加入一個計數器（例如最大次數）作為保險。
  • 使用偵錯器（debugger）逐步執行、檢查變數值變化與條件判斷。

小練習（建議實作）

  1. 寫一個函式 safe_divide_loop(x)，在迴圈前檢查 x 是否為 0，若為 0 則回傳錯誤提示；否則執行某個除法相關迴圈並回傳結果。
  2. 實作一個永遠運行但可透過按鍵（輸入 'q'）停止的主迴圈。
  3. 改寫 retry_operation，加入指數退避（exponential backoff）與最大等待上限（cap），並示範在模擬會失敗的 operation 上測試。

需要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：把練習 1–3 的參考答案寫成可執行程式碼並附測試輸出；或
  • B：示範如何用 logging 與 assert 在迴圈中自動偵測潛在無限迴圈情況（包含範例與說明）。
How are you doing? If all this talk of loops is starting to make your head spin, remember that there's nothing wrong with looping back round and reviewing what you've learned. It's the quickest way to stop feeling like you're running in circles. Feeling good? Great. Then we're ready for a different type of loop. In this video, we're going to meet the for loop. Play video starting at ::21 and follow transcript0:21 A for loop iterates over a sequence of values. A very simple example of a for loop is to iterate over a sequence of numbers like this. Notice how this structure is similar to the structures we've already seen. The first line indicates the distinguishing keyword. In this case, that's for, and it ends with a colon. The body of the loop is indented to the right like we saw in the while loop. The if block, and the function definitions. Play video starting at ::48 and follow transcript0:48 What's different in this case is that we have the keyword in. Also, between the for keyword and in keyword, we have the name of a variable. This variable will take each of the values in the sequence that loop iterates through. In this example, it'll iterate through a sequence of numbers generated using the range function. There are two important things I want to call out about this range function. First, in Python and a lot of other programming languages, a range of numbers will start with the value zero by default. Second, the list of numbers generated will be one less than the given value. Play video starting at :1:26 and follow transcript1:26 In the simple example here, x will take the values 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4. Let's check this out. There we have a very basic for loop. It iterates over a sequence of numbers generated by the range function. When using a for loop, we point the variable defined between for and in, in this case, x at each element of the sequence. This means on the first iteration, x points at one, on the second iteration, it points at two, and so on. Whatever code we put in the body of the loop will be executed on each of the values, one value at a time. Play video starting at :2:10 and follow transcript2:10 As we said earlier, the loop's body can do a lot of things with the values it iterates. For example, you could have a function to calculate the square of a number and then use a for loop to sum the squares of the numbers in a range. Iterating over numbers looks very similar to the while loop examples we showed before. You may be wondering, why have two loops that look like they do the same thing. Well, the power of the for loop is that we can use it to iterate over a sequence of values of any type, not just a range of numbers. Think all the way back to our very first Python example in this course. Remember our trustee "hi friends" script. Play video starting at :2:50 and follow transcript2:50 In it, we saw a for loop that iterated over a list of strings. It looked like this. We'll talk a lot more about lists later on, but for now, you only need to know that we can construct lists using square brackets and separate the elements in them with commas. In this example, we're iterating a list of strings, and for each of the strings on the list, we're printing a greeting. The sequence that the for loop iterates over could contain any type of element, not just strings. For example, we could iterate over a list of numbers to calculate the total sum and average. Here's one way of doing this. Here, we're defining a list of values. Play video starting at :3:30 and follow transcript3:30 After that, we're initializing two variables, sum and length that will update in the body of the for loop. In the for loop, we're iterating over each of the values in the list, adding the current value to the sum of values, and then also adding one to length, which calculates how many elements there are in the list. Once we've gone through the whole list, we print out the sum and the average. We'll keep using for loops in our examples every time we want to iterate over the elements of any sequence and operate with them. Some examples of sequences that we can iterate are the files in a directory, the lines in a file, the processes running on a machine, and there's a bunch of others. As an IT specialist, you'll use for loops to automate tons of stuff. For example, you might use them to copy files to machines, process the contents of files, automatically install software, and a lot more. Play video starting at :4:24 and follow transcript4:24 A few weeks ago, I had to update a lot of files with different values depending on their contents, so I used a for loop and a script to iterate over all the files. Then my script took different actions based on an if condition and updated all of those files for me. It would have taken me forever if I had done this manually file by file. If you're wondering when you should use for loops and when you should use while loops, there's a way to tell. Use for loops when there's a sequence of elements that you want to iterate. Use while loops when you want to repeat an action until a condition changes. If whatever you're trying to do can be done with either for or while loops, just use whichever one's your favorite. Play video starting at :5:1 and follow transcript5:01 I'm more of a while gal myself, but it's totally your call. Next up, we put together more examples to help get you more practice with for loops and discover some of the cool things you could do with them.
gpt-5-mini

我很好，謝謝！下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理這段影片關於 for 迴圈的重點、語法、範例、何時用 for vs while、以及實務應用與練習題，方便你快速上手與應用。

for 迴圈重點

  • for 迴圈用來[遍歷（iterate）]一個序列（sequence），例如數字範圍、列表（list）、字串、檔案列、或任何可迭代物件。
  • 語法結構與其他區塊相同：for 變數 in 序列: 之後縮排區塊是迴圈主體。
  • 每次迴圈，變數會被設為序列的下一個元素，直到序列耗盡為止。

基本語法與範例

  • 整數範圍（range）：
for x in range(5):   # x 會依序為 0,1,2,3,4  
    print(x)
  • 迭代列表的字串：
names = ["Alice", "Bob", "Carol"]  
for name in names:  
    print("Hi", name)
  • 迭代並累計數值（計算總和與平均）：
values = [10, 20, 30]  
total = 0  
length = 0  
for v in values:  
    total += v  
    length += 1  
average = total / length  
print(total, average)

要注意：range(n) 在 Python 中會從 0 開始，並到 n-1（不含 n）。

for vs while：何時用哪個？

  • 用 for 迴圈：當你有一個明確的序列（元素清單或可產生一系列元素的物件）想要遍歷時。
  • 用 while 迴圈：當你要持續執行直到某個布林條件變化（例如等待外部事件或條件滿足），而不是依序處理已知序列時。
  • 若兩者都能達成，選擇你覺得語意更清楚、程式更易讀的那個。

for 迴圈的實務用途（IT 範例）

  • 逐一處理目錄中的檔案（例如批次修改、複製、讀取與分析）。
  • 讀取並處理檔案的每一行（log 處理、資料擷取）。
  • 遍歷系統資源（例如正在執行的 process、使用者列表）。
  • 批次安裝或設定多台主機（搭配 SSH、API 呼叫等）。

範例：遍歷目錄修改檔案內容（示意）

import os  

for fname in os.listdir("/path/to/dir"):  
    if fname.endswith(".conf"):  
        path = os.path.join("/path/to/dir", fname)  
        with open(path, "r+") as f:  
            content = f.read()  
            # 修改 content 後寫回（示意）

進階提示與常見做法

  • 如果需要索引與值，可用 enumerate()：
for idx, val in enumerate(values):  
    print(idx, val)
  • 若要同時遍歷多個序列，使用 zip()：
for a, b in zip(list1, list2):  
    ...
  • 若需要反向或有步進，可用 range(start, stop, step) 或 reversed()：
for i in range(10, 0, -1):  
    print(i)
  • 對大型序列/檔案，for 迴圈通常比先把整個資料載入記憶體再處理更有效率（可逐行處理）。

練習題（建議實作）

  1. 寫程式讀一個數字列表，印出所有偶數的平方和。
  2. 寫一個函式 sum_and_avg(values) 回傳總和與平均，使用 for 迴圈實作。
  3. 用 for 迴圈讀取目錄中的所有 .txt 檔，統計每個檔案的行數並印出檔名與行數。
  4. 用 enumerate 實作：給定一串名字，印出序號（從 1 開始）與名字。
  5. 使用 zip：給兩個等長清單（名稱與分數），印出每個學生的名稱與分數，並計算平均分數。

要我幫你做哪一件？

  • A：把其中某個練習（例如題 1 或 3）寫成完整、可執行的參考程式碼（含測試示例）；或
  • B：示範 enumerate、zip 與 range 的範例並說明何時用哪個（含短程式碼範例）。
In the last video, we talked about the range function and how it generates a sequence of numbers starting with zero. Sometimes, though, we don't want to start with zero. For these situations, the range function also allows us to specify the first element of the list to generate. We do that by passing two parameters to the function instead of one, like in the next example. Product = 1, for n in range (1,10). Product = product * n. Print (product). Play video starting at ::47 and follow transcript0:47 In this example, we're calculating the product of all numbers 1-9. For this operation, it's important that we start with one and not with zero. If we had started with zero, the whole product would be zero. Additionally, we can specify a third parameter to change the size of each step. This means that instead of going one by one, we could have a larger difference between the elements. Let's check out this example when you might want to do something like this. First, we're defining a function that converts a temperature value from Fahrenheit to Celsius, and we're simply using a conversion formula to do that. Play video starting at :1:24 and follow transcript1:24 Then we have a for loop that starts at zero and goes up to 100 in steps of 10. Notice that we're using 101 for the upper limit instead of 100. We're doing this because the range never includes the last element, and we want to include 100 in our range. The body of the for loop prints the value in Fahrenheit and the value in Celsius creating a conversion table. Let's see this in action. That example got you feeling the heat? Don't worry. Play video starting at :1:54 and follow transcript1:54 There's a quick rundown of what we've learned. The range function can receive 1, 2, or 3 parameters. If it receives one parameter, it will create a sequence one by one from zero until one less than the parameter received. If it receives two parameters, it will create a sequence one by one from the first parameter until one less than the second parameter. Finally, if it receives three parameters, it will create a sequence starting from the first number and moving towards the second number, but this time, the jumps between the numbers will be the size of the third number. Again, it will stop before the second number. This might sound like a lot to remember, but don't panic. Play video starting at :2:33 and follow transcript2:33 As we've said before, you don't have to try to memorize it all. Just keep practicing. It'll soon become second nature.
gpt-5-mini

下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式簡明整理 range 的 1/2/3 參數行為、常見陷阱與實用範例（含你影片中提到的乘積與溫度轉換表），方便直接複製執行與練習。

range 函式速查

  • range(stop)：
    • 產生從 0 到 stop-1 的整數序列（步長預設為 1）。
    • 範例：range(5) → 0,1,2,3,4
  • range(start, stop)：
    • 產生從 start 到 stop-1 的整數序列（步長預設為 1）。
    • 範例：range(1,10) → 1,2,3,...,9
  • range(start, stop, step)：
    • 產生從 start 開始，每次加上 step，直到到達或超過 stop（不包含 stop）。step 可為正或負。
    • 範例：range(0,101,10) → 0,10,20,...,100
    • 範例（反向）：range(10,0,-2) → 10,8,6,4,2

注意：range 的終點為[不包含（exclusive）] stop；若要包含某個上限，通常需要把 stop 設為上限 + 1（或相應調整）。

常見陷阱

  • 忘記 range 不包含上限：for i in range(1,10) 不會包含 10。
  • 開始值選錯會影響結果（例如乘積若從 0 開始，結果會永遠為 0）。
  • step = 0 會造成錯誤（ValueError）；step 正負要搭配 start 與 stop 的方向。

影片中的範例 1：計算 1 到 9 的乘積（不要從 0 開始）

product = 1  
for n in range(1, 10):   # n = 1..9  
    product = product * n  
print(product)  # 1*2*...*9 = 362880

說明：若改成 range(0,10)，則序列包含 0，整個乘積會變成 0，因此必須從 1 開始。

範例 2：每 10 度列印一次華氏到攝氏轉換表

  • 轉換公式：C = (F - 32) * 5 / 9
  • 示範程式：
def f_to_c(f):  
    return (f - 32) * 5 / 9  

for f in range(0, 101, 10):   # 0,10,20,...,100  
    print(f"{f} F -> {f_to_c(f):.1f} C")

注意：用 range(0, 101, 10) 而不是 range(0, 100, 10) 才能包含 100。

額外練習（推薦）

  1. 修改乘積程式，寫成函式 factorial(n)，計算 12...(n-1) 或 12*...*n（注意你要選擇包含上限的寫法）。
  2. 用 range 與 step 參數，印出 20 到 0 的倒數（每次減 2）：range(20, -1, -2)。
  3. 寫一個程式列出 1 到 100 中所有能被 3 或 5 整除的數，並計算其總和（使用 for 與 if 條件）。

要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：把練習題 1–3 的完整範例寫成可執行程式並給出測試輸出；或
  • B：示範 factorial(n) 的正確寫法（包含邊界情況 n=0）並解釋為何通常把 range 的終點設為 n+1（若你希望包含 n）。
You're doing great getting your head around all these loops. I think you're ready for something a little bit more complex. We're going to explore what happens when you get loops inside of loops. Does that make your head spin? Don't worry. We're about to break it down for you with a couple of examples. Have you ever played dominoes before? Play video starting at ::17 and follow transcript0:17 There's a bunch of fun games you can play with these tiles. In case you're not familiar, each domino tile has two numbers represented by a collection of dots carved on each half of the tile. The numbers go from 0-6. Tiles can be rotated so that each combination of numbers is represented only once in a set of domino tiles. In other words, the 2,3 tile is the same as the 3,2 tile, and there's only one per set. Now, imagine we wanted to write a program that prints each domino tile in a set. If we take all of the tiles that have zero on the left, we can print tiles with numbers from 0-6 on the right. Play video starting at ::55 and follow transcript0:55 That should be easy to do with a for loop. What about tiles that have one on the left? Well, we need to skip the 1,0 tile, because that one was already printed as 0,1. We could print a list of tiles with one on the left and numbers from 1-6 on the right. When we look at two, we would need to skip both zero and one, and so on. Are you following along? How do you think we'd write the code for this? Play video starting at :1:21 and follow transcript1:21 Turning this into code means that we need to write 2,4 loops, one inside the other. This is what we call nested for loops. Check out how this looks in Python code. For left in range, seven. For right in range left, seven, print. We're going to do left bracket, plus str left, plus pipe, plus str right, plus close bracket and equals space, and print. In this code, we're using a new parameter that we pass to the print function. Play video starting at :2:33 and follow transcript2:33 This parameter is called end. Normally, once print has taken the content we passed and written it to the screen, then it writes a special character that creates a new line called the new line character. If we want print to write something else instead of the new line character, we use the end parameter, like we see in this example. Notice how the second for loop iterates over a different number of elements each time it's called as the value of left changes. Depending on what you want to achieve with your nested loops, you may want both loops to always go through the same number of elements, or you might want the second loop to connect to the first one. Let's look at a different example. Let's say you run a local girls' basketball league in your town. Play video starting at :3:18 and follow transcript3:18 You have four teams that will play against each other in the league, both at home and away. You've stored the names of the teams in a list like this. We want to write a script that will output all possible team pairings. For this, the order of the names matters because for each game, the first name will be the home team, and the second name is the away team. Of course, what we don't want to do is have a team playing against itself. What statement do we need to use to avoid that? To do this, we need to use a conditional that makes sure we only print the pairing when the names are different. Play video starting at :3:59 and follow transcript3:59 Check out what this looks like. For home team in teams, for a way team in teams, if home team not equal to a way team, print home team versus away team. Success. As you can see, nested loops are super useful for solving certain problems like pairing teams. What it doesn't solve is the question, who would win in a face off between dragons and unicorns. If only there were some code for that. Anyway, we've seen that nested loops are a handy tool, but we need to be careful not to just blindly apply them to any problem. Play video starting at :4:57 and follow transcript4:57 Why? Well, because the longer the lists your code needs to iterate through, the longer it takes your computer to complete the task. Let's say your manager asks you to do an operation that will run through a list of 10,000 elements. If the operation takes one millisecond per element, the whole loop would take one millisecond times 10,000 to complete, which is 10 seconds. Now, imagine we add a nested loop that has to go over the same 10,000 elements. This means that each iteration of the outside loop would do a full iteration of the inside loop, which again, would take 10 seconds to go through the whole list. Now the whole iteration takes 10,000 times 10 seconds, which is 100,000 seconds. Play video starting at :5:42 and follow transcript5:42 That's over 27 hours. I have the patience of a NAT, so that would definitely not work for me. This doesn't mean we shouldn't use nested loops. They're a useful tool when solving problems that require them, but we need to be careful of where and how we use them. Throughout this course and ones coming up, we'll look at a lot of techniques that can help us pick the right tool to use for each type of problem. Up next, we'll look into some common errors that you might come across when writing your for loops and what to do about them.
gpt-5-mini

我很好，謝謝！下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理這段影片關於[巢狀迴圈（nested loops）]的重點、範例與效能提醒，並附上可直接執行的參考程式碼與練習題，幫你更清楚掌握何時與如何使用巢狀 for 迴圈。

重點摘要：巢狀迴圈（Nested loops）

  • 巢狀迴圈就是在一個迴圈內再放另一個迴圈。外層迴圈每跑一次，內層迴圈就會完整跑一次。
  • 內層迴圈可以依賴外層迴圈的變數（例如內層的 range 以外層參數為起點），因此能產生有結構的組合或矩陣式輸出。
  • 使用巢狀迴圈時要注意效能：若每個迴圈都遍歷很大的序列，時間複雜度會呈乘法增長（例如 O(n*m) 或 O(n^2)），資料量大時可能非常慢或不可行。
  • 若需要避免重複或自對戰（如 dominoes 或隊伍配對），可透過調整內層迴圈的起始點或加入條件（if）來排除不必要的組合。

範例 1：印出多米諾骨牌組（每對只列出一次）

說明：多米諾骨牌雙面數字 0–6，且 (a,b) 與 (b,a) 視為相同，應只列出一種排列。做法是讓右側從 left 開始到 6。

for left in range(7):           # left = 0..6  
    for right in range(left, 7):  # right = left..6，避免重複組合  
        print(f"[{left}|{right}]", end=" ")  
    print()  # 換行，分行顯示每個 left 的結果

輸出示意（部分）：
[0|0] [0|1] [0|2] ...
[1|1] [1|2] [1|3] ...
...

備註：這裡用到 print 的 end 參數來控制輸出不自動換行，並在每個 left 完成後以 print() 換行。

範例 2：隊伍主客場配對（不允許隊伍與自己對戰）

說明：四隊兩兩配對，順序（home, away）有差別，但不允許 home == away。

teams = ["Rockets", "Tigers", "Wolves", "Eagles"]  

for home in teams:  
    for away in teams:  
        if home != away:  
            print(f"{home} vs {away}")

備註：若不想要主客場皆列（只要無序組合），可改用雙重索引並只列出 i < j 的配對，或用 combinations()。

常見做法與最佳化建議

  • 排除重複（如 dominoes）：讓內層起始於外層變數（range(left, N)）或用索引比較（i <= j）以避免 (a,b) 與 (b,a) 都列出。
  • 若只需要無序配對（不分主客），使用 itertools.combinations，可避免 O(n^2) 中不必要重工且語意清楚。
  • 當序列很大時，考慮更有效率的演算法或資料結構（例如利用集合／映射預先過濾、或用排序與雙指標技巧等），以避免暴力的巢狀迴圈。
  • 用生成器（generator）與 lazy evaluation 來避免一次載入大量資料到記憶體；或平行處理／分批處理以分散成本。

範例示範：使用 itertools 取得無序隊伍配對（更簡潔且避免重複）

import itertools  

teams = ["Rockets", "Tigers", "Wolves", "Eagles"]  
for a, b in itertools.combinations(teams, 2):  
    print(f"{a} vs {b}")

說明：combinations 會產生不分順序的組合，若還需要主客場（兩種排列），可用 permutations 或在 combinations 基礎上為每組產生兩個排列。

效能示例：巢狀迴圈的成長

  • 單一迴圈處理 10,000 個元素，若每元素耗時 1ms，總時間約 10 秒。
  • 巢狀雙迴圈處理相同 10,000 元素（即每次外層執行內層 10,000 次），總時間變為 10,000 * 10 秒 = 100,000 秒（超過 27 小時）。
    結論：在面對大資料量時務必避免不必要的 O(n^2) 或更糟的演算法。

練習題（建議實作）

  1. 實作並列出多米諾全套（0–6），確認總數為 28（公式 C(7+1,2) = 28）。
  2. 改寫隊伍配對，用 permutations() 來列出主客場皆列出的比賽，並用 combinations() 列出不分主客的對戰。比較兩者的輸出數量。
  3. 給定一個長度為 n 的清單，寫出不同演算法列出所有不重複配對（a,b）的方法，並在 n 增長時測量時間差（例如 n=50 或更大）以觀察效能差異。
  4. 將一個巢狀迴圈嘗試改寫成更有效率的演算法（舉例：用 hashmap/索引預處理以避免內層遍歷），並比較執行時間。

想要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：把多米諾範例、主客場配對（permutations）與不分主客配對（combinations）的完整可執行程式碼都寫出來並示範輸出；或
  • B：針對某個練習（例如練習 3）寫出範例、量測效能（簡單的 timeit 或時間記錄），並示範如何把 O(n^2) 的巢狀迴圈改寫成更快的方法（若有可能）。
We've now seen how to write for loops, combine them with functions, nest a for loop inside a different loop, and even combine a nested loop with conditionals. Nice job. You're chugging right along. But before we're done with for loops, let's check out some common mistakes you may come across while trying this yourself. As we've called out already, for loops iterate over sequences. The interpreter will refuse to iterate over a single element. As you see here, for x in 25, print x. Play video starting at ::34 and follow transcript0:34 In this example, we're trying to iterate over the number 25. Python prints a type error telling us that integers are not iterable. There are two solutions to this problem, depending on what we're trying to do. If we want to go from 0-25, then we use the range function. For x in range 25, print x. But if we're trying to iterate over a list that has 25 as the only element, then it needs to be a list, and that means writing it between square brackets. For x in list 25, print x. Play video starting at :1:23 and follow transcript1:23 You might be wondering why you'd ever want to iterate over a list of one element, and that's a good question. Well, this issue usually happens when you have a function with a for loop inside it, which is iterating over the elements of a list received by parameter. Say, for example, you have a function that fixes the permissions of a list of files received by parameter, and you want to call this function to fix the permissions of just one specific file. To do that, you need to pass the file as the single element of a list. Let's check this out with some code we're familiar with, our friendliest of Python examples. Hi, friends. We're going to modify it to have the greetings inside a function. Play video starting at :2:3 and follow transcript2:03 We've defined a greet friends function that receives a list by parameter and iterates over that list, greeting each friend. But what if we only want to greet one friend instead of for? Well, we still need to define a list, but with only one element. But first, let's see what would happen if we don't do that. Greet friends, Barry. Not what we expected. Well, what's going on here? Play video starting at :2:37 and follow transcript2:37 This happens because strings are iterable. The for loop will go over each letter of the string and do the operation we asked it to do, which in this case, print a greeting. Depending on what you're trying to do, you may actually want to iterate through the letters of a string, but in this case, we don't. To sum it up, if you get an error that a certain type isn't iterable, you need to make sure the for loop is using a sequence of elements and not just one. If you find your code iterating through each letter of a string when you want it to do it for the whole string, you probably want to have that string be a part of a list. We've now learned how to write while loops and for loops. You might remember for loops are best when you want to iterate over a known sequence of elements. Play video starting at :3:24 and follow transcript3:24 But when you want to operate while a certain condition is true, while loops are the best choice. Next up, we've got a super useful cheat sheet for you that puts all this into one handy resource. After that, head over to the practice quiz to test your knowledge and check in on how you're doing.
gpt-5-mini

我很好，謝謝！下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理這段影片關於 for 迴圈常見錯誤與處理方式，並附上範例與實作建議，方便你馬上理解並測試。

重點：for 迴圈的常見錯誤（與解法）

  1. 不能對非[可迭代物件]使用 for

    • 錯誤示例： 
      for x in 25:  
    print(x)
      會得到 TypeError: 'int' object is not iterable。原因是整數不是序列，無法被迭代。
    • 解法視情況而定：
      • 若你想要從 0 到 24，請用 range(25)：for x in range(25)。
      • 若你想要迭代一個只含 25 的[序列]，把它放入 list：for x in [25]。

  2. 把字串當作整個元素來處理但卻被拆成字元

    • 字串是可迭代的，因此 for 會逐字處理： 
      def greet_friends(friends):  
    for name in friends:  
        print("Hi", name)  

greet_friends("Barry")  # 會逐字 -> 'B','a','r','r','y'
    • 若你想把 "Barry" 當作單一元素（整個名字）處理，要傳入包含該字串的序列，例如 ["Barry"]：
      greet_friends(["Barry"])

  3. 當函式預期接收一個[序列]參數，但呼叫時傳入單一元素，就會出問題

    • 常見情境：函式會針對檔案清單處理每個檔案，若只想處理單一檔案，仍然要把它包成 list（或其他序列）傳入。

範例示範與說明

  1. 把 25 當作範圍（0..24）
for x in range(25):  
    print(x)
  1. 把 25 當作唯一元素的序列
for x in [25]:  
    print(x)   # 只印一次 25
  1. 正確處理單一名字的 greet_friends 範例
def greet_friends(friends):  
    for name in friends:  
        print("Hi", name)  

# 多人情況  
greet_friends(["Alice", "Bob"])  

# 一人情況：仍需傳入列表  
greet_friends(["Barry"])
  1. 若你確實要逐字處理字串（有時會想這樣做）
for ch in "Barry":  
    print(ch)   # B, a, r, r, y 逐字列印

實務建議（避免與偵錯）

  • 明確文件與參數型別：若函式要處理多個元素，在文件或函式名稱上註明[接受序列（list/iterable）]。

  • 呼叫處理時保持一致性：當有可能傳入單一元素時，呼叫端負責包裝成列表（或在函式內統一處理單一元素與序列兩種情況）。

  • 在函式開始處檢查或標準化輸入：

    • 若傳入的是非序列，將其包成 list；或強烈檢查並拒絕非序列。
    • 範例： 
      def greet_friends(friends):  
    # 若傳入單一字串，將其包成 list  
    if isinstance(friends, str):  
        friends = [friends]  
    for name in friends:  
        print("Hi", name)
    • 注意：這種做法會讓單一字串被當作單一元素處理（避免逐字迭代），但若輸入可能是其他可迭代型別（如 tuple、list），要謹慎判斷型別。

  • 使用型別註解與測試（type hints + unit tests）確保函式行為一致。

小練習（快速驗證）

  1. 寫一個函式 process_items(items) 接受序列並逐項印出；測試傳入整數、單一字串、與 list，觀察結果並修改函式以符合你預期的行為。
  2. 在有可能接受單一元素或序列的函式中，實作一段標準化輸入的程式碼（如上例），並撰寫兩個測試用例：一個傳字串、一個傳 list。

要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：把上述練習寫成完整可執行程式（含測試範例）；或
  • B：示範幾種在函式入口做[輸入標準化]的實作模式（含優缺點比較）。
Welcome back. How are you feeling after the last quiz? We're starting to learn some pretty cool things that we could do in our code. Who knew loops could be so fascinating? We've now discovered two looping techniques that we could use in Python, while loops and for loops. We use while loops when we want to do an operation repeatedly while a certain condition is true, and we use for loops when we want to iterate over the elements of a sequence. Now, we're going to check out a third technique called recursion. Play video starting at ::30 and follow transcript0:30 But before we dive in, you may have noticed that this video is marked as optional. That's because while recursion is a very common technique used in software engineering, it's not used that much in automation. Still, we think it's valuable for you to know about recursion and to have an idea of how to use it. You may see it in code written by others or you may face a problem where recursion is the best way to solve it. While the next few videos are marked as optional and you won't be graded on their content, it's still super valuable stuff. Of course, feel free to skip them if you just rather focus on concepts you'll be graded on. Let's dive in. Play video starting at :1:5 and follow transcript1:05 Recursion is the repeated application of the same procedure to a smaller problem. Have you ever played with a Russian nesting doll? They're a great visual example of recursion. Each doll has a smaller doll inside it. When you open up the doll to find the smaller one inside, you keep going until you reach the smallest doll, which can't be opened. Recursion lets us tackle complex problems by reducing the problem to a simpler one. Take our Russian nesting dolls all nested inside each other and imagine we want to find out how many dolls there are in total. Play video starting at :1:36 and follow transcript1:36 We would need to open each doll one by one until we got to the last one and then count how many dolls we've opened. That's recursion in action. Here's another example with a more complex problem. Imagine you're in a line of people and you want to know how many people are in front of you. Let me tell you, I can't stand long lines. Anyway, if the line is long, it might be hard to count the people without leaving the line and losing your place. Instead, you could ask the person in front of you how many people are in front of them? Play video starting at :2:5 and follow transcript2:05 Since this person will be in the same situation as you, they'll have to ask the same question to the person in front of them, and so on and so on until the question reaches the first person in the line. This person can confidently reply that there are no people in front of them. Then the second person in line can reply one, the person behind them replies two and so on until the answer reaches you. I know the chances are pretty small that all those people would play along just so you can know where you are in line, but it's a useful way to visualize how recursion works. How does this translate into programming? Well, in programming, recursion is a way of doing a repetitive task by having a function call itself. A recursive function calls itself usually with a modified parameter until it reaches a specific condition. Play video starting at :2:52 and follow transcript2:52 This condition is called the base case. In our earlier examples, the base case would be the smallest Russian doll or the person at the front of the queue. Let's check out an example recursive function to understand what we're talking about. Here, we're defining a function called factorial. At the beginning of the function, we have a conditional block defining the base case where n is smaller than 2, it simply returns the value 1. After the base case, we have a line where the factorial function is calling itself with n-1. This is called the recursive case and this creates a loop. Play video starting at :3:28 and follow transcript3:28 Each time the function is executed, it calls itself with a smaller number until it reaches the base case. Once it reaches the base case, it returns the value 1 and then the previously called function multiplies that by two, and the previously called function multiplies it by three and so on. This loop will keep going until the first factorial function called returns the desired result. It's a bit complex. Let's add a few print statements to see exactly how this works. Here we can see the function kept calling itself until it reached the base case. After that, each function returned the value of the previous function multiplied by n until the original function returned. Play video starting at :4:14 and follow transcript4:14 Cool. Next up, we're going to check out some more examples of when to use recursion and when it's best to avoid it.
gpt-5-mini

我很好，謝謝！下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理這段影片關於遞迴（recursion）的重點、直覺說明、範例（含階乘）、何時使用與避免，以及偵錯提示，方便你快速理解並實作。

什麼是遞迴（Recursion）

  • 遞迴是讓一個函式呼叫自己來解決問題的技巧。遞迴會把複雜的問題分解為較小的同類問題，直到抵達最簡單、可直接回答的情況。
  • 必要要素：
    • 基本情況（base case）：不再遞迴、直接回傳結果的條件，避免無限遞迴。
    • 遞迴情況（recursive case）：函式呼叫自己並把問題縮小，以逐步靠近基底情況。

視覺化比喻：俄羅斯套娃（每個娃娃裡有更小的娃娃），或站隊問前面人數的例子（每個人問前面那個人），直到第一個人回傳 0。

經典範例：階乘（factorial）

  • 定義：n! = n × (n-1) × ... × 1。特別地 0! = 1。
  • 以遞迴實作的思路：
    • 基底：若 n < 2，回傳 1（處理 n == 0 或 n == 1）。
    • 遞迴：否則回傳 n * factorial(n-1)。

範例程式（含列印呼叫過程以觀察遞迴堆疊）：

def factorial(n):  
    if n < 2:          # base case  
        print(f"factorial({n}) -> 1 (base)")  
        return 1  
    print(f"factorial({n}) -> {n} * factorial({n-1})")  
    result = n * factorial(n-1)  
    print(f"factorial({n}) resolved -> {result}")  
    return result  

print(factorial(5))  # 120

說明：遞迴會一路呼叫直到 factorial(1)，然後回傳並逐層計算回來。

何時使用遞迴（優點）

  • 問題本身具有遞迴性質（可被分解為較小的同類問題）時，遞迴通常讓程式碼更直觀、易讀。例如：
    • 樹狀或圖形結構的遍歷（例如檔案系統、XML/HTML DOM、抽象語法樹）。
    • 分治演算法（merge sort、quick sort 的邏輯有遞迴性）。
    • 數學上定義為遞迴的問題（階層、費式數列、組合生成等）。
    • 某些組合列舉（例如走迷宮、回溯演算法）。

何時避免遞迴（限制與缺點）

  • 遞迴深度可能很大，導致呼叫堆疊爆掉（stack overflow）或觸發語言的最大遞迴深度限制（Python 預設約 1000 層，可用 sys.setrecursionlimit 調整但不建議任意增大）。
  • 效能問題：若遞迴重複計算相同子問題（例如未使用快取的 Fibonacci），會造成指數級成本。
  • 在某些情況下，迭代版本更有效且更安全（使用顯式迴圈或手動維護堆疊/佇列可避免系統呼叫開銷）。

優化方法：使用記憶化（memoization）或改寫為動態規劃（bottom-up）或迭代解，以避免重複計算與降低深度。

範例：費式數列（遞迴 vs 記憶化 vs 迭代）

  1. 簡單遞迴（低效）
def fib(n):  
    if n < 2:  
        return n  
    return fib(n-1) + fib(n-2)
  1. 記憶化（避免重複計算）
from functools import lru_cache  

@lru_cache(None)  
def fib_memo(n):  
    if n < 2:  
        return n  
    return fib_memo(n-1) + fib_memo(n-2)
  1. 迭代（高效且不耗深度）
def fib_iter(n):  
    a, b = 0, 1  
    for _ in range(n):  
        a, b = b, a + b  
    return a

偵錯與安全做法

  • 永遠確保有明確且可達成的基底情況（base case）。若基底條件寫錯或不可達，會變成無限遞迴（類似無限迴圈但耗盡呼叫堆疊）。
  • 對於可能深度很大的輸入，優先考慮非遞迴實作或改用尾遞迴（若語言支援尾端呼叫優化，Python 不支援尾呼叫優化）。
  • 在開發時加入列印或記錄（logging）來觀察遞迴深度與參數變化；在必要時限制輸入大小或使用防護（例如最大深度參數）。
  • 若函式有重複子問題，使用快取（memoization）或動態規劃來提升效率。

小練習（建議）

  1. 寫遞迴版的 factorial(n)，並測試 n=0,1,5。
  2. 實作 fib 的三種版本（簡單遞迴、記憶化、迭代），比較 n=30 或更大值的效能差異。
  3. 用遞迴解一個樹狀結構問題（例如計算目錄中所有檔案總大小），注意處理深度與可能的循環連結（若有 symbolic links）。

要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：把上述練習 1–3 寫成完整、可執行且附測試執行時間的程式碼；或
  • B：示範一個實際的遞迴應用（例如遞迴遍歷檔案系統計算總檔案大小），並處理常見陷阱（符號連結、最大深度保護、例外處理）。
>> By now you've seen what a recursive function looks like, how to write a base case and a recursive case. You might be wondering, why do we need recursive functions if I can just use a, for or while loop? Well, solutions to some specific problems are easier to write and understand when using recursive functions. A lot of math functions like the factorial or the sum of all the previous numbers are good examples of this. If a math function is already defined in recursive terms, it's straightforward to just write the code as a recursive function. But it's not just about math functions. Let's check out a couple of examples of how this could help an IT specialist trying to automate tasks. Play video starting at ::38 and follow transcript0:38 Let's say that you need to write a tool that goes through a bunch of directories in your computer and calculates how many files are contained in each. When listing the files inside a directory, you might find subdirectories inside them, and you'd want to count the files in those subdirectories as well. This is a great time to use recursion. The base case would be a directory with no subdirectories. For this case, the function would just return the amount of files. The recursive case would be calling the recursive function for each of the contained subdirectories. The return value of a given function call would be the sum of all the files in that directory plus all the files in the contained subdirectories. Play video starting at :1:17 and follow transcript1:17 A directory of files that can contain other directories is an example of a recursive structure, because directories can contain subdirectories that contain subdirectories that contain subdirectories, and so on. When operating over a recursive structure, it's usually easier to use recursive functions than for or while loops. Another IT focused example of a recursive structure is anything that deals with groups of users that can contain other groups. We see this situation a lot when using administrative tools like Active Directory or ldap. Say your group management software allows you to create groups that that have both users and other groups as their members, and you want to list all human users that are part of a given group. Here you would use a recursive function to go through the groups. The base case would be a group that only includes users, listing all of them. Play video starting at :2:8 and follow transcript2:08 The recursive case would mean going through all the groups contained, listing all the users in them, and then listing any users contained in the current group. It's important to call out that in some languages, there's a maximum amount of recursive calls you can use. In Python, by default, you can call a recursive function 1000 times until you reach the limit. That's fine for things like sub directories or user groups that aren't thousands of levels deep, but it might not be enough for mathematical functions like the ones we saw in the last video. Let's go back to our factorial example from the last video and try to call it with n equals 1000 factorial 1000. See that error? It's telling us that we've reached the maximum limit for recursive calls. Play video starting at :2:57 and follow transcript2:57 So while you can use recursion in a bunch of different scenarios, we only recommend using it when you need to go through a recursive structure that won't reach 1000 nested levels. All right, we've just added recursion to your growing scripting toolbox there, ready for you whenever the situation calls for it.
gpt-5-mini

你做得很好，把遞迴（recursion）放進工具箱是很實用的。下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理這段影片的重點、實作示範（含遞迴處理目錄與群組的例子）、以及在 Python 中的限制與建議，方便你在實務中判斷何時用遞迴、怎麼寫、以及如何避免常見問題。

重點回顧

  • 遞迴（recursion）適合處理[遞迴結構]（recursive structures）：例如目錄（directory）會包含子目錄、或群組（group）會包含子群組。
  • 在這種結構上，遞迴常比迴圈更直觀：把問題拆成[處理當前節點]與[處理所有子節點]兩部分。
  • 基本概念回顧：每個遞迴函式都有 base case（基底）和 recursive case（遞迴情況）。
  • Python 預設遞迴深度限制約 1000 層（可用 sys.getrecursionlimit() 查詢、sys.setrecursionlimit() 調整，但任意調高風險較大）。因此只建議在不會超過此深度的遞迴結構上使用遞迴。

範例 1：遞迴計算某目錄下檔案總數（含子目錄）

  • 說明：對於每個目錄，我們計算該目錄的檔案數，再遞迴進入每個子目錄，把子目錄的檔案數加總回來。
  • 注意：示範版包含對符號連結（symlink）的簡單處理，避免無限循環；實務中可依需加強例外處理與權限處理。

範例程式（概念代碼）：

import os  

def count_files(path, seen_dirs=None):  
    if seen_dirs is None:  
        seen_dirs = set()  
    try:  
        real = os.path.realpath(path)  
    except OSError:  
        return 0  

    # 避免因符號連結或循環造成無限遞迴  
    if real in seen_dirs:  
        return 0  
    seen_dirs.add(real)  

    total = 0  
    try:  
        with os.scandir(path) as it:  
            for entry in it:  
                if entry.is_file(follow_symlinks=False):  
                    total += 1  
                elif entry.is_dir(follow_symlinks=False):  
                    total += count_files(entry.path, seen_dirs)  
    except PermissionError:  
        # 權限不足則略過或視需求處理  
        pass  
    except FileNotFoundError:  
        pass  

    return total  

# 範例呼叫  
print(count_files("/path/to/directory"))

要點：

  • 用 os.scandir() 提高效能與節省資源。
  • 使用 realpath + seen set 避免符號連結造成循環。
  • 捕捉 PermissionError、FileNotFoundError 等例外以穩健運行。

範例 2：遞迴列出群組中的所有使用者（群組可包含子群組）

  • 問題：一個群組可以包含使用者與其他群組。要列出某群組下的所有[人類使用者]，需要遞迴展開子群組。
  • 假設我們有兩個查詢函式：is_user(member) 與 get_group_members(group)（分別回傳是否為使用者，以及回傳該群組的成員清單）。

示意程式：

def list_users_in_group(group, seen_groups=None):  
    if seen_groups is None:  
        seen_groups = set()  
    if group in seen_groups:  
        return set()  
    seen_groups.add(group)  

    users = set()  
    members = get_group_members(group)  # 假設回傳名稱或物件列表  
    for m in members:  
        if is_user(m):  
            users.add(m)  
        else:  # m 是子群組  
            users.update(list_users_in_group(m, seen_groups))  
    return users

要點：

  • 加入 seen_groups 防止循環群組（group A 包含 group B，group B 又包含 group A）造成無限遞迴。
  • 回傳集合（set）可避免重複使用者。
  • 若底層系統查詢有成本，可在外層加入快取機制以減少重複呼叫。

Python 的遞迴深度限制與建議

  • Python 預設最大遞迴深度大約是 1000（可用 sys.getrecursionlimit() 查）。超過會丟出 RecursionError。
  • 若你的樹狀深度很深（例如上千層），遞迴就不適合，應改用迭代+顯式堆疊（stack）或 BFS/DFS 的非遞迴實作。
  • 儘量不用調高 recursion limit 來[強行支援]深度，除非你確定系統資源與呼叫堆疊安全，並了解風險。

範例：把上面計算目錄檔案的遞迴改寫為顯式堆疊的非遞迴版本：

import os  

def count_files_iterative(root):  
    total = 0  
    seen = set()  
    stack = [root]  

    while stack:  
        path = stack.pop()  
        try:  
            real = os.path.realpath(path)  
        except OSError:  
            continue  
        if real in seen:  
            continue  
        seen.add(real)  

        try:  
            with os.scandir(path) as it:  
                for entry in it:  
                    if entry.is_file(follow_symlinks=False):  
                        total += 1  
                    elif entry.is_dir(follow_symlinks=False):  
                        stack.append(entry.path)  
        except (PermissionError, FileNotFoundError):  
            continue  

    return total

優點：不受 Python 呼叫堆疊深度限制；可在深度非常大的結構上安全運行。

實務建議總結

  • 當資料結構本身是遞迴（目錄、群組、樹）且深度受限（遠小於 ~1000）時，遞迴通常最直觀且可讀。
  • 若結構可能非常深或有循環，採用：
    • 顯式堆疊的迭代實作，或
    • 在遞迴中加入循環檢測（seen set）、例外處理與深度上限檢查，並視需要快取查詢結果。
  • 對需要高效能且有重複子問題的遞迴（例如某些數學問題），使用記憶化或動態規劃（bottom-up）以避免指數時間。

想要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：把[目錄檔案計數]與[群組使用者展開]的範例寫成完整可執行範例（含模擬資料或 stub 函式、以及測試與輸出示範）；或
  • B：將其中一個遞迴範例改寫成非遞迴（顯式堆疊）版本，並做簡單效能比較（用小型模擬資料）。

Now that we have the basics of syntax out of the way, we can start growing our Python knowledge, which will let us do more and more interesting operations. Remember, one of our main goals in this course is to help you learn to write short Python scripts that automate actions. 下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理你剛貼的影片內容重點（從語法複習過渡到下一章：資料型別），並補充學習建議與下一步實作練習，方便你快速銜接後續課程內容與實務練習。

影片重點摘要

  • 恭喜你已掌握基本語法要素：函式、條件判斷（if/else）、while 與 for 迴圈，還有遞迴（recursion）。這些是寫自動化腳本的核心工具。
  • 接下來課程會深入介紹 Python 中幾種非常實用的資料型別／資料結構：
    • 字串（strings）——之前已經用過，但功能遠不止基本輸入輸出；
    • 串列（lists）——可變的序列，能儲存有順序的一組元素；
    • 字典（dictionaries）——鍵值對（key:value）結構，適合快速查找與描述性資料。
  • 這些資料結構在日常自動化腳本中極為常見與重要，值得花時間熟悉何時使用與常見操作。

為什麼這些資料型別重要（實務觀點）

  • 字串：大量自動化任務會處理檔名、日誌、命令輸出、網頁與 API 回傳的文字；熟練字串操作可節省大量處理時間。
  • 列表：用來收集多個項目（例如檔案清單、使用者清單、任務序列）。支援切片、串接、過濾、排序等豐富操作。
  • 字典：用來描述結構化資料（例如使用者屬性、設定選項、映射表），查找速度快且語意清楚。

建議的學習與練習步驟（短期可執行）

  1. 字串進階：

    • 練習：字串拼接、格式化（f-string）、split/join、strip、replace、正規表示式（簡介）。
    • 實作練習：解析一段日誌（log）字串，擷取時間、等級、訊息欄位並列印成表格。

  2. 列表深度：

    • 練習：索引、切片（slice）、append/extend/insert/pop/remove、list comprehension（串列生成式）。
    • 實作練習：讀取一個目錄的檔案名稱到 list，過濾出特定副檔名並排序。

  3. 字典與集合：

    • 練習：建立字典、以鍵存取、用 dict.get() 安全取值、巢狀字典、使用 set 去重。
    • 實作練習：把一組使用者資料（姓名、email、群組）轉成字典索引，或統計各群組人數。

  4. 綜合練習（結合三者）：

    • 讀取 CSV 檔（或模擬的逗號分隔字串），把每列資料解析成 dict，存入 list，然後做搜尋與匯總（例如找出特定條件的所有記錄）。

簡短參考範例（示意）

  • 字串格式化：
name = "Alice"  
age = 30  
print(f"{name} is {age} years old.")
  • 列表過濾（list comprehension）：
files = ["a.txt", "b.py", "c.md"]  
py_files = [f for f in files if f.endswith(".py")]
  • 字典儲存與查詢：
user = {"name": "Bob", "email": "bob@example.com"}  
print(user.get("email"))

若要我幫你延伸其中某一部分，以下任選一項我可以立即提供完整範例與練習：

  • A：字串進階教學（含正規表示式範例）與 3 個實戰練習題與解答。
  • B：列表深度操作與 list comprehension 詳解（含實作範例：檔案過濾與排序）。
  • C：字典與集合實務（含巢狀字典處理、合併字典、群組統計範例）。
  • D：把 A+B+C 整合成一個小專案範例（例如從模擬 CSV 讀入資料，解析、過濾、彙總並輸出結果）。

你想從哪一項開始？

By now, we've used strings in a lot of examples, but we haven't spent time looking at them in detail yet. Before we dive into the nitty gritty, though, let's go over what we've seen so far and add a few more points. First, a quick refresher. A string is a data type in Python that's used to represent a piece of text. It's written between quotes, either double quotes or single quotes, your choice. It doesn't matter which type of quotes you use, as long as they match. If we mix up double and single quotes, Python won't be too happy, and it'll return a syntax error, telling us it couldn't find the end of the string. Play video starting at ::36 and follow transcript0:36 A string can be as short as zero characters, usually called an empty string, or really long. We also learned that we can use strings to build longer strings using the plus sign, an action called concatenating. A less common operation is to multiply the string by a number which multiplies the content of the string that many times, like this. If we want to know how long a string is, we can use the len function, which we saw in earlier videos. The len function tells us the number of characters contained in the string. We can use strings to represent a lot of different things. They can hold a username, the name of a machine, an email address, the name of a file, and any other text. Play video starting at :1:25 and follow transcript1:25 A lot of the data that we'll interact with will be stored in strings, so it's important to know how to use them. There are tons of things we could do with strings in our scripts. For example, we can check if files are named a certain way by looking at the file name and seeing if they match our criteria. Or we can create a list of emails by checking out the users of our system and concatenating our domain. I recently wrote a script that worked with a bunch of files and took different actions according to the name of each file. So if the file ended in a certain extension, say txt, then my script would print it. If the file had a certain string in the name, say test, then my script would ignore it and move on to the next thing, and so on. Play video starting at :2:8 and follow transcript2:08 The contents of a text file are also strings. A few months ago, I had to change the default values for a bunch of configuration options from true to false. So I wrote a function that would find the string true in a file and replace it with false. You can probably think of more examples where your code needs to handle strings, but to use strings effectively, we need to know what options are available to us in Python. In the next few videos, we'll cover some of the operations we can perform over strings, including how to access parts of them and modify them.
gpt-5-mini

下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理這段影片關於字串（strings）的重點、常見操作與實務範例，並附上可直接執行的參考程式碼與練習題，幫你快速掌握字串在自動化腳本中的常見用途。

重點回顧：什麼是字串

  • 字串（string）是 Python 中表示文字的資料型別，用引號包起來（單引號或雙引號皆可，但需成對）：
    • "hello"、'world'。
  • 空字串是長度為 0 的字串："" 或 ''。
  • 字串可很長，能表示使用者名稱、檔名、email、檔案內容等各種文字資料。

基本操作（示範程式碼）

  • 串接（concatenation）：
a = "Hello, "  
b = "Alice"  
print(a + b)  # Hello, Alice
  • 重複（multiplication）：
print("ha" * 3)  # hahaha
  • 長度（len）：
s = "Python"  
print(len(s))  # 6

常見字串檢查與變形（實務常用）

  • 檔名與副檔名檢查（endswith / startswith / in）：
fname = "report.txt"  
if fname.endswith(".txt"):  
    print("Text file")  
if "test" in fname:  
    print("Contains 'test'")
  • 取代（replace）：
content = "enable_feature = true"  
new = content.replace("true", "false")  
print(new)  # enable_feature = false
  • 切割與合併（split / join）：
line = "alice,bob,charlie"  
names = line.split(",")   # -> ["alice","bob","charlie"]  
print(",".join(names))    # -> "alice,bob,charlie"
  • 去除空白（strip / lstrip / rstrip）：
s = "  hello\n"  
print(s.strip())  # "hello"
  • 大小寫轉換：
print("AbC".lower())  # "abc"  
print("AbC".upper())  # "ABC"

進階提示（實務中很有用）

  • 若要安全比對不在意大小寫，先轉成統一大小寫（.lower() 或 .upper()）。
  • 檢查副檔名與檔案路徑操作建議使用 os.path 或 pathlib，而不是單純字串操作，以避免平台差異問題。
  • 當要處理大量或複雜的文字解析時（例如 log 解析、格式化輸入），考慮使用正規表示式（re 模組）。

範例（用 pathlib 檢查副檔名）：

from pathlib import Path  
p = Path("logs/error.log")  
if p.suffix == ".log":  
    print("log file")

實務範例情境

  • 批次處理檔案：根據副檔名對檔案採取不同動作（搬移、刪除、解析）。
  • 產生 email 列表：從使用者名稱串接公司網域。
  • 批次修改設定檔：在多個配置檔中把 "true" 換為 "false"（注意避免誤替換無關字串，最好用更精準的匹配或正規表示式）。
  • 解析指令輸出或日誌：以文字操作擷取關鍵欄位。

實作示例：把目錄中所有 .conf 檔案內的 "enabled = true" 改為 "enabled = false"（示意）：

from pathlib import Path  

for p in Path("/etc/myapp").glob("*.conf"):  
    text = p.read_text()  
    new = text.replace("enabled = true", "enabled = false")  
    if new != text:  
        p.write_text(new)  
        print("Updated", p)

（注意：實際執行前請先備份或在測試環境試跑）

小練習

  1. 寫一個函式 clean_name(s) 將檔名轉為小寫、去掉前後空白，並把空格改為底線。
  2. 實作一個函式 find_and_replace_in_files(path, pattern, repl)：遍歷 path 下的所有 .txt 檔，將 pattern 替換為 repl，並回傳被修改檔案的清單。
  3. 解析一段模擬日誌：給定 "2025-08-13 ERROR Failed to start service" 類型的行，寫程式把日期、等級、訊息分割並輸出成 dict。

想要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：把練習 1–3 寫成完整可執行程式並示範輸出；或
  • B：教你使用正規表示式（re）做更精準的字串搜尋與替換，並附 3 個實務範例；或
  • C：示範 pathlib/os.path 與字串操作在檔案處理上的最佳實務（包含備份策略與測試建議）。
When we first came across the four loops, we called out that we can iterate over a string character by character. But what if we want to access just a specific character or characters? We might want to do this, for example, if we have a text that's too long to display, and we want to show just a portion of it, or if we want to make an acronym by taking the first letter of each word in a phrase. We can do that through an operation called string indexing. This operation lets us access the character in a given position or index using square brackets and the number of the position we want, like this. This might seem confusing at first, like Python is acting up. We're asking for the first character, and it's giving us the second. What gives Python? Play video starting at ::45 and follow transcript0:45 Well, what's happening here is that Python starts counting indexes from zero, not one, just like it does with the range function. So if we want the first character, we need to access the one at index zero. Knowing that indexes start at zero, which one do you think will be the last index in the string? It'll always be one less than the length of the string. In this case, our string has six characters, so the last index will be five. Let's try it out. We see that the character in position five is the last character of the string. Play video starting at :1:25 and follow transcript1:25 And if we try to access index six, we get an index error telling us that it's out of range. We can only go up to length minus one. What if you want to print the last character of a string, but you don't know how long it is. You can do that using negative indexes. Let's see that in a different example. In this example, we don't know the length of the string, but it doesn't matter. Using negative indexes lets us access the positions in the string starting from the last. Play video starting at :2:4 and follow transcript2:04 Nice. On top of accessing individual characters, we can also access a slice of a string. A slice is the portion of a string that can contain more than one character, also sometimes called a substring. We do that by creating a range using a colon as a separator. Let's see an example of this. The range we use when accessing a slice of a string works just like the one created by the range function. It includes the first number but goes up to one less than the last number. Play video starting at :2:41 and follow transcript2:41 In this case, we start with Index 1, the second letter of the string, and go up to index three, the fourth letter of the string. Another option for the range is to include only one of the two indexes. In that case, it's assumed that the other index is either zero for the first value or the length of the string for the second value. Check this out. Accessing the slice from nothing to four takes the first four characters of the string. Index is zero to three. Accessing the slice from four to nothing takes everything from index four onward. Play video starting at :3:31 and follow transcript3:31 All of this indexing might seem confusing at first. Don't worry. We all took time to wrap our heads around it. Just like all the challenges we've come across so far, the key is to keep practicing until you master it. There are a bunch of exercises ahead to help you with that. Now that we know how to select, slice, and access the parts of the string we want, we're going to learn how to modify them. That's coming up next.
gpt-5-mini

下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理影片內容關於字串索引與切片的重點、範例、常見錯誤與練習題，並補充實務小技巧，讓你快速上手字串位置存取與子字串操作。

重點摘要

  • 字串可以逐字元迭代，但若要取特定位置的字元，可以使用索引（indexing）：用方括號和位置數字，例如 s[0]。
  • Python 的索引從 0 開始：s[0] 是第一個字元，最後一個字元的索引是 len(s) - 1。
  • 超出範圍會發生 IndexError。
  • 支援負索引：s[-1] 是最後一個字元，s[-2] 是倒數第二個，依此類推。
  • 切片（slice）可以取得子字串：s[start:stop]，包含 start，但不包含 stop（類似 range 的行為）。
  • 切片可以省略 start 或 stop：s[:n] 表示從開頭到 n-1；s[n:] 表示從 n 到結尾；s[:] 則複製整個字串。
  • 切片也可以使用步進（step）：s[start:stop:step]，例如 s[::2] 取得偶數索引的字元。

範例與說明

  1. 基本索引
s = "Python"  
print(s[0])   # 'P'（第一個字元）  
print(s[5])   # 'n'（最後一個字元，因為 len(s) == 6）  
# print(s[6])  # IndexError: string index out of range
  1. 負索引
s = "Python"  
print(s[-1])  # 'n'  
print(s[-2])  # 'o'
  1. 切片（slice）
s = "abcdef"  
print(s[1:4])   # 'bcd'  包含索引 1,2,3；不包含 4  
print(s[:4])    # 'abcd' 相當於 s[0:4]  
print(s[4:])    # 'ef'   相當於 s[4:len(s)]  
print(s[:])     # 'abcdef' 完整複製
  1. 步進（step）
s = "abcdefg"  
print(s[::2])   # 'aceg'  每隔一個字元取一個  
print(s[1::2])  # 'bdf'   從索引1開始，每隔兩個取一個  
print(s[::-1])  # 'gfedcba'  反轉字串（常用技巧）

常見錯誤與注意事項

  • 忘記索引從 0 開始，導致 off-by-one（少一或多一）錯誤。
  • 存取超出範圍會丟 IndexError。切片則較安全：超出範圍的切片不會丟錯，只會回傳可用範圍的子字串。
    例：s[2:100] 若 s 長度小於 100，會回傳從索引2到結尾的子字串，而不會出錯。
  • 對 Unicode 字元（如某些 emoji 或合成字元）要小心：某些字元在內部可能佔用多個 code unit（在 Python 的 str 中通常以 code point 為單位，但與外部編碼交互時需注意）。簡單操作通常沒問題，但在處理複雜文字（例如 grapheme cluster）時需使用專門函式庫。

實務技巧

  • 取得最後一個字元：s[-1]，比寫 s[len(s)-1] 更直觀。
  • 反轉字串：s[::-1]（便利且常用）。
  • 取每個單字的首字母做縮寫（acronym）：
phrase = "Portable Network Graphics"  
acronym = "".join(word[0].upper() for word in phrase.split())  
print(acronym)  # 'PNG'
  • 當需要固定欄位取子字串（例如解析固定寬度記錄）時，切片很方便。若欄位是以分隔符分隔（例如 CSV），則宜先 split() 再取元素。

練習題（建議手動嘗試）

  1. 寫一個函式 first_and_last(s) 回傳 (s[0], s[-1])，處理空字串時回傳 (None, None)。
  2. 實作 truncate(s, n)：如果 s 長度超過 n，回傳 s[:n-3] + "..."（確保結果長度不超過 n），否則回傳原字串。
  3. 給定一段字串，寫一行程式取出從第 3 個字元（含）到倒數第 3 個字元（不含）的子字串，並每隔 2 個字元取一個。
    • 提示：用 s[2:-3:2]（注意邊界情況）。

範例解答（參考）：

def first_and_last(s):  
    if not s:  
        return None, None  
    return s[0], s[-1]  

def truncate(s, n):  
    if len(s) <= n:  
        return s  
    if n <= 3:  
        return "." * n  
    return s[:n-3] + "..."

需要我幫你做哪一項延伸？

  • A：把練習題 1–3 寫成完整測試程式並示範多組輸入輸出；或
  • B：示範用切片與分割（split）實作常見文字處理任務（如生成縮寫、截短顯示、多語言反轉等）；或
  • C：說明 Unicode 與 Python 字串的進階議題（例如 emoji、合成字元與 grapheme cluster 的處理），並示範實務解法（含第三方套件）。
In the last video, we saw how to access certain characters inside a string. Now, what if we wanted to change them? Imagine you have a string with a character that's wrong and you want to fix it like this one. Taking into account what you learned about string indexing, you might be tempted to fix it by accessing the corresponding index and changing the character. Let's see what happens if we try that. Oops, these pesky type errors. In this case, we're told that strings don't support item assignment. Play video starting at ::37 and follow transcript0:37 This means that we can't change individual characters because strings in Python are immutable, which is just a fancy word meaning they can't be modified. What we can do is create a new string based on the old one like this. Nice. We fixed the typo. But does this mean the message variable can never change? Not really. We can assign a new value to the same variable. Play video starting at :1:16 and follow transcript1:16 Let's do that a couple of times to see how it works. What we're doing here is giving the message variable a whole new value. We're not changing the underlying string that was assigned to it before. We're assigning a whole new string with different content. If this seems a bit complex, that's okay. You don't need to worry about this right now. We'll call this out whenever it's relevant for the program we're writing. Play video starting at :1:52 and follow transcript1:52 We figured out how to create a new message from the old one, but how are we supposed to know which character to change? Let's try something different. In this case, we're using a method to get the index of a certain character. A method is a function associated with a specific class. We'll talk a lot more about classes and methods later. For now, what you need to know is that this is a function that applies to a variable, and we can call it by following the variable with a dot. Let's try this a few more times. Play video starting at :2:43 and follow transcript2:43 The index method returns the index of the given substring inside the string. The substring that we pass can be as long or as short as we want. What if there's more than one of the substring? Here, we know there are two S characters, but we only get one value. That's because the index method returns just the first position that matches. What happens if the string doesn't have the substring we're looking for? The index method can't return a number because the substring isn't there, so we get a value error instead. Play video starting at :3:20 and follow transcript3:20 We said that if the substring isn't there, we would get an error. How can we know if a substring is contained in a string to avoid the error? Let's check this out. We can use the keyword in to check if a substring is contained in a string. We came across the keyword in when using for loops. In that case, it was used for iteration. Here, it's a conditional that can be either true or false. Play video starting at :3:54 and follow transcript3:54 It'll be true if the substring is part of the string and false if it's not. Here, the dragons substring isn't part of the string, and sadly we can't have a dragon as a pet. We just covered a bunch of new things, and you're doing awesome. Let's put all this stuff together to solve a real-world problem. Imagine that your company has recently moved to using a new domain, but a lot of the company email addresses are still using the old one. You want to write a program that replaces this old domain with the new one in any outdated email addresses. The function to replace the domain would look like this. Play video starting at :4:32 and follow transcript4:32 This function is a bit more complex than others, so let's go through it line by line. First, we define the replace domain function, which accepts three parameters : the email address to be checked, the old domain, and the new domain. Having all these values as parameters instead of directly in the code makes our function reusable. We aren't just changing one domain to the other. We have a function that will work with all domains. Pretty sweet. In the first line of the body of the function, we check if the concatenation of the at sign and the old domain are contained in the email address using the keyword in. Play video starting at :5:10 and follow transcript5:10 We check this to make sure the email has old domain on the portion that comes after the at sign. If the condition is true, the email address needs to be updated. To do that, we first find out the index where the old domain, including the at sign, starts. We know that this index will be a valid number because we've already checked that the substring was present. Using this index, we create the new email. This is a string that contains the first portion of the old email up until the index we had calculated, followed by the at sign and the new domain. Finally, we return this new email. Play video starting at :5:49 and follow transcript5:49 If the email didn't contain the new domain, then we can just return it, which is what we do in the last line. Wow. That was a really complex function with a lot of new things in it, so don't worry if you're finding it a bit tricky. Rewatch the video and take your time. If there's a specific part that's tripping you up, remember, you can always ask your fellow learners for help in the discussion forum. You may even find that someone has asked and got the answer to the same question already. When you feel ready to move on, meet me over in the next video, where we're going to learn a lot more handy string methods.
