下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理影片重點、示範程式碼（含你要的 replace-domain 範例）、常見錯誤說明與練習題，幫你把[字串不可變（immutable）]與[如何修改字串內容]的觀念釐清並實作可重複使用的函式。

重點整理

  • Python 的 str 是不可變（immutable）的，不能透過索引直接改變個別字元（例如 s[0] = "x" 會跑出 TypeError）。
  • 要[修改]字串，必須建立新的字串（通常透過切片、串接、或使用字串方法），然後把新字串指派回原變數（變數可以重新指向不同的字串）。
  • 字串有許多便利的方法（如 index、find、replace、in、split、join、upper、lower… 等）可以用來搜尋、切割、替換與建構新字串。
  • index(sub) 會回傳子字串第一次出現的位置，但若找不到會丟 ValueError。find(sub) 則在找不到時回傳 -1（比較安全）。
  • 運用 in 可先檢查子字串是否存在，以避免 index() 拋錯。

replace_domain 範例（影片中所示邏輯）

以下函式會檢查 email 是否使用 old_domain（注意要檢查 '@' + old_domain，避免在使用者名稱部分誤判），若是的話就回傳替換過 domain 的新 email，否則回傳原 email。

def replace_domain(email, old_domain, new_domain):  
    # 檢查是否在 '@' 後使用了 old_domain  
    target = "@" + old_domain  
    if target in email:  
        start = email.index(target)  # safe 因為我們已檢查過存在  
        # 保留 email 開頭到 start（不含 start），再接上 '@' + new_domain  
        new_email = email[:start] + "@" + new_domain  
        return new_email  
    return email

範例使用：

print(replace_domain("alice@oldcorp.com", "oldcorp.com", "newcorp.io"))  
# 輸出: alice@newcorp.io  

print(replace_domain("bob@other.com", "oldcorp.com", "newcorp.io"))  
# 輸出: bob@other.com  （沒改變）

備註：若要更保險，可改用 split 或更嚴謹的 email 解析（例如處理多個 @ 或驗證格式）。

更穩健的實作建議

  1. 用 find() 代替 index()，避免可能的 ValueError：
def replace_domain_safe(email, old_domain, new_domain):  
    target = "@" + old_domain  
    pos = email.find(target)  
    if pos != -1:  
        return email[:pos] + "@" + new_domain  
    return email
  1. 若想更精準只改[domain 部分]，不讓使用者名稱內包含相同字串誤判，可以以最後一個 '@' 為分界（處理包含多個 '@' 的異常字串）：
def replace_domain_by_split(email, old_domain, new_domain):  
    if "@" not in email:  
        return email  # 或視需求丟錯  
    local, domain = email.rsplit("@", 1)  
    if domain == old_domain:  
        return f"{local}@{new_domain}"  
    return email
  1. 若需處理大量 email，或想處理錯誤格式、空白、大小寫差異，可加上預處理與驗證（例如 strip(), lower() 或正規表示式）。

為何 index() 會丟錯？如何避免

  • index() 在找不到子字串時會拋 ValueError。避免方法：
    • 先用 in 檢查子字串是否存在（as in 影片）；或
    • 使用 find()，會在找不到時回傳 -1；或
    • 在 try/except 中捕捉 ValueError。

其他常用字串方法（與修改字串相關）

  • replace(old, new)：回傳把所有 old 替換成 new 的新字串（不會改變原字串）。
    • "aabb".replace("a", "x") -> "xxbb"
  • split(sep) / join(iterable)：切割與合併字串。
  • strip()/lstrip()/rstrip()：去除頭尾空白。
  • upper()/lower()/capitalize()/title()：大小寫轉換。
  • format 或 f-string：格式化輸出（建立新字串）。

範例：把 email list 中舊 domain 批次替換：

emails = ["a@old.com", "b@new.com", "c@old.com"]  
updated = [replace_domain_by_split(e, "old.com", "new.com") for e in emails]  
print(updated)  # ['a@new.com', 'b@new.com', 'c@new.com']

練習題（建議練習）

  1. 寫一個函式 normalize_email(email)：去除前後空白、把 domain 轉小寫，但保留 local-part 原本大小寫。
  2. 實作一個函式 bulk_replace_domain(emails, old, new)：接受 email 的 list，回傳替換過後的 list，並回傳被修改的數量。
  3. 實作一個更嚴謹的 replace_domain_validated(email, old, new)：先用簡單正規表示式驗證 email 格式，再執行替換，若格式錯誤回傳 None 或丟例外。

需要我幫你做哪一項？

  • A：把上面三個練習寫成完整可執行的程式並示範測試輸出（含邊界情況）；或
  • B：示範如何用正規表示式更嚴格地解析與驗證 email（並把 replace_domain 與驗證結合）；或
  • C：把 replace-domain 的批次替換整合成一個實用腳本（讀取檔案或標準輸入、輸出報表與備份），並提供安全運行建議。
We said earlier that we had a lot of new exciting concepts coming up. Well, I'm not going to string you along anymore. We're going to tie up our lessons on strings with a bunch of fun methods for transforming our string text. I know. My jokes are pretty terrible, so let's get back to the good stuff. So far, we've seen ways you can access portions of strings using the indexing technique, create new strings by slicing and concatenating, find characters in strings using the index method, and even test if one string contains another. On top of all this string processing power, the string class provides a bunch of other methods for working with text. Play video starting at ::38 and follow transcript0:38 Now we'll show you how to use some of these methods. Remember, the goal is not for you to memorize all of this. Instead, we want to give you an idea of what you can do with strings in Python. Some string methods let you perform transformations or formatting on the string text, like upper and its opposite, lower. These methods are really useful when you're handling user input. Let's say you wanted to check if the user answered yes to a question. How would you know if the user typed it using upper or lowercase? Play video starting at :1:8 and follow transcript1:08 You don't need to. You just transform the answer to the case you want, like this example. Another useful method when dealing with user input is the strip method. This method will get rid of surrounding spaces in the string. If we ask the user for an answer, we usually don't care about any surrounding spaces. It's a good idea to use the strip method to get rid of any white space. This means that strip doesn't just remove spaces, it also removes tabs and new line characters, which are all characters we don't usually want in user-provided strings. Play video starting at :1:50 and follow transcript1:50 There are two more versions of this method L strip and R strip to get rid of the white space characters just to the left or to the right of the string instead of both sides. Other methods give you information about the string itself. The method count returns how many times a given sub-string appears within a string. The method ends with returns whether the string ends with a certain sub-string. The method is numeric returns whether the strings made up of just numbers. Adding to that, if we have a string that is numeric, we can use the int function to convert it to an actual number. In earlier videos, we show that we can concatenate strings using the plus sign. Play video starting at :2:43 and follow transcript2:43 The join method can also be used for concatenating. To use the join method, we have to call it on the string that will be used for joining. In this case, we're using a string with a space in it. The method receives a list of strings and returns one string with each of the strings joined by the initial string. Let's check out another example. Finally, we can also split a string into a list of strings. The split method returns a list of all the words in the initial string, and it automatically splits by any white space. Play video starting at :3:48 and follow transcript3:48 It can optionally take a parameter and split the strings by another character, like a comma or a dot. Are you starting to see how these string methods could be useful in your IT job? We've just learned a bunch of new methods, but there are tons more that you can use on strings. We've included a list with the ones we talked about and some new ones in the next cheat sheet. You'll also find a link to the full Python documentation there, which gives you all the info on each available method. As we've said before, don't worry about trying to memorize everything. You'll pick these concepts up with practice, and the documentation is always there if you need it. Play video starting at :4:25 and follow transcript4:25 Alright. Last up in our string of string videos, we're going to check out how to format strings.
gpt-5-mini

下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理這段影片關於字串方法（string methods）的重點、常用範例與實務建議，並附上練習題與一張快速參考清單，方便你在自動化腳本中快速應用這些方法。

重點摘要

  • 除了索引與切片之外，Python 的 str 類別提供許多內建方法，用來轉換、檢查、切割與合併字串。
  • 常見用途包括：標準化使用者輸入、去除不必要空白、檢查內容、把字串拆成清單或把清單合併成字串、以及判斷字串特性（是否以某子字串結尾、是否全為數字等）。
  • 不必全部背下來，先熟悉常用方法，遇到需求再查文件即可。

重要方法與範例

  1. 大小寫轉換：upper(), lower(), title(), capitalize()
s = "Yes"  
print(s.lower())  # "yes"  
print(s.upper())  # "YES"  
print("hello world".title())  # "Hello World"

用途：標準化使用者輸入（例如接受 "YES", "Yes", "yes" 都視為同一答案）。

  1. 去除空白：strip(), lstrip(), rstrip()
s = "  answer \n"  
print(s.strip())   # "answer"  
print(s.lstrip())  # 去左邊空白  
print(s.rstrip())  # 去右邊空白

用途：處理來自輸入或檔案的多餘空白、換行與 tab。

  1. 計數與查找：count(), find(), index()
s = "abracadabra"  
print(s.count("a"))   # 5  
print(s.find("cad"))  # 回傳起始索引或 -1（找不到）  
# index() 也回傳起始索引，但找不到會丟 ValueError

用途：判斷子字串出現次數或位置；用 find() 比較安全避免例外。

  1. 開頭/結尾檢查：startswith(), endswith()
fname = "report.txt"  
print(fname.endswith(".txt"))   # True  
print(fname.startswith("log_")) # False

用途：依副檔名或前綴處理檔案、過濾輸入等。

  1. 數字檢查：isnumeric() / isdigit() / isdecimal()
s = "12345"  
print(s.isnumeric())  # True  
n = int(s)            # 轉成整數

用途：驗證是否可以安全轉型為數值。

  1. 分割與合併：split(), join()
line = "alice bob charlie"  
words = line.split()        # ["alice","bob","charlie"]  
csv = ",".join(["a","b","c"])  # "a,b,c"  
# split 可以接受參數 split(",")，也可指定 maxsplit

用途：解析列資料、處理空白分隔或特定分隔符號；join 用於把多個字串合成一個。

  1. 替換：replace()
s = "enabled = true"  
print(s.replace("true", "false"))  # "enabled = false"

用途：批次修改檔案內容或字串中的某些詞彙。注意：replace 會替換所有符合的子字串（必要時用更精準的方法或正規表示式）。

實務建議

  • 處理使用者輸入時，先使用 strip() 去除首尾空白，再視需要做 lower() 或 upper() 做不分大小寫比較。
  • 對於檔案副檔名檢查，建議搭配 pathlib 或 os.path（例如 Path.suffix）以避免平台差異問題。
  • 當要做精準的取代（避免部分字串誤替換）時，考慮使用正規表示式（re.sub）或先用 split/join 確定邊界。
  • find() 在找不到時回傳 -1，比 index() 更安全；若一定要用 index()，可先用 in 或 try/except 包裹。
  • join 的呼叫者是[分隔字串]，例如 " ".join(list)，這點常被初學者搞混。

快速參考清單（常用）

  • 轉換：s.lower(), s.upper(), s.title(), s.capitalize()
  • 去空白：s.strip(), s.lstrip(), s.rstrip()
  • 檢查：s.startswith(prefix), s.endswith(suffix), substring in s
  • 查找：s.find(sub), s.index(sub), s.count(sub)
  • 分割/合併：s.split(sep=None), sep.join(iterable)
  • 替換：s.replace(old, new)
  • 檢測數字：s.isnumeric(), s.isdigit(), s.isdecimal()

練習題（建議練習）

  1. write a function normalize_answer(ans)：

    • 去除首尾空白，轉小寫，並把多重空白縮成單一空格。
    • 例如 " YES Sir " -> "yes sir"。

  2. write a function anonymize_emails(text)：

    • 將 text 中出現的 email（簡單以包含 "@" 且由空白或標點分隔判斷）用 "[redacted]" 取代。提示：可先用 split() 與判斷包含 "@"，或用正規表示式做得更好。

  3. 實作一個 log_parser(line)：

    • 給定 "2025-08-13 ERROR Failed to start" 這類型的字串，回傳 dict：{"date":"2025-08-13","level":"ERROR","msg":"Failed to start"}，對不同數量空白與多詞訊息能穩健處理（提示：可用 split(maxsplit=2)）。

若要，我可以：

  • A：把上面 1–3 題寫成完整程式碼並示範多組測試輸出；或
  • B：示範如何用 re（正規表示式）把 email 偵測與取代做得更精準，並包含範例；或
  • C：整理一張更完整的 string method cheat-sheet（含 less-common methods 與簡短說明）。

你想選哪一項延伸？

to convert numbers into strings so that we can concatenate them too. This works, but it's not ideal, especially when the operations you want to do with the string are on the tricky side. There's a better way to do this using the format method. Let's see a couple of examples. In this example, we have two variables name and number. We generate a string that has those variables in it by using the curly brackets placeholder to show where the variables should be written. We then pass the variables as a parameter to the format method. Play video starting at ::53 and follow transcript0:53 See how it doesn't matter that name is a string and number is an integer. The format method deals with that, so we don't have to. Pretty neat. The curly brackets aren't always empty. By using certain expressions inside those brackets, we can take advantage of the full power of the format expression. Heads up. This can get complex fast. Play video starting at :1:14 and follow transcript1:14 If at any point you get confused, don't panic, you only really need to understand the basic usage of the format method we just saw. One of the things we can put inside the curly brackets is the name of the variable we want in that position to make the whole string more readable. This is particularly relevant when the text can get rewritten or translated and the variables might switch places. In our earlier example, we could rewrite the message to make the variables appear in a different order. In that case, we'd need to pass the parameters to format in a slightly different way. Because we're using placeholders with variable names, the order in which the variables are passed to the format function doesn't matter. But for this to work, we need to set the names we're going to use and assign a value to them inside the parameters to format. Play video starting at :2:8 and follow transcript2:08 That's just the tip of the iceberg of what we can do with the format method. Want to dive a little deeper? Great. Let's keep on going. We're going to check out a different example. Let's say you want to output the price of an item with and without tax. Depending on what the tax rate is, the number might be a long number with a bunch of decimals. Play video starting at :2:29 and follow transcript2:29 If something costs $7.5 without tax, and the tax rate is 9%, the price with tax would be $8.175. First off, ouch. Also, since there's no such thing as half a penny anymore, that number doesn't make sense. To fix this, we can make the format function print only two decimals like this. In this case, between the curly brackets, we're writing a formatting expression. There are a bunch of different expressions we can write. These expressions are needed when we want to tell Python to format our values in a way that's different from the default. Play video starting at :3:24 and follow transcript3:24 The expression starts with a colon to separate it from the field name that we saw before. After the colon, we write.2f. This means we're going to format a float number and that there should be two digits after the decimal dot. No matter what the price is, our function always prints two decimals. Remember when we did the table to convert from Fahrenheit to Celsius temperatures, our table looked ugly because it was full of float numbers that had way too many decimal digits. Using the format function, we can make it look a lot nicer. In these two expressions, we're using the greater than operator to align text to the right so that the output is neatly aligned. Play video starting at :4:6 and follow transcript4:06 In the first expression, we're saying we want the numbers to be aligned to the right for a total of three spaces. In the second expression, we're saying we want the number to always have exactly two decimal places, and we want to align it to the right at six spaces. We can use string formatting like this to make the output of our program look nice and also to generate useful logging and debugging messages. Over the course of my SIS Admin career, I've grown used to formatting strings to create more informative error messages. They help me understand what's going on with a script that's failing. There's a ton more formatting options you can use when you need them, but don't worry about learning them all at once. We'll explain any others as they come along and we'll put everything in a cheat sheet that you can refer to whenever you need a formatting expression. Play video starting at :4:52 and follow transcript4:52 Let's take a look at that now, and then we'll have a quiz to help you get more familiar with all this new knowledge.
gpt-5-mini

下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理影片中關於字串格式化（format 方法）與格式化表達式的重點、常見用法、範例與實務建議，並附上練習題與參考對照，方便你快速掌握如何用格式化生成可讀性高且排版整齊的輸出。

重點摘要

  • str.format() 可以在字串中使用大括號 {} 作為佔位符，把變數或運算結果插入字串，省去手動把數字轉成字串再串接的麻煩。
  • 大括號內可放位置、變數名稱或格式化說明（format spec），例如 {0}、{name}、{value:.2f}。
  • 若使用命名佔位符（{name}），則傳入 format 的參數可以是關鍵字參數，參數順序就不重要，非常適合文字需要被翻譯或重新排序的情況。
  • 格式說明（format spec）從冒號 : 開始，例如 :.2f 表示將數值格式化為浮點數並保留兩位小數。格式化還可包含寬度、對齊、填充字元等選項，能讓表格或數值對齊更整齊好讀。

基本用法範例

  1. 最簡單的佔位符（位置參數）
name = "Alice"  
number = 5  
msg = "Hello {}, you have {} new messages".format(name, number)  
# Hello Alice, you have 5 new messages
  1. 命名參數（可任意順序）
msg = "Hello {user}, your score is {score}".format(score=95, user="Bob")  
# Hello Bob, your score is 95
  1. 格式說明（小數位數）
price = 7.5  
tax_rate = 0.09  
total = price * (1 + tax_rate)  # 8.175  
s = "Total: ${:.2f}".format(total)  
# Total: $8.18
  1. 欄位寬度與對齊
  • 語法：{field:fill_align_width.precisiontype}
    • fill：填充字元（可省略，預設空白）
    • align：對齊方式 <（左）、>（右）、^（置中）
    • width：欄位寬度（整數）
    • precision/type：視型別而定，如 .2f（浮點數小數點後2位）
items = [("apple", 0.5), ("banana", 1.25)]  
for name, price in items:  
    print("{:>10} : ${:6.2f}".format(name, price))  
#      apple : $  0.50  
#     banana : $  1.25

上例中 name 被設定成寬度 10 且靠右（>10），price 被格式化為 6 字元寬（含小數點與小數位），且保留兩位小數。

進階提示（常用格式參考）

  • 整數、浮點數與小數點控制：{:d}, {:f}, {:.2f}
  • 對齊與填充：{:>8}（右對齊至寬度8），{:_<10}（左對齊、以底線填滿到寬度10）
  • 千分位分隔（Python 3）：{:,} -> 在數字中加入逗號分隔 1000000 -> '1,000,000'
  • 以百分比顯示：{:.1%} -> 0.123 -> '12.3%'
  • 名稱取代與複雜表達式：大括號內可以放變數名稱，或在 format() 中傳入 dict 再用 ** 解包："{name} {age}".format(**person)

範例（千分位與百分比）：

val = 1234567.891  
print("{:,.2f}".format(val))     # "1,234,567.89"  
rate = 0.075  
print("{:.1%}".format(rate))     # "7.5%"

為什麼用 format 比手動轉型好？

  • 自動處理不同型別（int、float、str）而不必呼叫 str()。
  • 可控制輸出格式（小數位、對齊、寬度、填充、千分位等），讓輸出一致且易讀。
  • 使用命名參數能讓模板字串更可讀、可維護，也利於國際化（翻譯）時變數重排。

備註：從 Python 3.6 起，f-string（格式 f"...{var:.2f}"）提供更直觀且效能較好的格式化方式，功能與 format 類似且語法更簡潔。例：f"Total: ${total:.2f}"

範例：顯示商品價格表（對齊與兩位小數）

products = [("Pen", 1.2), ("Notebook", 2.5), ("Eraser", 0.25)]  
print("{:<15} {:>8}".format("Item", "Price"))  
for name, price in products:  
    print("{:<15} ${:7.2f}".format(name, price))

輸出：
Item Price
Pen 1.20Notebook 1.20 Notebook 1.20Notebook 2.50
Eraser $ 0.25

練習題（建議練習）

  1. 寫一個函式 format_invoice(items, tax_rate)，items 是 (name, price) 的 list，輸出對齊的發票（每項顯示兩位小數），最後顯示 subtotal、tax 與 total（千分位格式與兩位小數）。
  2. 將下列資料用 format 或 f-string 排成表格，名字欄左對齊 20、分數右對齊 5 並保留一位小數：students = [("Alice", 91.234), ("Bob", 88), ("Cathy", 95.6)]。
  3. 練習使用命名佔位符寫一個提示字串，例如 "Dear {title} {last}, your balance is {bal:.2f}"，並示範如何用 dict 與 ** 解包填入資料。

需要我幫你做哪一項延伸？

  • A：把練習題 1–3 寫成完整範例程式並示範多組輸出（含 f-string 版本）；或
  • B：把常見的 format 規格整理成一張更完整的對照表（包含填充、對齊、寬度、精度、型別字元如 d,f,s,%,, 等）；或
  • C：示範如何把 format/f-string 用在日誌/錯誤訊息與國際化（i18n）模板中（含實務注意事項）。
def student_grade(name, grade): return "{} recevied {}% on the exam".format(name, grade) print(student_grade("Reed", 80)) print(student_grade("Paige", 92)) print(student_grade("Jesse", 85)) 上面程式輸出後出現下面錯誤: Here is your output: Reed recevied 80% on the exam Paige recevied 92% on the exam Jesse recevied 85% on the exam Not quite. The correct return line should be "return {} received {}% on the exam".format(name,grade)"
gpt-5-mini

你貼的程式能正常執行並輸出結果；問題其實是字串內英文單字拼錯（"recevied" 應為 "received"），以及你最後一段想表達的正確字串格式化寫法有些排版上的誤會。我把正確且較清晰的版本給你，並說明兩個可能的改法（單行與多行字串）。

正確且簡潔的單行實作：

def student_grade(name, grade):  
    return "{} received {}% on the exam".format(name, grade)  

print(student_grade("Reed", 80))  
print(student_grade("Paige", 92))  
print(student_grade("Jesse", 85))

輸出：
Reed received 80% on the exam
Paige received 92% on the exam
Jesse received 85% on the exam

如果你想要把回傳字串寫成跨行字面值（例如為了可讀性），可用三引號或在換行處用反斜線；但通常不建議在訊息中硬換行，除非就是要換行顯示。兩種示例：

  1. 用三引號（會包含換行字元）：
def student_grade(name, grade):  
    return """{} received {}% on the exam""".format(name, grade)

（這和單行等價，但若在三引號內換行就會在結果中出現換行）

  1. 用字串連接寫成可讀的多行程式碼（結果仍為單行）：
def student_grade(name, grade):  
    return ("{} received {}% on the exam"  
            .format(name, grade))

備註與延伸：

  • 更現代也更直觀的寫法是使用 f-string（Python 3.6+）：
def student_grade(name, grade):  
    return f"{name} received {grade}% on the exam"
  • 若希望 grade 以整數格式顯示（避免小數），可以格式化為整數： f"{grade:d}" 或 "{:d}".format(grade)。

需要我把程式改成 f-string 版本、或幫你把訊息支援不同的格式（例如對齊或固定小數位）嗎？

String Formatting You can use the format method on strings to concatenate and format strings in all kinds of powerful ways. To do this, create a string containing curly brackets, {}, as a placeholder, to be replaced. Then call the format method on the string using .format() and pass variables as parameters. The variables passed to the method will then be used to replace the curly bracket placeholders. This method automatically handles any conversion between data types for us. If the curly brackets are empty, they’ll be populated with the variables passed in the order in which they're passed. However, you can put certain expressions inside the curly brackets to do even more powerful string formatting operations. You can put the name of a variable into the curly brackets, then use the names in the parameters. This allows for more easily readable code, and for more flexibility with the order of variables. You can also put a formatting expression inside the curly brackets, which lets you alter the way the string is formatted. For example, the formatting expression {:.2f} means that you’d format this as a float number, with two digits after the decimal dot. The colon acts as a separator from the field name, if you had specified one. You can also specify text alignment using the greater than operator: >. For example, the expression {:>3.2f} would align the text three spaces to the right, as well as specify a float number with two decimal places. String formatting can be very handy for outputting easy-to-read textual output.
gpt-5-mini

下面以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理你貼的[String Formatting]說明，並補充範例與常見用法，讓你快速理解並能實際運用 format 的各種功能。

字串格式化（str.format）重點整理

  • 使用大括號 {} 作為佔位符，在字串上呼叫 .format(...) 並傳入變數，變數會依位置或名稱填入佔位符。format 會自動處理基本型別轉換（如 int、float、str）。
  • 空的大括號 {}：依傳入順序填入參數。
  • 命名佔位符 {name}：可在 format(...) 中以關鍵字參數傳入，參數順序不重要，程式較易讀且利於翻譯或重新排列變數位置。
  • 格式說明（format spec）：可以在大括號內用冒號 : 接上格式化表達式，例如 {:.2f} 表示以浮點數格式顯示並保留兩位小數。冒號左邊可放欄位名稱或索引，右邊放格式說明。
  • 對齊與寬度：可以指定欄位寬度與對齊方式，例如 {:>8} 表示右對齊到 8 個字元寬；結合精度可寫成 {:>6.2f} 表示總寬 6、右對齊、顯示兩位小數。
  • 格式化常用於產生易讀的表格、金額顯示、百分比、千分位等。

範例

  1. 位置佔位符（依順序填入）
"Hello {}, you have {} new messages".format("Alice", 3)  
# "Hello Alice, you have 3 new messages"
  1. 命名佔位符（可任意順序）
"Hello {user}, score: {score}".format(score=95, user="Bob")  
# "Hello Bob, score: 95"
  1. 小數位數與欄位對齊
price = 7.5  
tax = 0.09  
total = price * (1 + tax)  # 8.175  

print("Total: ${:.2f}".format(total))       # "Total: $8.18"  
print("{:>10} : ${:8.2f}".format("Item", total))  
# 右對齊欄位寬度與兩位小數
  1. 常見進階示例
num = 1234567.891  
print("{:,.2f}".format(num))   # "1,234,567.89"（千分位與兩位小數）  
rate = 0.075  
print("{:.1%}".format(rate))   # "7.5%"（百分比格式）

format 規格速查（常用）

  • 型別：d（整數）、f（浮點數）、s（字串）
  • 精度： .2f（小數點後兩位）
  • 寬度： {:8}（至少 8 個字元）
  • 對齊： <（左）、>（右）、^（置中） 如 {:^10}
  • 填充字元： {:_>10}（以底線填充並右對齊）
  • 千分位： {:,}
  • 百分比： {:.1%}

語法範例：{field_name:fillalignwidth.precisiontype}

小建議

  • 若使用 Python 3.6+，f-string（f"...{var:.2f}"）更簡潔、可讀且效能較好，建議優先使用。
  • 對於國際化（i18n）或需要動態重排變數位置的範本，使用命名佔位符較安全。
  • 當格式變化多或模板複雜時，將模板字串獨立出來可提高維護性。

想要我幫你做哪一項延伸？

  • A：將以上範例改寫成 f-string 版本並說明差異；或
  • B：示範一個發票/帳單列印函式（用格式化對齊、千分位與小數位）；或
  • C：整理一張更完整的 format spec 對照表（包含 less-common options）。
As you know by now, Python comes with a lot of ready to use data types. We've seen integers, floats, booleans, and strings in detail, but those data types can only take you so far. Eventually, in your scripts, you'll want to develop code that manipulates collections of items, like a list of strings representing all the file names in a directory, or a list of integers representing the size of network packets. This is where the list data type comes in handy. You can think of lists as long boxes with the space inside the box divided up into different slots. Each slot can contain a different value. Like we mentioned earlier, when we first came across a list in Python, we use square brackets to indicate where the list starts and ends. Play video starting at ::44 and follow transcript0:44 Let's check out an example. Here, we've created a new variable called X and set its contents to be a list of strings. We can check the type of X using the type function we saw a little while ago. Nice. Python tells us this is a list in the same way we've done with other variables. We can show the contents of the whole list using the print function. The length of the list is how many elements it has. Play video starting at :1:19 and follow transcript1:19 To get that value, we'll use the same len function we used for strings. That's right, our list has four elements. When calling len for the list, it doesn't matter how long each string is on its own. What matters is how many elements the list has. To check if a list contains a certain element, you can use the keyword in like in these examples. Again, when we used this with strings, the result of this check is a Boolean, which we can use as a condition for branching or looping. We can also use indexing to access individual elements, depending on their position in the list. Play video starting at :2:3 and follow transcript2:03 To do that, we use the square brackets and the index we want to access, exactly like we did with strings. Remember that the first element is given the index 0. This means the last index of the list will be the length of the list minus 1. What happens if we try to access an element after the end of the list? You might have seen this coming. We get an index error, we can't go over the end of the list. Remember that because list indexes start at 0, accessing the item at index 4 means we're trying to access the fifth element in the list. Play video starting at :2:42 and follow transcript2:42 There are only four elements, so we're out of range if we try to access the index number four. Does this seem a bit confusing? If it does, this visualization might help you out. As you can see, index 4 doesn't point at anything. Since there's no slot four in our list, as with strings, we can also use indexes to create a slice of the list. For this, we use ranges of two numbers separated by a colon. Again, the second element isn't included in the slice, so the range goes to the second index minus 1. Play video starting at :3:15 and follow transcript3:15 Here we start at index 1 and go up to 1 less than 3, which is 2. We can also leave out one of the range indexes empty. The first value defaults to 0 and the second value to the length of the list. Make sense? If all this sounds really familiar to what we said about strings, then this course is working as intended. That's because strings and lists are very similar data types. In Python, strings and lists are both examples of sequences. Play video starting at :3:45 and follow transcript3:45 There are other sequences too, and they all share a bunch of operations like iterating over them, using for loops, indexing, using the len function to know the length of the sequence, using plus to concatenate two sequences, and using in to verify if the sequence contains an element. So this is great news. While understanding indexing is hard, once you know it for one data type, you've pretty much mastered it for every data type. So you actually know way more than you thought. Wow, now we're really cooking. Next up, we're going to look at some more list operations, this time actually specific to lists.
deepseek-chat

以下以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理 Python 列表（List）的核心概念、與字串的異同、基本操作與進階技巧，並附上範例與練習題，幫助你快速掌握這個重要的資料結構。

Python 列表（List）核心概念

  • 列表是什麼？
    列表是一個可變（mutable）且有序的序列，用方括號 [] 表示，元素之間用逗號分隔。可以存放不同類型的資料（如整數、字串、甚至其他列表）。

    x = ["file1.txt", "file2.log", 42, True]  # 混合類型的列表

  • 與字串的異同

    • 相同點：
      • 都是序列（sequence），支援索引（x[0]）、切片（x[1:3]）、len()、in 檢查、+ 串接、* 重複。
      • 索引從 0 開始，超出範圍會拋 IndexError。
    • 不同點：
      • 列表可變（可修改元素），字串不可變（需創建新字串）。
      • 列表可以存放任意類型，字串只能存字符。

列表基本操作

1. 創建與存取

files = ["a.txt", "b.log", "c.csv"]  
print(files[0])    # "a.txt"（第一個元素）  
print(files[-1])   # "c.csv"（最後一個元素）  
print(files[1:3])  # ["b.log", "c.csv"]（切片，不包含結束索引）

2. 檢查元素是否存在

if "a.txt" in files:  
    print("Found!")  # 輸出：Found!

3. 修改列表（可變性）

files[1] = "backup.log"  # 修改第二個元素  
files.append("d.zip")    # 追加元素到末尾  
files.insert(0, "new")   # 在索引 0 插入元素

4. 常用方法

方法說明範例
append(x)在末尾追加元素files.append("e.pdf")
extend(iterable)合併另一個列表files.extend(["f.doc", "g.xls"])
remove(x)刪除第一個匹配的元素files.remove("a.txt")
pop([i])移除並返回索引 i 的元素（預設最後一個）last = files.pop()
sort()原地排序（可自訂 key 和 reverse）files.sort(key=lambda x: x.lower())
reverse()反轉列表順序files.reverse()

進階技巧

1. 列表生成式（List Comprehension）

快速生成列表的簡潔語法：

squares = [x**2 for x in range(5)]  # [0, 1, 4, 9, 16]  
filtered = [f for f in files if f.endswith(".txt")]  # 過濾出 .txt 文件

2. 深拷貝 vs. 淺拷貝

  • 淺拷貝（copy() 或 list[:]）：只複製一層，嵌套列表仍共享引用。
  • 深拷貝（import copy; copy.deepcopy(x)）：完全獨立複製。 
    nested = [[1, 2], [3, 4]]  
shallow = nested.copy()  
shallow[0][0] = 99  # 會修改 nested 的內容！

3. 列表與迭代

for idx, file in enumerate(files):  
    print(f"Index {idx}: {file}")

常見錯誤與陷阱

  1. 索引越界：

    files = ["a.txt", "b.log"]  
print(files[2])  # IndexError: list index out of range

  2. 修改列表時迭代：
    避免在迭代中直接修改列表（如刪除元素），建議改用生成式或反向迭代。

    # 錯誤示範（可能跳過元素或越界）  
for f in files:  
    if f.endswith(".log"):  
        files.remove(f)  
# 正確做法  
files = [f for f in files if not f.endswith(".log")]

  3. 可變預設參數：
    函數的預設參數如果是列表，會共享同一對象！應改用 None 並在函數內初始化。

    def add_item(item, lst=None):  
    if lst is None:  
        lst = []  
    lst.append(item)  
    return lst

練習題

  1. 過濾與轉換：
    寫一個函式 filter_and_upper(files)，過濾出 .txt 結尾的文件並將檔名轉大寫。

    def filter_and_upper(files):  
    return [f.upper() for f in files if f.endswith(".txt")]

  2. 列表扁平化：
    將嵌套列表 [[1, 2], [3, 4]] 轉換為一維列表 [1, 2, 3, 4]。

    nested = [[1, 2], [3, 4]]  
flat = [num for sublist in nested for num in sublist]

  3. 統計頻率：
    用字典統計列表中各元素的出現次數（例如 ["a", "b", "a", "c"] → {"a": 2, "b": 1, "c": 1}）。

    from collections import Counter  
freq = Counter(["a", "b", "a", "c"])

需要我幫你深入哪一部分？

  • A：列表生成式的高級用法（如多重循環、條件嵌套）；
  • B：列表與其他資料結構（如元組、集合、字典）的轉換與應用場景；
  • C：實際案例（如處理檔案列表、網路封包分析）的完整程式碼示範。
Lists in Python are defined using square brackets, with the elements stored in the list separated by commas: my_list = ["This", "is", "a", "list"]. You can use the len() function to return the number of elements in a list: len(my_list) would return 4. You can also use the in keyword to check if a list contains a certain element. If the element is present, it will return a True boolean. If the element is not found in the list, it will return False. For example, "This" in my_list would return True in our example. Similar to strings, lists can also use indexing to access specific elements in a list based on their position. You can access the first element in a list by doing my_list[0], which would allow you to access the string "This". In Python, lists and strings are quite similar. They’re both examples of sequences of data. Sequences have similar properties, like (1) being able to iterate over them using for loops; (2) support indexing; (3) using the len function to find the length of the sequence; (4) using the plus operator + in order to concatenate; and (5) using the in keyword to check if the sequence contains a value. Understanding these concepts allows you to apply them to other sequence types as well.
deepseek-chat

以下以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理 Python 列表（List）與字串（String）的相似性與核心操作，並補充實用範例與常見應用場景，幫助你快速掌握序列的通用操作與列表特性。

Python 列表（List）與字串（String）的相似性

1. 共同特性（序列操作）

  • 索引（Indexing）：從 0 開始，支援負索引（-1 表示最後一個元素）。

    my_list = ["This", "is", "a", "list"]  
my_str = "Hello"  
print(my_list[0])   # "This"  
print(my_str[-1])   # "o"

  • 切片（Slicing）：[start:end:step]，不包含 end 索引。

    print(my_list[1:3])   # ["is", "a"]  
print(my_str[1:4])    # "ell"

  • 長度（len()）：返回元素數量或字符數。

    print(len(my_list))   # 4  
print(len(my_str))    # 5

  • 成員檢查（in）：檢查元素或子字串是否存在。

    print("is" in my_list)   # True  
print("ell" in my_str)   # True

  • 串接（+）：合併兩個同類型序列。

    new_list = my_list + ["too"]   # ["This", "is", "a", "list", "too"]  
new_str = my_str + " World"    # "Hello World"

  • 迭代（for 迴圈）：遍歷元素或字符。

    for word in my_list:  
    print(word)  
for char in my_str:  
    print(char)

2. 關鍵差異

特性列表（List）字串（String）
可變性可修改（如 my_list[0] = "That"）不可修改（需創建新字串）
內容類型可混合（如 [1, "a", True]）僅字符
專屬方法append(), pop(), sort() 等upper(), split(), replace() 等

列表專屬操作（可變性應用）

1. 修改元素

my_list[0] = "That"   # 修改第一個元素 → ["That", "is", "a", "list"]

2. 動態調整

my_list.append("!")       # 追加元素 → ["That", "is", "a", "list", "!"]  
my_list.insert(1, "was")  # 插入 → ["That", "was", "is", "a", "list", "!"]  
my_list.pop(2)           # 移除並返回索引 2 的元素（"is"）

3. 排序與反轉

numbers = [3, 1, 4, 2]  
numbers.sort()          # 原地排序 → [1, 2, 3, 4]  
numbers.reverse()       # 反轉 → [4, 3, 2, 1]

實用範例

1. 過濾與轉換

files = ["a.txt", "b.log", "c.csv"]  
txt_files = [f.upper() for f in files if f.endswith(".txt")]  # ["A.TXT"]

2. 統計元素頻率

from collections import Counter  
words = ["apple", "banana", "apple", "cherry"]  
freq = Counter(words)   # {"apple": 2, "banana": 1, "cherry": 1}

3. 列表扁平化

nested = [[1, 2], [3, 4]]  
flat = [num for sublist in nested for num in sublist]  # [1, 2, 3, 4]

常見陷阱

  1. 淺拷貝問題：

    a = [[1, 2], [3, 4]]  
b = a.copy()  
b[0][0] = 99   # 會同時修改 a 的內容！應改用 `copy.deepcopy()`

  2. 迭代中修改列表：

    # 錯誤示範（可能跳過元素）  
for item in my_list:  
    if condition:  
        my_list.remove(item)  
# 正確做法：生成新列表或反向迭代  
my_list = [item for item in my_list if not condition]

練習題

  1. 合併與去重：
    將兩個列表合併並去除重複元素（如 [1, 2, 3] 和 [3, 4, 5] → [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]）。

    list1 = [1, 2, 3]  
list2 = [3, 4, 5]  
unique = list(set(list1 + list2))  # 轉集合去重

  2. 分組計數：
    給定一個字串列表 ["apple", "banana", "apple", "cherry"]，統計每個單詞的長度分布（如 {5: 2, 6: 1, 7: 1}）。

    words = ["apple", "banana", "apple", "cherry"]  
length_counts = {}  
for word in words:  
    length = len(word)  
    length_counts[length] = length_counts.get(length, 0) + 1

  3. 矩陣轉置：
    將二維列表 [[1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6]] 轉置為 [[1, 3, 5], [2, 4, 6]]。

    matrix = [[1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6]]  
transposed = list(zip(*matrix))  # [(1, 3, 5), (2, 4, 6)]

需要進一步探討哪個主題？

  • A：列表生成式的高級用法（如條件嵌套、多重迴圈）；
  • B：列表與其他資料結構（如字典、集合）的交互應用；
  • C：實際案例（如 CSV 解析、檔案批次處理）的完整程式碼示範。
One of the ways that lists and strings are different is that lists are mutable, which is another fancy word to say that they can change. This means we can add, remove, or modify elements in a list. Let's go back to our example of thinking of a list as a long box. Changing the list means we keep the same box and we add, remove, or change the elements inside that box. We'll now go through the methods that let us modify the list one by one. If all these details seem a little overwhelming, that's okay. As usual, there will be a cheat sheet at the end, and you'll have lots of chances to practice each of these methods as we go along. Play video starting at ::40 and follow transcript0:40 You don't need to learn all those by heart. And of course you can always review anything that isn't clear. So don't worry, we've got your back. We'll start with the simplest change, adding an element to a list using the append method. Let's check this out. In the tastiest example yet, the append method adds a new element at the end of the list. It doesn't matter how long the list is, the element always gets added to the end. Play video starting at :1:21 and follow transcript1:21 You could start with an empty list and add all of its items using append. If you want to insert an element in a different position instead of at the end, you can use the insert method. The insert method takes an index as the first parameter and an element as the second parameter. It adds the element at that index in the list. To add it as the first element, we use index zero and we can use any other number. What happens if we use a number larger than the length of the list? Woo-hoo, no errors. Play video starting at :2:15 and follow transcript2:15 You can say that it even worked just peachy. If we use an index higher than the current length, the element just gets added to the end. You can pass any number to insert, but usually you either add at the beginning using Insert at the zero index, or at the end using Appendix. We can also remove elements from the list. We can do it using the value of the element we want to remove. Can you guess what method we would use? You got it, use the remove method. Play video starting at :2:56 and follow transcript2:56 The remove method removes from the list the first occurrence of the element we passed to it. What happens if the element is not in the list? Oof, that went pear shaped. We got a value error telling us the element isn't in the list. Another way we can remove elements is by using the POP method, which receives an index. The POP method returns the element that was removed at the index that was passed. And the last way to modify the contents of a list is to change an item by assigning something else to that position. Play video starting at :3:45 and follow transcript3:45 Like this. Wow, [LAUGH] the contents of our fruits variable have changed a lot since we started this video. But it's always the same variable, the same box. We've just modified what's inside Modifying the contents of lists will come up in tons of scripts as we operate with them. If the list contains hosts on a network, you could add or remove hosts as they come online or offline. If the list contains users authorized to run a certain process, you could add or remove users when permissions are granted or removed, and so on. You've now seen a number of methods that let us modify the contents of a list, adding, removing, and changing the elements that are stored inside the list. Play video starting at :4:42 and follow transcript4:42 Whenever you need to write a program that'll handle a variable amount of elements, you'll use a list. What if you need a sequence of a fixed amount of elements? That's coming up in our next video.
deepseek-chat

以下以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理 Python 列表（List）的**可變性（Mutability）**與其核心修改方法，並附上實用範例、陷阱提醒與應用場景，幫助你安全且高效地操作列表。

列表的可變性（Mutability）與修改方法

1. 可變性是什麼？

  • 列表是可變物件（mutable），意味著可以直接修改其內容（增刪改元素），而無需創建新列表。
  • 對比字串（不可變）：每次修改字串都會產生新物件，而列表修改是[就地（in-place）]操作。
# 字串（不可變）  
s = "hello"  
s[0] = "H"  # TypeError: 'str' object does not support item assignment  

# 列表（可變）  
lst = [1, 2, 3]  
lst[0] = 99  # 合法 → [99, 2, 3]

2. 修改列表的四大操作

(1) 追加元素：append() 與 insert()

方法行為範例輸出
append(x)在末尾追加元素 xlst.append(4)[1, 2, 3, 4]
insert(i, x)在索引 i 處插入 xlst.insert(1, 99)[1, 99, 2, 3]

注意：

  • insert 的索引超出範圍時，元素會自動追加到末尾（不會報錯）。
  • 若需高效頻繁插入，考慮改用 collections.deque（尤其頭部插入）。

(2) 移除元素：remove() 與 pop()

方法行為範例輸出
remove(x)刪除第一個匹配的 xlst.remove(2)[1, 3]
pop([i])移除並返回索引 i 的元素（預設最後一個）lst.pop(0)[2, 3]（返回 1）

陷阱：

  • remove 若找不到元素會拋 ValueError，建議先檢查 if x in lst。
  • 在迴圈中直接 remove 可能導致跳過元素（見下方範例）。

(3) 直接賦值修改

lst = [1, 2, 3]  
lst[1] = 99  # 修改索引 1 → [1, 99, 3]

3. 實用範例與場景

範例 1：動態維護網路主機列表

hosts = ["host1", "host2"]  
hosts.append("host3")          # 新增主機  
hosts.remove("host1")          # 移除離線主機  
hosts[0] = "host2_updated"     # 更新主機名

範例 2：安全移除多個元素

# 錯誤：在迴圈中直接 remove 會跳過元素  
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 2, 4]  
for num in numbers:  
    if num == 2:  
        numbers.remove(num)  # 結果可能是 [1, 3, 4]（漏刪）  

# 正確做法：生成新列表或反向迭代  
numbers = [num for num in numbers if num != 2]  # 列表生成式

範例 3：堆疊（Stack）與佇列（Queue）模擬

# 堆疊（後進先出）  
stack = []  
stack.append(1)  # push  
stack.pop()      # pop  

# 佇列（先進先出，使用 deque 更高效）  
from collections import deque  
queue = deque(["a", "b"])  
queue.append("c")  # enqueue  
queue.popleft()    # dequeue

進階注意事項

1. 淺拷貝（Shallow Copy）問題

a = [[1, 2], [3, 4]]  
b = a.copy()       # 淺拷貝  
b[0][0] = 99       # 會同時修改 a 的內容！  
print(a)           # [[99, 2], [3, 4]]  

# 解決方案：深拷貝  
import copy  
b = copy.deepcopy(a)

2. 效能考量

  • 頻繁頭部插入：insert(0, x) 時間複雜度為 O(n)，建議改用 deque（O(1)）。
  • 合併列表：extend() 或 += 比 + 更高效（後者會創建新物件）。

練習題

  1. 移除所有偶數：
    寫一個函式 remove_evens(lst)，原地移除列表中所有偶數（不返回新列表）。

    def remove_evens(lst):  
    lst[:] = [x for x in lst if x % 2 != 0]  # 使用切片賦值修改原列表

  2. 合併有序列表：
    將兩個已排序列表 [1, 3, 5] 和 [2, 4, 6] 合併為一個有序列表（禁止用 sort()，需手動實現）。

    def merge_sorted(a, b):  
    result = []  
    i = j = 0  
    while i < len(a) and j < len(b):  
        if a[i] < b[j]:  
            result.append(a[i])  
            i += 1  
        else:  
            result.append(b[j])  
            j += 1  
    result.extend(a[i:] + b[j:])  
    return result

  3. 處理嵌套列表：
    寫一個函式 flatten(nested)，將任意深度的嵌套列表（如 [1, [2, [3]]]）轉換為一維列表（[1, 2, 3]）。

    def flatten(nested):  
    result = []  
    for item in nested:  
        if isinstance(item, list):  
            result.extend(flatten(item))  
        else:  
            result.append(item)  
    return result

需要進一步探討哪個主題？

  • A：列表與其他可變物件（如字典、集合）的交互陷阱；
  • B：高效列表操作的底層原理（如記憶體管理、時間複雜度）；
  • C：實際案例（如批次處理日誌、動態配置管理）的完整程式碼示範。
As we called out before, there are a number of data types in Python that are all sequences. Strings are sequences of characters and are immutable. Lists are sequences of elements of any type and are mutable. A third data type that's a sequence and also closely related to lists is the tuple. Tuples are sequences of elements of any type that are immutable. We write tuples in parentheses instead of square brackets. You might be wondering, why do we even need another sequence type? Weren't lists great? Play video starting at ::35 and follow transcript0:35 Yes, lists are great, they can hold any number of elements, and we can add, remove, and modify their contents as much as we want. But there are cases when we want to make sure an element in a certain position or index refers to one specific thing and won't change. In these situations, lists won't help us. Thanks for nothing lists. In our example, we have a tuple that represents someone's full name. The first element of the tuple is the first name. The second element is the middle initial, and the third element is the last name. Play video starting at :1:8 and follow transcript1:08 If we add another element somewhere in there, what would that element represent? It would just be confusing, and our code wouldn't know what to do with it. And that's why modifying isn't allowed. In other words, when using tuples, the position of the elements inside the tuple have meaning. Tuples are used for lots of different things in Python. One common example is the return value of functions. When a function returns more than one value, it's actually returning a tuple. Play video starting at :1:37 and follow transcript1:37 Remember the function to convert seconds to hours, minutes, and seconds that we saw a while back? Here it is to remind you. This function returns three values, in other words, it returns a tuple of three elements. Let's give it a try. We see the result is a tuple. What if we print it? We see that it has the three elements we expect it to have. Play video starting at :2:11 and follow transcript2:11 Remember, since this is a tuple, the order matters. The first element represents the hours, the second one represents the minutes, and the third represents the seconds. One interesting thing we can do with tuples is unpack them. This means that we can turn a tuple of three elements into three separate variables. Because the order won't change, we know what those variables represent. Like this. Now we've split the tuple into three separate values. Play video starting at :2:51 and follow transcript2:51 We've seen before that we can also do this directly when calling the function without the intermediate result variable. In Python, it's really common to use tuples to represent data that has more than one value and that needs to be kept together. For example, you could use a tuple to have a file name and its size, or you could store the name and email address of a person, or a date and time and the general health of a system at any point in time. Can you see how these different data types could help you automate some of your IT work? Pretty cool. Knowing when to use tuples and when to use lists can seem a little fuzzy at first. But don't worry, it'll get clearer as we tackle more examples.
deepseek-chat

以下以繁體中文、Markdown 格式整理 Python **元組（Tuple）**的核心特性、與列表（List）的對比、實際應用場景與進階技巧，幫助你理解何時該使用元組而非列表。

Python 元組（Tuple）核心概念

1. 基本定義

  • 不可變（Immutable）序列：一旦創建，內容無法修改（無 append、remove 等方法）。

  • 用圓括號 () 表示（可省略括號，逗號才是關鍵）：

    tuple1 = ("Alice", "B", "Chen")  # 明確寫法  
tuple2 = "Alice", "B", "Chen"    # 省略括號（仍為元組）  
single_tuple = ("Only",)         # 單元素元組需加逗號（避免與字串混淆）

  • 與列表的差異：

    特性元組（Tuple）列表（List）
    可變性❌ 不可變✅ 可變
    語法() 或逗號分隔[]
    效能記憶體占用較小，迭代稍快修改操作靈活但效能開銷較大
    用途固定結構資料（如座標、資料庫記錄）動態集合（如待辦事項、暫存資料）

2. 為何需要元組？

  • 確保資料完整性：防止意外修改（如系統配置、常數集合）。
  • 作為字典的鍵：因元組不可變，可哈希（hashable），而列表不行。 
    valid_dict = {("host1", "port80"): "service"}  # 合法  
invalid_dict = {["host1", "port80"]: "service"}  # TypeError: unhashable type
  • 函式多返回值：隱式返回元組，可直接解包（unpack）到變數。 
    def get_time():  
    return 9, 30, 0  # 隱式返回元組 (9, 30, 0)  

hours, minutes, seconds = get_time()  # 解包賦值

元組操作與應用場景

1. 基本操作

  • 索引與切片：與列表相同（因為同屬序列）。

    name = ("Alice", "B", "Chen")  
print(name[0])    # "Alice"  
print(name[1:])   # ("B", "Chen")

  • 成員檢查：in 關鍵字。

    print("B" in name)  # True

  • 拼接與重複：+ 和 *（生成新元組，非就地修改）。

    full_name = name + ("PhD",)  # ("Alice", "B", "Chen", "PhD")

2. 解包（Unpacking）

  • 直接解包：

    x, y, z = (1, 2, 3)  # x=1, y=2, z=3

  • 忽略部分值：使用 _ 占位：

    x, _, z = (1, 2, 3)  # 忽略第二個值

  • 星號解包（Python 3.5+）：

    first, *middle, last = ("Alice", "Bob", "Carol", "Dave")  # middle=["Bob", "Carol"]

3. 實際應用範例

範例 1：函式返回多值

def analyze_file(filepath):  
    size = os.path.getsize(filepath)  
    mod_time = time.ctime(os.path.getmtime(filepath))  
    return size, mod_time  # 返回元組  

file_stats = analyze_file("data.txt")  # 接收元組  
print(f"Size: {file_stats[0]} bytes, Modified: {file_stats[1]}")

範例 2：固定結構資料

# 座標點（不可變，確保資料一致性）  
point = (3.5, 7.2)  
print(f"X: {point[0]}, Y: {point[1]}")  

# 資料庫記錄（如 SQLite 查詢結果）  
user_record = ("Alice", 28, "alice@example.com")

範例 3：字典鍵與配置常數

# 網路服務配置（不可變，避免執行時被修改）  
CONFIG = (  
    ("host", "127.0.0.1"),  
    ("port", 8080),  
    ("timeout", 30)  
)  

# 轉換為字典（需顯式轉換）  
config_dict = dict(CONFIG)

進階技巧與陷阱

1. 效能優勢

  • 記憶體與建構速度：元組比列表更輕量，適合大量靜態資料。 
    import sys  
print(sys.getsizeof((1, 2, 3)))    # 72 bytes（範例值）  
print(sys.getsizeof([1, 2, 3]))    # 88 bytes（範例值）

2. [可變元組]的陷阱

  • 元組僅保證頂層不可變，若元素為可變物件（如列表），其內容仍可修改： 
    mutable_tuple = ([1, 2], "immutable")  
mutable_tuple[0].append(3)  # 合法 → ([1, 2, 3], "immutable")

3. 與 namedtuple 的選擇

  • 需命名欄位時，可使用 collections.namedtuple： 
    from collections import namedtuple  
Person = namedtuple("Person", "name age email")  
alice = Person("Alice", 28, "alice@example.com")  
print(alice.name)  # "Alice"

練習題

  1. 座標距離計算：
    寫一個函式 distance(p1, p2)，計算兩個二維元組點 (x, y) 的歐幾里得距離。

    import math  
def distance(p1, p2):  
    return math.sqrt((p1[0] - p2[0])**2 + (p1[1] - p2[1])**2)

  2. 資料過濾：
    給定元組列表 [("Alice", 28), ("Bob", 19), ("Carol", 35)]，過濾出年齡大於 25 的記錄。

    people = [("Alice", 28), ("Bob", 19), ("Carol", 35)]  
filtered = [p for p in people if p[1] > 25]

  3. 字典鍵轉換：
    將字典 {"Alice": 28, "Bob": 19} 的鍵值對轉換為元組列表 [("Alice", 28), ("Bob", 19)]。

    data = {"Alice": 28, "Bob": 19}  
tuple_list = list(data.items())

需要進一步探討哪個主題？

  • A：元組與列表的底層實現差異（如 CPython 原始碼解析）；
  • B：更多 namedtuple 進階應用（如預設值、型別提示）；
  • C：實際案例（如 API 響應解析、多執行緒共享資料）的完整程式碼示範。
As we mentioned earlier, strings and lists are both examples of sequences. Strings are sequences of characters, and are immutable. Lists are sequences of elements of any data type, and are mutable. The third sequence type is the tuple. Tuples are like lists, since they can contain elements of any data type. But unlike lists, tuples are immutable. They’re specified using parentheses instead of square brackets. You might be wondering why tuples are a thing, given how similar they are to lists. Tuples can be useful when we need to ensure that an element is in a certain position and will not change. Since lists are mutable, the order of the elements can be changed on us. Since the order of the elements in a tuple can't be changed, the position of the element in a tuple can have meaning. A good example of this is when a function returns multiple values. In this case, what gets returned is a tuple, with the return values as elements in the tuple. The order of the returned values is important, and a tuple ensures that the order isn’t going to change. Storing the elements of a tuple in separate variables is called unpacking. This allows you to take multiple returned values from a function and store each value in its own variable.
deepseek-chat

以下是 Python 中 元组（Tuple） 的核心概念与使用场景的总结，以清晰的 Markdown 格式呈现：

Python 元组（Tuple）详解

1. 元组的基本特性

  • 不可变序列：一旦创建，内容无法修改（无 append、remove 等方法）。

  • 语法：用圆括号 () 表示，逗号是关键（括号可省略）。

    tuple1 = ("Alice", "B", "Chen")  # 标准写法  
tuple2 = "Alice", "B", "Chen"    # 省略括号（仍是元组）  
single_tuple = ("Only",)         # 单元素元组需加逗号

  • 与列表的对比：

    特性元组（Tuple）列表（List）
    可变性❌ 不可变✅ 可变
    语法() 或逗号分隔[]
    用途固定结构数据动态集合

2. 为什么需要元组？

  • 确保数据完整性：防止意外修改（如配置、常量）。
  • 作为字典的键：因元组不可变，可哈希（列表不行）。 
    valid_key = {("host", "port"): "service"}  # 合法  
invalid_key = {["host", "port"]: "service"}  # 报错
  • 函数多返回值：隐式返回元组，可直接解包。 
    def get_coordinates():  
    return 3.5, 7.2  # 返回元组 (3.5, 7.2)  

x, y = get_coordinates()  # 解包到变量

3. 元组的核心操作

  • 索引与切片（同列表）：

    name = ("Alice", "B", "Chen")  
print(name[0])    # "Alice"  
print(name[1:])   # ("B", "Chen")

  • 解包（Unpacking）：

    first, middle, last = name  # 解包到三个变量  
first, *rest = name         # 解包首元素，剩余部分存入 rest

  • 拼接与重复（生成新元组）：

    full_name = name + ("PhD",)  # ("Alice", "B", "Chen", "PhD")

4. 实际应用场景

场景 1：函数返回多值

def analyze_file(file):  
    size = os.path.getsize(file)  
    mod_time = time.ctime(os.path.getmtime(file))  
    return size, mod_time  # 返回元组  

size, time = analyze_file("data.txt")  # 直接解包

场景 2：固定结构数据

# 坐标点（不可变，确保数据安全）  
point = (3.5, 7.2)  
print(f"X: {point[0]}, Y: {point[1]}")  

# 数据库记录（如 SQL 查询结果）  
user = ("Alice", 28, "alice@example.com")

场景 3：配置常量

# 网络配置（不可变，避免运行时被修改）  
NETWORK_CONFIG = (  
    ("host", "127.0.0.1"),  
    ("port", 8080),  
    ("timeout", 30)  
)

5. 高级技巧

陷阱：元组的“可变性”

元组仅保证顶层不可变，若元素为可变对象（如列表），其内容仍可修改：

mixed_tuple = ([1, 2], "immutable")  
mixed_tuple[0].append(3)  # 合法 → ([1, 2, 3], "immutable")

替代方案：namedtuple

需命名字段时，使用 collections.namedtuple：

from collections import namedtuple  
Person = namedtuple("Person", "name age email")  
alice = Person("Alice", 28, "alice@example.com")  
print(alice.name)  # "Alice"

何时选择元组 vs 列表？

  • 用元组：

    • 数据需要保持固定（如配置、坐标、数据库记录）。
    • 作为字典的键或集合的元素。
    • 函数返回多个值。

  • 用列表：

    • 需要动态增删数据（如待办事项、缓存）。
    • 需要频繁修改内容。

通过理解元组的不可变性和固定结构特性，你可以更安全地处理数据，并写出更高效的代码！

>> When we looked at for loops, we said they iterate over a sequence of elements. One of the examples we checked out was iterating over a list. Let's take a little trip to the zoo to see this in action. Okay, so we will make a list of animals. So animals = and since we're making a list, we'll start with a bracket and we'll add lion, zebra, dolphin, and monkey and end the list with another bracket. Chars = 0 and we'll start a loop for animal in animals, two spaces chars += equals length of animals. Print total characters, average length.format chars chars/ length animals. Play video starting at :1:35 and follow transcript1:35 In this code, we're iterating over a list of strings. For each of the strings, we get its length and add it to the total amount of characters. At the end, we print the total and the average, which we get by dividing the total by the length of the list. You can see we're using the len function twice. Once to get the length of the string and then again to get the amount of elements in the list. What if you wanted to know the index of an element while going through the list? You could use the range function and then use indexing to access the elements at the index that range returned. Play video starting at :2:11 and follow transcript2:11 You could use a range function and then use indexing to access the elements at the index that range just returned. Or you could just use the enumerate function. Winners = we'll make a list Ashley, Dylan, and Reese and close the list. For index person in enumerate winners, print curly brackets-curly brackets.format index +1 person. The enumerate function returns a tuple for each element in the list. The first value in the tuple is the index of the element in the sequence. The second value in the tuple is the element in the sequence. Play video starting at :3:20 and follow transcript3:20 You're the real winner with the enumerate function, it does all the work for you. Pretty useful, right? Let's use all of this now to solve a slightly more interesting problem. Say you have a list of tuples containing two strings each. The first string is an email address, and the second is the full name of the person with that email address. You want to write a function that creates a new list containing one string per person, including their name and the email address between angled brackets, the format usually used in emails like this. So what do we need to do? Play video starting at :4:1 and follow transcript4:01 We'll start by defining a function that receives a list of people. Def full emails takes the argument people. Remember, people is a list of tuples where the first element is the email address and the second one is the full name. So in our function we'll first create the variable that we'll use as a return value, which will be a list and we'll call it result. Result = empty list. We'll then iterate over the list of people. We know this list contains tuples of two strings each, so we'll unpack the values directly when iterating in variables that we'll call email and name for email and name in people. Play video starting at :4:59 and follow transcript4:59 Now, our result variable is a list and it should contain strings, so we'll append the resulting string to the results list. Result append. The string that will append will be formatted in the way we want. To do that, we'll use the format method with the two variables of our iteration. So curly brackets, curly brackets.format, name and email. Once we're done with the iteration, we'll return the list, which should now contain all the necessary emails. Return result. Play video starting at :5:47 and follow transcript5:47 Will this work? What do you think? Let's try it out. Printfull alex@example.com Alex Diego. Shay@exxample.com is the email and we'll call Shay Brandt as the name. Yes, this worked as expected. Before we move on, a quick word of caution about some common errors when dealing with lists in Python. Play video starting at :6:40 and follow transcript6:40 Because we use the range function so much with for loops, you might be tempted to use it for iterating over indexes of a list and then to access the elements through indexing. You could be particularly inclined to do this if you're used to other programming languages before, because in some languages the only way to access an element of a list is by using indexes. Real talk this works, but looks ugly. It's more idiomatic in Python to iterate through the elements of the list directly or using enumerate when you need the indexes like we've done so far. There are some specific cases that do require us to iterate over the indexes. For example, when we're trying to modify the elements of the list, we're iterating. By the way, if you're iterating through a list and you want to modify it at the same time, you need to be very careful. Play video starting at :7:26 and follow transcript7:26 If you remove elements from the list while iterating, you're likely to end up with an unexpected result. In this case, it might be better to use a copy of the list instead. We've now seen a bunch of different things we can do with lists, and hopefully you're starting to see how they can be a very powerful tool in your IT specialist toolkit. Next up, we're going to learn a powerful technique for creating lists.
deepseek-chat

以下是根据提供的Python列表操作内容整理的总结，重点涵盖列表遍历、enumerate函数、元组解包和常见陷阱，并以Markdown格式呈现：

Python 列表遍历与操作指南

1. 基础列表遍历

示例：计算字符串列表中字符的总数和平均长度

animals = ["lion", "zebra", "dolphin", "monkey"]  
chars = 0  
for animal in animals:  
    chars += len(animal)  # 累加每个字符串的长度  
print(f"Total characters: {chars}, Average length: {chars/len(animals)}")
  • 关键点：
    • 使用 for item in list 直接遍历元素（无需索引）。
    • len() 函数既可用于字符串（字符数）也可用于列表（元素数）。

2. 使用 enumerate 获取索引

示例：打印带序号的获胜者名单

winners = ["Ashley", "Dylan", "Reese"]  
for index, person in enumerate(winners, start=1):  # start=1 让序号从1开始  
    print(f"{index}. {person}")
  • 输出： 
    1. Ashley  
2. Dylan  
3. Reese
  • enumerate 返回值：
    每个迭代返回一个元组 (index, element)，适合需要索引的场景。

3. 元组解包与字符串格式化

示例：将邮箱和姓名列表转换为标准邮件格式

def full_emails(people):  
    result = []  
    for email, name in people:  # 直接解包元组  
        result.append(f"{name} <{email}>")  
    return result  

# 测试  
print(full_emails([  
    ("alex@example.com", "Alex Diego"),  
    ("shay@example.com", "Shay Brandt")  
]))
  • 输出： 
    ['Alex Diego <alex@example.com>', 'Shay Brandt <shay@example.com>']
  • 关键技巧：
    • 直接在循环中解包元组：for email, name in people。
    • 使用 f-string 或 format() 方法组合字符串。

4. 常见陷阱与最佳实践

❌ 避免用 range(len()) 遍历列表（除非必要）

# 不推荐（除非需要修改元素）  
for i in range(len(my_list)):  
    print(my_list[i])  

# 推荐方式  
for item in my_list:  
    print(item)

⚠️ 不要在遍历时直接修改列表

# 错误示例：可能跳过元素或越界  
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4]  
for num in numbers:  
    if num % 2 == 0:  
        numbers.remove(num)  # 危险！  

# 正确做法：创建新列表或反向遍历  
numbers = [num for num in numbers if num % 2 != 0]  # 列表生成式

✅ 需要修改元素时使用索引

# 修改元素时可用索引  
for i in range(len(numbers)):  
    numbers[i] *= 2  # 合法且安全

5. 实际应用场景

场景1：处理嵌套结构

users = [  
    ("alex@example.com", "Alex", ["Admin", "Dev"]),  
    ("shay@example.com", "Shay", ["User"])  
]  
for email, name, roles in users:  
    print(f"{name} ({email}): {', '.join(roles)}")

场景2：结合 zip 并行遍历多个列表

names = ["Alice", "Bob"]  
scores = [85, 92]  
for name, score in zip(names, scores):  
    print(f"{name}: {score}")

附：列表操作速查表

操作方法/语法说明
直接遍历元素for x in list无需索引时首选
遍历索引和元素for i, x in enumerate(list)需要索引时使用
安全修改元素for i in range(len(list))修改元素时需用索引
过滤元素列表生成式[x for x in list if x > 0]

如果需要更深入探讨特定场景（如大数据量下的性能优化或复杂数据结构处理），请进一步说明！

- Welcome back. The first time we talked about list comprehensions, we showed you how to create a list using a for loop. Then we showed you how to create that same list using a list comprehension. If you're anything like me, you're probably wondering why there are two ways to do the same thing. So how do you know which one to use? In this video, we're going to talk about when to use a for loop and when to use a list comprehension. But first, a quick review. Play video starting at ::27 and follow transcript0:27 We said a for loop iterates, or repeats over a sequence of values like numbers, letters, and so on. A list comprehension lets us create new lists based on sequences or ranges. It's basically a shorthand way to build a new list based on the contents of an existing list. The list comprehension has the for loop, the compilation, and builds the list all in a single line of code. List comprehensions and for loops both do the same thing, so when should you use which one? The short answer is it's your call. Both methods are essentially interchangeable so there are no standards or best practices. Play video starting at :1:7 and follow transcript1:07 Deciding when to use a list comprehension instead of a for loop or vice versa is totally up to you. That said, there are considerations that many programmers make when deciding whether to use a list comprehension or a for loop. Programmers tend to use a list comprehension when it's fairly simple code, such as filtering a list to pull out items that match or capitalizing words in a list. If it can fit on a single line, I'd probably make it a list comprehension which you can see in this example. For more complex code, it's usually a good idea to use a for loop. A for loop spells out the process better which will make it easier for you and other programmers to read and maintain the code you write. For example, let's say you're working for a company that maintains a list of invoices. Play video starting at :1:53 and follow transcript1:53 You need to calculate the sales tax and balance due for all the items on the list. You wanna start with updating the status of past due invoices. You could accomplish this with a list comprehension but it would be complicated and likely confusing to read and understand. Let's go over an example of what the list comprehension would look like for updating the status of past due invoices. In this code, we create a list called Past Due that contains all of the invoices in the invoices list that are more than 30 days old and have not yet been paid. I is used in the list comprehension to iterate over the invoices list. Then for J in past due iterates over the past due list and sets the status of each invoice to past due. Play video starting at :2:43 and follow transcript2:43 J is used in the for loop to iterate over the past due list. In this case, a for loop would be preferable because it clearly lays out all the steps the code is going through so other programmers can read and understand it quickly. Here's an example of what that looks like. This for loop iterates over the invoices list and sets the attribute of each invoice to past due if the invoice is more than 30 days old and has not been paid yet. This code will have the same result as the list comprehension we just went over but it's more straightforward. This makes it easier to code and understand. So let's loop back to the question we asked earlier. Play video starting at :3:23 and follow transcript3:23 When should you use a for loop and when should you use a list comprehension? Here are some questions to ask yourself to guide your decision. Which one will make my code both clear and concise and which one will make my code easier for other people to read and understand? It's important to keep in mind that most developers like their code short, sweet, and to the point. Finally, remember that whatever code writing strategy you choose, use meaningful names for all your variables, data sets and lists. Always assume others will see your code. And now that you're armed with the information to make the best decisions, you can continue building your knowledge and skills as you dive deeper into Python.
deepseek-chat

以下是根据提供的Python列表操作内容整理的总结，重点涵盖列表遍历、enumerate函数、元组解包和常见陷阱，并以Markdown格式呈现：

Python 列表遍历与操作指南

1. 基础列表遍历

示例：计算字符串列表中字符的总数和平均长度

animals = ["lion", "zebra", "dolphin", "monkey"]  
chars = 0  
for animal in animals:  
    chars += len(animal)  # 累加每个字符串的长度  
print(f"Total characters: {chars}, Average length: {chars/len(animals)}")
  • 关键点：
    • 使用 for item in list 直接遍历元素（无需索引）。
    • len() 函数既可用于字符串（字符数）也可用于列表（元素数）。

2. 使用 enumerate 获取索引

示例：打印带序号的获胜者名单

winners = ["Ashley", "Dylan", "Reese"]  
for index, person in enumerate(winners, start=1):  # start=1 让序号从1开始  
    print(f"{index}. {person}")
  • 输出： 
    1. Ashley  
2. Dylan  
3. Reese
  • enumerate 返回值：
    每个迭代返回一个元组 (index, element)，适合需要索引的场景。

3. 元组解包与字符串格式化

示例：将邮箱和姓名列表转换为标准邮件格式

def full_emails(people):  
    result = []  
    for email, name in people:  # 直接解包元组  
        result.append(f"{name} <{email}>")  
    return result  

# 测试  
print(full_emails([  
    ("alex@example.com", "Alex Diego"),  
    ("shay@example.com", "Shay Brandt")  
]))
  • 输出： 
    ['Alex Diego <alex@example.com>', 'Shay Brandt <shay@example.com>']
  • 关键技巧：
    • 直接在循环中解包元组：for email, name in people。
    • 使用 f-string 或 format() 方法组合字符串。

4. 常见陷阱与最佳实践

❌ 避免用 range(len()) 遍历列表（除非必要）

# 不推荐（除非需要修改元素）  
for i in range(len(my_list)):  
    print(my_list[i])  

# 推荐方式  
for item in my_list:  
    print(item)

⚠️ 不要在遍历时直接修改列表

# 错误示例：可能跳过元素或越界  
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4]  
for num in numbers:  
    if num % 2 == 0:  
        numbers.remove(num)  # 危险！  

# 正确做法：创建新列表或反向遍历  
numbers = [num for num in numbers if num % 2 != 0]  # 列表生成式

✅ 需要修改元素时使用索引

# 修改元素时可用索引  
for i in range(len(numbers)):  
    numbers[i] *= 2  # 合法且安全

5. 实际应用场景

场景1：处理嵌套结构

users = [  
    ("alex@example.com", "Alex", ["Admin", "Dev"]),  
    ("shay@example.com", "Shay", ["User"])  
]  
for email, name, roles in users:  
    print(f"{name} ({email}): {', '.join(roles)}")

场景2：结合 zip 并行遍历多个列表

names = ["Alice", "Bob"]  
scores = [85, 92]  
for name, score in zip(names, scores):  
    print(f"{name}: {score}")

附：列表操作速查表

操作方法/语法说明
直接遍历元素for x in list无需索引时首选
遍历索引和元素for i, x in enumerate(list)需要索引时使用
安全修改元素for i in range(len(list))修改元素时需用索引
过滤元素列表生成式[x for x in list if x > 0]

如果需要更深入探讨特定场景（如大数据量下的性能优化或复杂数据结构处理），请进一步说明！

We're almost done with our deep dive into Python list, but before we continue to our next data structure, let's talk about creating lists in a shorter way. Say we wanted to create a list with multiples of seven from 7-70, we could do it like this. We create a list called multiples. Then for x in range 1-11, multiples.append x*7. Print multiples. This works fine and is a good way of solving it, but because creating lists based on sequences is such a common task, Python provides a technique called list comprehension that lets us do it in just one line. This is how we would do the same with list comprehension. Play video starting at :1:4 and follow transcript1:04 Multiples equals, we'll start the list, x*7 for x in range 1-11 and close the list. Print multiples. It should be the same. List comprehensions let us create new lists based on sequences or ranges. We can use this technique whenever we want to create a list based on a range, like in this example, or based on the contents of a list, a tuple, a string, or any other Python sequence. The syntax tries to copy how you would express these concepts with natural language, although it can still be confusing sometimes. Let's check out a different example. Play video starting at :1:53 and follow transcript1:53 Say we have a list of strings with the names of programming languages like this one, and we want to generate a list of the lengths of the strings. We could iterate over the list and add them using append like we did before, or we could use a list comprehension, like this, lengths = [len(language) for language in languages]. Print lengths. List comprehensions also let us use a conditional clause. Say we wanted all the numbers that are divisible by three between zero and 100. We could create a list like this, z equals open list, x for x in range 1-101 if x modulo 3 = 0. Print z. In this case, we just want the element x to be part of the list, but we only want the numbers where the remainder of the division by three is zero, so we add the conditional clause after the range. Play video starting at :3:17 and follow transcript3:17 Using list comprehensions when programming in Python is totally optional. Sometimes it can make the code look nicer and more readable. At other times, it can have the opposite effect, especially if we try to pack too much information together. In general, it's a good idea to know that list comprehensions exist, especially when you're trying to understand someone else's code. We've now seen a bunch of different methods we can use to operate with lists and tuples, and Python provides even more of them that we didn't get to talk about. In our next reading, you'll find a list of the most common operations and links to the official documentation in case you want to learn more. After the reading, you can practice your new skills in the next quiz.
deepseek-chat

以下是根据提供的Python列表操作内容整理的总结，重点涵盖列表遍历、enumerate函数、元组解包和常见陷阱，并以Markdown格式呈现：

Python 列表遍历与操作指南

1. 基础列表遍历

示例：计算字符串列表中字符的总数和平均长度

animals = ["lion", "zebra", "dolphin", "monkey"]  
chars = 0  
for animal in animals:  
    chars += len(animal)  # 累加每个字符串的长度  
print(f"Total characters: {chars}, Average length: {chars/len(animals)}")
  • 关键点：
    • 使用 for item in list 直接遍历元素（无需索引）。
    • len() 函数既可用于字符串（字符数）也可用于列表（元素数）。

2. 使用 enumerate 获取索引

示例：打印带序号的获胜者名单

winners = ["Ashley", "Dylan", "Reese"]  
for index, person in enumerate(winners, start=1):  # start=1 让序号从1开始  
    print(f"{index}. {person}")
  • 输出： 
    1. Ashley  
2. Dylan  
3. Reese
  • enumerate 返回值：
    每个迭代返回一个元组 (index, element)，适合需要索引的场景。

3. 元组解包与字符串格式化

示例：将邮箱和姓名列表转换为标准邮件格式

def full_emails(people):  
    result = []  
    for email, name in people:  # 直接解包元组  
        result.append(f"{name} <{email}>")  
    return result  

# 测试  
print(full_emails([  
    ("alex@example.com", "Alex Diego"),  
    ("shay@example.com", "Shay Brandt")  
]))
  • 输出： 
    ['Alex Diego <alex@example.com>', 'Shay Brandt <shay@example.com>']
  • 关键技巧：
    • 直接在循环中解包元组：for email, name in people。
    • 使用 f-string 或 format() 方法组合字符串。

4. 常见陷阱与最佳实践

❌ 避免用 range(len()) 遍历列表（除非必要）

# 不推荐（除非需要修改元素）  
for i in range(len(my_list)):  
    print(my_list[i])  

# 推荐方式  
for item in my_list:  
    print(item)

⚠️ 不要在遍历时直接修改列表

# 错误示例：可能跳过元素或越界  
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4]  
for num in numbers:  
    if num % 2 == 0:  
        numbers.remove(num)  # 危险！  

# 正确做法：创建新列表或反向遍历  
numbers = [num for num in numbers if num % 2 != 0]  # 列表生成式

✅ 需要修改元素时使用索引

# 修改元素时可用索引  
for i in range(len(numbers)):  
    numbers[i] *= 2  # 合法且安全

5. 实际应用场景

场景1：处理嵌套结构

users = [  
    ("alex@example.com", "Alex", ["Admin", "Dev"]),  
    ("shay@example.com", "Shay", ["User"])

for email, name, roles in users:  
    print(f"{name} ({email}): {', '.join(roles)}")

场景2：结合 zip 并行遍历多个列表

    print(f"{name}: {score}")

遍历索引和元素for i, x in enumerate(list)需要索引时使用
安全修改元素for i in range(len(list))修改元素时需用索引
